managementResponses.response: We are sorry to hear you were unhappy with your stay.  Being in a central location does have its ups and downs and we understand this is not suited for everyone.  We value your feedback and wish you had a more enjoyable stay.  Thanks again.

review.title: Bad Experience
review.reviewText: We had the worst experience at this hotel & wanted to leave from the moment we arrived. Rooms are tiny & not soundproof from street noise so we got no sleep. Definitely more a backpackers 1 or 2 star property.
review.negativeRemarks: Most things, air con would be a good idea & sound proof the windows/rooms from street noise. Do more to move guests when they're unhappy.
review.locationRemarks: Located on a noisy street with cable cars running all the time.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: One of the more affordable Union Square hotel rooms but the room was barely larger than the double bed in it, hard to even walk around. Also our walls were covered in a good layer of dust, and it was not a very comfortable bed. Fine for one night on a budget, like us, but not for an extended stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We apologize your stay was less than excellent.  We understand that being in such a central location can create some unwanted noise and are sorry if you were not expecting this.  We do offer ear plugs and assistance with white noise to help make your stay more comfortable.  We appreciate your feedback and can assure you we strive to offer every guest a wonderful stay.  We will review these comments with our team to help us improve.  Thank you again.

review.title: Don't Stay Here!
review.reviewText:
Unhelpful staff, bad neighbourhood, door wouldn't lock, too many stairs, trams too noisy, windows not double glazed, wouldn't refund when we wanted to leave, not enough room to swing a cat in.

DO NOT STAY HERE!
review.negativeRemarks: Too much to list
review.locationRemarks: Noisy & lots of homeless people, someone even tried to get into our room.

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: The hotel amenities were satisfying and the hotel had recent renovations which made the stay comforting.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel room could use a thorough cleaning in which there were dust collected behind the headboards and the lights on the lamp next to the bed.
review.locationRemarks: location is ideal as it's a block away from Union Square and a block away from the beginning of the cable car routes.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our lobby and wine hour.  I apologize however if you were uncomfortable with the room temperature, I will share this with my team to help us improve in the future.  Thank you again,

review.title: Never staying here again
review.reviewText:
At first in the lobby, it seems very nice, the hall ways leading to the room are cool and retro looking. But walking in felt like I was going into a sauna. There was NO air conditioning. Like how out dated can a hotel be to not put in an air conditioning unit?! And up on the bed board was a thick layer of dust. The carpet looked a little torn up to. Plus their parking was $55!!

The only good thing was that they were nice and there was complimentary wine from 5-6. 

Not a comfortable stay though, very disappointed.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to share your stay with us.  We are sorry to hear your visit was less than excellent.  I can assure you we strive to offer friendly customer service and I apologize this was not what you experienced.  We will review this feedback with our team to help us improve.  Thank you again.

review.title: Nice, but....
review.reviewText: I got delayed in SF and chose this hotel because of the discount on expedia. The hotel has all of the trappings of a nice place, but the hotel staff was rude, the room was super tiny, there were not enough towels, and the carpets were all pretty gross.  I was also traveling with a dog. They charge a $50 fee, which is okay, but they insist on an inspection of the room before you leave, so you are at there mercy whether you have a good dog or not.

review.title: Nice historical hotel from 1913
review.reviewText:
The hotel is excellently located in the heart of union square right next to the cable train and BART subway system. The hotel rooms are small and not modernized but the price is fair for what you are paying for. 

We found the front desk very friendly, checkin/our was fast and accommodating. We had some issues with out room and they were able to quickly resolve the issue and moved us to a different room.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our location and proximity to union square.  I will share the feedback about wanting team service in the rooms with our team.  We hope to see you again in the future.

review.title: Great buzzy location but otherwise disappointing
review.reviewText: Rooms are small and really not terribly well equipped - no bar fridge, no kettle (just a coffee maker), and no TEABAGS!!
review.positiveRemarks: Location so close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Supply of teabags in each room, a bar fridge, and supply of a small quantity of milk to be able to make tea or coffee in the mornings.
review.locationRemarks: Really good location for shopping, tourist buses which leave from Union Square, and also really convenient for the cable car.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the comments on your recent stay.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed our location however I apologize if the rest of your visit was less than excellent.  We appreciate you taking the time to review us.

review.title: Find a different hotel
review.reviewText: The room was ridiculously small,  the bathroom was so small it was a joke,  and the bed was like a roll up 4" mattress on an Ikea frame.  Really awful. Staff was ok but not great. The only positive was the location. Do yourself a favor and find a different hotel.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing this with us.  We are pleased you found our location excellent and staff nice.  I am sorry however if you were unsatisfied with your room.  I will review this feedback with the team to help us improve in the future.

review.title: The "urban" room is misleading in all sense
review.reviewText:
The "urban" room is misleading in all sense: small room, old, with a window facing a wall.
It was a total disappointment from what I did saw on the website.
The location is superb, so it's really too bad the room experience is that bad!
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, even if nothing was done to improve my disappointment, it did feel I am not the first who feels that way
review.negativeRemarks: clearly display how the urban room looks like, or even close them for guest...
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Tiny but nice
review.reviewText: A good central location but beware this part of SF is expensive. You can walk to the harvest, take the cable car or get the tram. Literally a 2 minute walk from BART so only $8.95 to get to / from the airport. So overall pricey but good location

review.title: I loved the style and location
review.reviewText: Got our booking wrong and didn't have the right room but did discount it.

review.title: Our 1st Anniversary
review.reviewText:
We were warmly welcomed and it just got better. Harvey and Ruben made our stay so much more enjoyable than we anticipated! Harvey was very accommodating and generous being that it was our 1year anniversary. Ruben, who recommended great places to eat and was extremely kind and hospitable made both my husband and I feel right at home, like family! 
  We loved our Sleep and Soak Room, and sleep and soak we did. The room was cozy, sexy and romantic, perfect for celebrating our first year of marriage! 
 The easy access to trolly carts and buses made our daily adventures in San Francisco a breeze. We didn't take advantage of the night life scene, but if that's your cup of tea Harvey would gladly recommend all the Hotspots! 
 To sum it up we loved our stay at Hotel Union Square!  -(the love birds in room 623)

review.title: Awesome Hotel.... Awesome Staff...
review.reviewText: I just relocated to San Francisco and spent my first night in the city at The Hotel Union Square. I enjoyed the hotel so much I extended my stay for a week. The hotel offers many superlatives but I was most impressed with "the staff" as they were friendly and went out of their way to assist me with everything from directions to recommending future living accommodations. I would also give high marks to the hotel's free evening wine hour and gym access. Kudos and many thanks to the staff for making my first week and stay in San Francisco a pleasant one!

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the feedback.  We apologize your visit was less than excellent.  We value your feedback and appreciate you taking the time to let us know.

review.title: Chintzy hotel - terrible place to stay!
review.reviewText:
The room door would not lock from inside as it was a fire escape with the stairs outside the window. Room 328. 
The only room left was an inside room, no window. It was really an awful chintzy hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Who cares? It's a terrible place to stay.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for sharing this unfortunate experience with us.  We are very sorry you were unsatisfied and not able to stay at our property.  I can assure you this is not the check in experience we strive to offer our guests.  Thank you for taking the time to let us know.  We will review this feedback with the team.

review.title: Left hotwl
review.reviewText: I went to the room they assigned me- the room's deadbolt on the door was broken. So I went down to the front desk to let them know and request a different room- they already knew about the broken door lock and was either hoping I didn't notice or didn't care! Upon my frustration and complaining, they switched my room. This second room had dirty sheet and shower. So after this I was so appalled that I just told them to cancel my reservation and I was leaving. I found a Marriott next door and stayed there. This hotel is such a rip off.

review.title: Very nice, nothing mind blowing.
review.reviewText:
Nothing was terrible, but nothing was incredibly amazing either. The window looked out onto a wall in a tiny area with other walls and windows; can't call it a courtyard because it was too small and can't be accessed. Gave the room a dark claustrophobic feel. 

But otherwise it was adequate, quite nice.
Very helpful and knowledgeable staff. Answered all of the questions we had.

review.title: Good location, bad conditions
review.reviewText: Good location, rooms too small, not what You see in the pictures on the internet, there is no restaurant in the hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel was in the perfect location to be able to walk around and explore the city. Very clean and nice hotel. Will stay here again

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to review us.  We are sorry to hear your stay was less than excellent.  We value your feedback and appreciate you letting us know.

review.title: Room was no larger than a closet!
review.reviewText: Room no larger than a closet, uncomfortably small, no clock radio, only one side lamp, noisy (I could hear TV noise from next room.  Getting to room was difficult, had to climb extra set of stairs, dark hallways and no privacy.  Way overpriced!  I would not stay there again or ever recommend it to anyone!
review.positiveRemarks: The lemon water they offered at the front door, that is about it
review.negativeRemarks: The price!
review.locationRemarks: That was the only benefit, close to Union Square.

review.title: Near all the Union Square Shopping
review.reviewText: Great proximity to the Retail District around Union Square and only 2 blocks from the Powell Metro. We had a great time shopping and museum going all within walking distance of the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The gave us a free upgrade to the Penthouse Suite; great views from the 6th floor! Hotel is older but tastefully remodeled.

review.title: Extremely friendly, helpful & accommodating staff
review.reviewText: I last visited San Francisco when I was only 11 years old so this was like a first visit. From check-in to check-out, the staff helped us navigate food, activities, and where to go, how to get there, and what to do. They always had a map handy which was extremely helpful. Surprisingly quiet given the proximity to the cable cars which are loud.  We are excited to return.

review.title: The hotel was good - nice fit out etc
review.reviewText: There were parts that were very dated, but overall a pretty good experience

managementResponses.response:
Dear Julio,
Thank you, thank you, thank you!
We hope that you will be back soon.
Best regards,

review.title: nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: location good , staff was nice , rooms were kinda small but really i was only using room to sleep i was gone pretty much all day , i would recommend this hotel to anyone

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for your comment. I can't express how disappointed I am by the level of service that was offered to you. I have already have a talk with the Front Desk staff so that  this kind of thing doesn't happen anymore. I want to apologize for the inconvenience. Thank you very much for sharing it with me.
I hope that you will consider staying wit us again and witness improvement by yourself.
Best regards

review.title: This is a great location for visiting SF.
review.reviewText: The understaffed front desk make check in and check out a lengthy process.  The room was tiny with a window facing another window approximately a foot away.  I arrived early and walked up to the desk.  "Can I help you?."  When I told her I was here to check in... "Check in is at three pm."  Blank look.  Can I check my bag and come back?  "Over there."  I also called a couple of hours later just to ask if the room was ready.  There was no room ready and he took my number to text me when it was available.  I arrived around 5 pm obviously without a text to check in.  Then I went to the bell clerk to get my bags to take them to a tiny room with a view of the tiny room about a foot away from the window.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is excellent. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything else.
review.locationRemarks: Union square.  Great location.  Close to everything.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Johanna,

Thank you very much for the 5 stars review and for choosing to stay with us. We loved that you loved your stay with us and we are looking forward to having you back soon.
Best regards,

review.title: Great location, nice rooms, comfortable, convenien
review.reviewText:
Loved it!
Will definitely stay again. 
Staff very friendly & accomodating.
Historic SF hotel.
Close to work area.
Good location.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

I am sorry to read that you chose not to stay with us. I hope that we could have accommodated your needs. Thank you for taking the time to leave a review.

review.reviewText: I left after 5 minutes- creepy. Felt unsafe and the lock on the door did not work. Very dirty too and dusty.

managementResponses.response:

Looking forward to having you back once again.
Best regards

review.title: Luxurious boutique hotel in the heart of SF.
review.reviewText: Luxurious decor and ambiance. We enjoyed wine hour in the lobby with live music to kick off our evening. Steps away from the heart of Union Square shopping. We jumped on a cable car right outside the hotel and rode down to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner. Every time I go to the city I for work I try a new place but this place was so great that I will be sticking with them.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for the review. I am sorry to hear that you encountered a rude staff member. We do offer larger rooms at a little more of a cost. We hope to see you with us again soon.

Warm Regards,

review.title: Old building, but modern interiors
review.reviewText: Stayed at probably the smallest and cheapest room.  Windows, but no outside light coming through.  Interiors and fixtures are modern.  Only one lady staff on the phone was rude, but other staff were all polite and professional.  Right in the middle of the downtown.  I don't mind staying there again.

managementResponses.response:
Hello Anonymous,

Thank you for taking the time to review our property. I am sorry to hear that you will not be staying with us in the future because of our "hidden fees"
The 15.00 fee should have been on your confirmation at the time of your booking. All fees are displayed. There is a fee for parking which is normal for most metropolitan cities. We also display any fee that you might incur at the front desk. Parking and Facitility fee are displayed in our lobby.
 Best Regards

review.title: Fees
review.reviewText: The hidden fees are not acceptable and they do a very poor job of telling you as well. You pay a 45$ overnight parking fee as well as a 15$ for wifi,1 water bottle and "wine" that most customers do not care for. I will never stay there again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Rose,
Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us and for your review. I am sincerely sorry to read that your stay with us was such a disappointment, I wish we could have found a solution for you at the time.
Thanks you for your comments they will help us improve.
Best regards

review.title: very poorly managed.
review.reviewText: The hotel needs improvement need new chairs and more light.  Terrible experience Unable to access internet.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything! from lighting to furniture.  I can't believed the give us chair that is completely ruin leather pulling off.
review.locationRemarks: the location nearby is ok.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for your comment and for staying with us. I am sorry you were inconvenienced by the smell in the building.
Thanks for letting us know we will look into it.
We hope that you will be back soon.
Best regards

review.title: Great beds, quiet room, needs to be aired out.
review.reviewText:
A reasonable alternative just off Union Square; friendly & effective front desk.  

Unfortunately the entire 6th floor had a strong musty odor.  It diminished in our room, but was still strong enough that I was concerned that my clothes would smell the next day.  It's hard to imagine that staff and others would not be troubled by it.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thanks a lot for this 4 stars review. We ar glad you had a good stay with us.

review.reviewText: Fast check in, friendly staff, nicely decorated lobby

review.title: Great price and location
review.reviewText: Beds were comfortable.  Very clean.  In the middle of the shopping district.   Would definitely stay here again.  Minor negatives:  no mini fridge, only one ice machine in hotel.

review.reviewText: The whole building needs a whole renovation. There's a smell in the washroom probably lack of exhaust and the cold faucet is not working.

review.title: Loud
review.reviewText: It was loud from other room at midnight. That's terrible

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

review.title: Nice hotel. Centrally located.
review.reviewText: Had a great stay. Hotel was located right in the heart of the shopping district and within easy walking access.

managementResponses.response:
Dear John,

Thanks you very much for your review and for sharing your thoughts with us. I am sorry that your room wasn't to your liking. It is true that our standard rooms are on the smaller side, maybe a Premium King would have better suited your needs. We try to advertise our $15 per day facility fee as much as we can, it also includes wine hour from 5pm-6pm with live music, access to tablets, printer and fax, free local calls and discounts. I wish you didn't feel it was a hidden fee.
Best regards

review.title: "Boutique" city centre hotel.
review.reviewText: I was infuriated to be told when checking in that, in addition to the quoted daily rate, we were required to pay a mandatory additional "Facilities Fee" of $15 per night. The hotel attempted to justify this by saying that it was to pay for wifi access, and one small bottle of water each day (to be shared by the two of us). Sharp practice, and scandalous.
review.negativeRemarks: Is the term "boutique hotel" a euphemism for small (that the room, and all of the facilities, will be cramped)? Too small for comfort.
review.locationRemarks: Central San Francisco, so all the city attractions are easily accessible.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for your comment and for choosing to stay with us. We love that you think of us as perfect and convenient.
We hope that we will have the pleasure to have you back soon.
Best regards

review.reviewText: It was perfect and convenient. Union square is the heart of SF and although I've been there many times, this time was probably the best because it was close to where I had a business meeting and also showing SF around to my love.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Michelle,
Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to write a review about your stay.
I wish you had enjoyed it more, I am sincerely sorry for the hot water inconvenience, the problem was more serious than expected and took longer than we wished to be resolved. Thank you very much for your patience and for your kind words for Ruben,
I hope that you might give us another chance and stay with us again in the future.
Best regards,

review.title: Great location, room not so great
review.reviewText: GREAT location, near shopping & transportation. The room didn't match the online pics. It was very small, there was stool and not a chair, and the hot water went out. They proactively let us know about the hot water issue but didnt communicate when it would be fixed. We had to repeatedly ask for extra towels, when housekeeping knew there were 3 in the room. The phone headset didn't work. We were disappointed in the room. concierge Ruben was great, very helpful and the guy who worked at night.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Patati,

Thank you for your review and for choosing to stay with us. I am glad that you enjoyed your time with us and that the staff played a big role in it.
Looking forward to having you back soon.
Best regards

review.title: Great staff and awesome location!
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful at all times.  Location was the best!!  Room was small had a heater by side of bed quite cumbersome.  It was unseasonably warm in San Francisco and the ac was not cooling. Requested a fan that was bought up immediately that helped.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest ,

review.reviewText: Very stylish hotel fit for 2 right in the bustling city within steps of union square shopping and some great restaurants and bars.  Minimal amenities, but reflected in the price.  We enjoyed the room while we were in it!

review.title: Nice hotel expensive parking
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing. The hotel was interesting very artistic. The parking being so expensive is a reason why I wouldn't stay again

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Does "Boutique Hotel" mean musty?
review.reviewText: Close to transit, shopping, restaurants. Room smelled musty, needed to buy air freshener. Window overlooked central courtyard. Quiet for a downtown hotel. Only one working ice machine inconveniently located on the 6th floor. Boiler was out of order for half a day -- no hot water. Staff was professional, helpful and courteous.

The afternoon wine reception was less than welcoming -- ran out of wine glasses and the singer was worse than Phoebe Bufay and not entertaining at all.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean -- deep clean -- the bathroom - have a chair in the room to sit on.
review.locationRemarks: Great for shopping and fantastic restaurants!

review.positiveRemarks: Price was very competitive and location.

review.title: Not quite up to par
review.reviewText: While the hotel is trendy and cool looking, it is a tiny hotel with claustrophobic rooms.  I was disappointed to find a lot of mold in the shower (at eye level in the grout) and the room was not very clean.  The room had no air conditioning and I had to prop open the window to let in some air.  Unfortunately, the trolleys run right outside the hotel and the sound of the trolleys and drunk people kept us awake all night.  The blinds on the windows didn't block a lot of outside light, so the room was lit up all night as well.  I was extremely upset to learn of the $45 per night, per vehicle parking fee.  Wish Expedia would have disclosed that on their website.
review.positiveRemarks: I can not think of anything that I really liked other than it was trendy.  Nothing differentiates it from other hotels in the same price range.
review.locationRemarks: The location is ideal.  Lots of great restaurants, bars, and shopping within walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Gogglz Paesano,
Thank you very much for this very sweet review.
We did have some hot water issues at the beginning of the month but it's all taken care of. Sorry for the inconvenience.
We hope that you will be back soon.
Best regards,

review.title: Conveniently Located
review.reviewText:
Hotel conveniently located in downtown SF!  Situated along Powell Street, it is closely located to the cable cars and surrounded by retail shops.  Getting to the wharf area is super easy since it is along the cable car route and the staging area is fortunately located 1 block away.  

Please understand that this boutique hotel is NOT adjacent to Union Square, but however, it is closely located 2 blocks away so no big deal!  I truly enjoyed the charming features of this older hotel and it is a nice balance of old and new!

Staff was super friendly and helpful.  They do serve complimentary wine in the lobby area from 5-6 pm, so what a perfect way to just wind down after having a busy day touring the city...  Nice touch guys!
review.positiveRemarks: Very Charming, an older hotel with upgraded modern features!
review.negativeRemarks: If you are showering late and if it was a cold way, the hot water seems to be very limited.

photos.caption: Did they drag this chair up from the basement?

managementResponses.response:
Hi Vanessa,

i would like to offer my sincere appologies for the lack of hot water. We have corrected that issue and we have ordered new chairs. We do appreciate the photographs.
Best Regards,
Charles

review.title: It's ok in a pinch
review.reviewText: I stay in SF regularly for work and booked here because my regular hotel was full. The hotel is conveniently located about a block from the Powell station and the room was clean. The view out of my window was pretty cool too. Saturday night was very noisy, but the remaining three nights I stayed here were relatively quiet (for being on a busy street). My only complaints were that I didn't get to have a hot shower my entire stay (water never warmed up, despite me running the tap for upwards of 15 minutes), and the sorry state of the office chair in my room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Haley,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for your review.

review.title: Overall good
review.reviewText: Hotel is old but charming. Rooms are redone and clean. Very small room and bathroom. The beds are comfortable and the location is amazing - right in the middle of union square.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for your comment, thank you as well for letting us know about the issues you had, they have been corrected.

review.reviewText: Decent hotel but rooms are very small. No AC and window wouldn't stay open. For business travel, may want to consider other options or more than the most basic room at this place.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

review.title: Great location however..
review.reviewText: This is a boutique hotel so the rooms are the size of a sardine can. They don't include a safe. There is a closet but there is no light. No couch. The website says there is a gym but in reality it is 6 blocks away. If you decide to stay here, make sure you are okay with having zero space to pass by whoever you are travelling with.You will be breathing down each others necks.  (We stayed in a queen room). The size of the washroom isn't bad however, there is no shelf space. There is only one tiny shelf above the toilet so my stuff fell into the toilet a few times. There is also a tiny window sill but I didn't bother putting my things there as they would've fallen out the window. The only space to place your things in the room is on the desk or the night table. This was not suffice for 2 people staying for 6 nights.

The bathroom was small but fine for one person.  The room was dark since the window faced into a fire escape and an alley.  The hallways in the hotel are also a little dim for my taste.  Otherwise it was fine.  I would stay there again for a short stay (1-2 days), or for a longer stay in a better room.

We were able to check in to a room at the Expedia rate, and later the manager took our reservation info. and cleared up that matter completely himself and was apologetic over the confusion.  Other than having to adjust to the slanty floors, our room was clean and nicely decorated.  We missed having a clock and a mini fridge, but all the other regular amenities were there, and replenished as needed. Our room had plenty of conveniently-located electrical outlets, which was a nice surprise for an older building. "Wine Hour" with live music at 5 in the lobby is a nice, friendly touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for public transportation to anywhere in SF.  Very friendly, helpful staff.

review.title: The hotel had cool vibes but our room sucked
review.reviewText:
I liked that it was a boutique hotel, room and lobby were decorated nicely and had a nice feel to them. Hotel was also in a fantastic location right near union square (obv) and the start of the cable car line. However we had an internal room with no window or view. We didn't mind missing out on the view, however the only way to get fresh air was to turn on the EXTREMELY loud aircon unit. We could hardly sleep because of the noise but needed it on overnight, otherwise it was way too hot and stuffy. The ceiling fan was too slow to make any difference. Also the shower curtain was designed so badly, you couldn't bring the curtain all the way around to the shower head side (to keep water in the bath / shower area) without being exposed on the other side to the main part of the room (I.e. Bed / roommate). Hard to explain, you probably have to see it but in other words, the curtain didn't cover the whole bath. Either water got out or you were in full view of the rest of the room. 

Staff were nice enough and tried to be helpful however there was a small incident where we had to call / go down to the lobby 3 times requesting a new tv remote (was missing when we checked in) before it was brought to our room. 

If we had a room on the outer section of the building, this review may be a lot better. Either request an outer room or stay somewhere else.

Lingering smell, ok whatever that's fine, but this smell was so strong it was like someone was actively smoking at all hours. Also, we extended our checkout from 12 to 1230, had the privacy please sign on our door, yet around 1130 housekeeping came in to clean the room. Seriously? What's the point of the sign! Even though it reeked of marijuana and the housekeeper decided to come in, I would still recommend this hotel. I think the 2 things that happened to us were isolated events.

review.title: Right At The Trolly
review.reviewText: This location is right near the start of the trolly.  If you are in a room that faces the left side of the building, you are able to see them at their stopping point.  I would consider the hotel to be a boutique hotel.  I have never stayed in one like it.  I don't know if it is use to be an apartment complex, but it is set up like one.  The rooms are spaced far apart from one another and you can take the stairs or the elevator to get to the the next level.  What I liked is that the hotel was in the middle of the action, but we couldn't hear any of the street noise.  The blackout curtains worked great as we didn't know that morning had come.  The room was clean with very few issues.  There was a stain on the box spring and there were some signs of wear and tear in the bathroom, but other than that it was a great looking room.  The pillows and the bed were very comfortable.  The Wi-Fi was free and it worked well.  There was an issue with the television as all of the stations had a bit of a snowy effect to them.  But for as much as we were in the room that was not a big issue.  The hotel entrance was right between a store where you could buy trinkets and a money exchange location.  You have to be careful because if you aren't looking for it, you could miss it. There are lot of stores located right across and down the street from the hotel, even a pharmacy.  It's a great place if you want to walk.  There are fees that you should be aware of such as the cleaning deposit.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great.  They also have a concierge. This is a hotel that I would love to visit again.  It's a bit pricey, but well worth it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.  It was all good.
review.locationRemarks: You can take the trolly or hire a car service to take you around the city.  It is in walking distance of several stores.

I was staying with some friends outside of San Francisco but realized I needed to be closer to the start of the run, so I found the Hotel Union Square. The rates were affordable and reasonable for my stay and were surprising as well, given how expensive staying in Union Square can be. The staff was very hospitable and made every effort to help me navigate the city. The housekeeping staff was nice as well and very respectful of noise in the hallway. Cleanliness is huge to me and this hotel gets a golden star for that. 

Overall, the experience was great as the location was central to everywhere I went to (and dangerously close to an H&M and Uniqlo). I would recommend this hotel and stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Like a small apartment in a great part of town.
review.reviewText: Hotels in SF are expensive, so I'm always on the hunt for 'diamonds in the rough".  Union Square area is not the rough, but I did find a diamond!  The Hotel Union Square is a quaint hotel nears great shops and across the street from an amazing Walgreens. You have everything you need steps from the hotel.  I upgraded to a 400 square foot suite and it was like having an apartment...for less than $400 a night!  Free Wi-Fi too.  A great find.
review.negativeRemarks: No need.
review.locationRemarks: shopping, sightseeing, close to public transit.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Chuck,

Thank you for chssoing to stay with us, I will convey your kind words to the staff. Tha k you as well for your review.
See you soon.

review.title: Conveniently located hotel near Trollylloll line
review.reviewText: Boutique style, small but clean & comfortable room.  Very accommodating hotel staff.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kurt,

I can't say how terribly sorry for the way your stay went. Tomorrow first thing in the morning everything you brought up will be discussed with our Housekeeping and Maintenance team and taken care of. There is no excuse for this type of issue regarding cleanliness.Best regards,

review.title: Read this story - We were not happy
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right downtown.  It is an older building that they renovated. When we booked the hotel we saw that we would be able to use a gym nearby through vouchers but learned that this was not the case.  There was no gym, or access to a gym, which was disappointing.  Our first room was located in the center the the hotel and was very quiet. It seemed clean so we went for a walk.  We came back at 9:00 PM and had showers.  There was no hot water in our room.  After having a cold shower I saw that there was blood splattered on the walls in the bathroom.  My wife and I have 16 years of forensic experience, and yes, what we saw was blood splatter, and from the location and color of the splatter I would surmise from intravenous needle use.  I also observed staining on the wall in the bedroom, that to be fair I cannot say of that was blood as well.  I collected swabs of the suspected blood splatter from the bathroom and called the front desk.  The manager was not working so we were moved to another hotel room. This other hotel room had paper thin walls so we listened to the occupants of the next suite making what had to be nothing short of an adult movie.  The female participant was very descriptive and 'articulate'. And...  the TV in this room did not work so we listed to that for about one hour...  The next day the manager was very reasonable and refunded our entire prepaid stay.  We were happy to leave
review.negativeRemarks: The hot water, the TV, the sound proofing of the hotel and the staff in the hotel need to do a better job cleaning
review.locationRemarks: We liked that it was right downtown, but it was not really a 'nice' part of the city.  I  would not recommend staying in this area.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kim,
Thank you for choosing to stay with us. The rooms on the inner courtyard do face each other, if you consider staying with us again in the future maybe you could try one of our rooms facing the street.
Thank you for leaving a review.
Best regards

review.title: Safe and clean, but not luxury.
review.reviewText: I had an interior court room, with a window that looked into a small courtyard and certainly other windows.  The room was clean and cozy, I could understand it is in a 1913 building, which is cool.  But the view was a mix of tenament housing/rear window.  I wasn't in the room much, anyway.  I liked the ceiling fan and comfy bed, wine reception was sweet.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us. It's pleasure to read that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope that you will have the pleasure to host you again soon, maybe in one of our larger rooms. Best regards

review.title: Great hotel with vibrant environment.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay here with good experience. Friendly personnel with good attitude.
review.negativeRemarks: Room sizes.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ignacio,
Thank you for your review and for choosing to stay with us. I am sorry about this whole situation, it is true that hotels sometime get oversold and we have to relocate people. You were able to stay with us, I wish that the room had been to your liking.
Best regards

review.title: Don't stay in this hotel
review.reviewText: Smelly room and hallways. No window in the room. No closet in the room. Noisy AC unit. They completely ignored my late arrival reservation and did not have a room for me when I arrived. They wanted to send me to a hotel that was 6 blocks away for one night and check-in with them the next day. When I explained my schedule did not allowed for that they did not offer any other solutions. Finally, another guest arrived and they discovered they had double booked him. So they did have a room for me, a really bad one.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your comment, we do have some small rooms but we also have some larger rooms with desk that are definitely more suitable to business travelers. Thank you for letting me know about the mirror I will look into it. We hope you will choose to stay with us again. Best regards

review.reviewText: Room was clean, but ridiculously small and dark.   Hotel offers no amenities at all.  Not suitable for needs of a business traveler.  On first night of stay, room had a full length mirror on back of closet door.  On second day, it was removed!  Staff was very nice.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a comment about your stay with us. Our Deluxe Queen rooms are on the smaller side,I am glad that we were able to accomodate your needs and to offer you an upgrade to one of our Executive rooms. Thank you for your very nice comments about the staff.

review.title: DON'T GET A DELUXE QUEEN!
review.reviewText:
When we first arrived, we had a deluxe queen.  There was nothing "deluxe" about it!  It was basically a closet with a queen bed in it.  There was no point to even having a window in the room, because it just was up against the other wall of the hotel without any light coming in.  It was awful.  I knew I would not be able to spend three nights in that room without losing my mind, so I went down to the front desk to ask if there were any upgrades available.  Thankfully, there was one left.  She gave us the room key to go look at it before we decided to move.  WHAT A DIFFERENCE!  It was an additional $45/night for the new room but worth every cent compared to the last room.  

The staff there was beyond wonderful.  They were always willing to give us directions, recommendations, etc.  I highly recommend the hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Make the Deluxe rooms into storage closets or something.  They shouldn't be sold as hotel rooms.  They are awful.
review.locationRemarks: There are so many wonderful places to walk to and do.  It's right in the center of everything and easy access to public transportation.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Helena, 
Thank you for your review and for choosing to stay with us. I am sorry that we didn't meet your expectations I hope we could have done more for you.
Best regards

review.title: Terrible room
review.reviewText: Tiny room without fresh air or air conditioning. Could hear every step next to me and above. The same with running water and shower from my neighbors.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you so much for this very nice comment and for choosing to stay with us, I am extremely happy to read that you enjoyed your stay, the convemience of the hotel and the level of service you were provided.

Best regards,

review.title: Amazing hotel right in the center of union square
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel stay, very comfortable and accommodating. I would recommend to anyone visiting San Francisco. Super close to Market St. and all of the Union Square shopping. Only a quick walk to the pier and the view of the Bay Bridge.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a comment, I was sorry to read that you didn't your stay with us. I hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future and maybe allow us to change your opinion.
Best regards,

review.title: Misleading Hotel
review.reviewText: We were expecting an independent boutique Art Deco hotel, as was advertised. Instead what we experienced was a grotty back street 1 star hotel. The foyer was the only part that was passable.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us. I always love to read that the staff did a great job. Thank you very much for them.

review.title: Right in the centre of things
review.reviewText: The position of the hotel was central, everywhere was accessible,restaurants, shops and waterfront. Ideal.
review.negativeRemarks: Window, sound insulation
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, shops places of interest, waterfront.

review.title: Nice hotel, thin walls...
review.reviewText: Overall it was a good experience.  Good service, clean room and really good location.  Only thing was I could hear my neighbors "having a gods time" late at night...

review.title: Too crowded, hard to park.
review.reviewText:
We stayed for two nights, our first visit to San Francisco. It's a central location for shopping. But it's very busy and noisy. We had two rooms, both looking out to Ellis St. There is a bar across the street and it's always noisy, either people or garbage trucks. We wanted to keep windows open to get some fresh air and couldn't due to noise. And our room didn't have air conditioning, you don't really need it in San Francisco but if you can't have windows open, it gets stuffy in the room.

And we had to take cabs to all the sites. Wish we stayed a little out of central areas, would be better for sleeping.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Steve,
Thank you very much for your review and for choosing to stay with us. Our No Frills rooms are the smallest we have and they do not have AC, it's true. We nevertheless also have bigger rooms, that you probably would have enjoyed more.
Best regards.

review.title: Not worth the $$
review.reviewText:
The room was tiny, had no air con. Defiantly not worth the money it cost.
Location is great, staff where very friendly.
It was called a no frills room, it was certainly that!

review.title: Excellent spot.
review.reviewText: Was very close to the trolleys, or just walking around. Staff was great. Took the time to answer our questions and find areas on the map for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the room, very clean. The overall feel of this hotel was calming

The rooms have A/C and/or ceiling fans. all are rooms do not have A/C units, I am sorry if this what an issue for you.

Best regards,

review.reviewText: The hotel rooms look nothing like the photos online. The rooms are very small and some do not have air conditioning and it was a very warm in our room. We were moved to a room with air conditioning which was a little better. The rooms had a dorm type of feel. They were very small.

Best regards

review.title: Nice hotel. Smaller rooms.
review.reviewText: Rooms on the smaller side and could use cleaning that is more thorough. But bedding was clean, and room was generally clean. Cool older building. review.title: NOT AS DESCRIBED
review.reviewText:
- Keys are not working well. (changed all the keys once but still same)
- 2 double beds room looks totally different from the pictures on the website.
- No slippers.
- Only sugar and creamers. No coffee in the room at the 1st day (got it 2nd day of stay)
- Phone doesn't work at all. (charging forever)
- Very noisy outside. No soundproof.
- No "DO NOT DISTURB" sign.
- Smells bad in the room.
- There is NO "Complimentary use of Fitness Center". NO fitness at all.
review.negativeRemarks:
Pictures on the website.
Upload a pic of how the 2 double beds room really looks like.
review.locationRemarks:
In the middle of Union Square.
Very close to all the retail stores.

review.reviewText:
Friendly staff, small but clean room.
Good location.

review.title: vintage
review.reviewText:
A great vintage hotel with a touch of hip, located downtown,  Of course the rooms are a bit small, but the high ceilings with a fan are a nice trade off.  I understand it's an old building, which is why I really like it, but they really need to install a system of air exchange to bring fresh air quality into the rooms ... there's got to be a way to make this work!  Perhaps to install special room air conditioners with a minimum % fresh air setting, or alternatively, single room air exchangers which operate independently.  Hotel Union Square could upgrade the rooms one at a time.  The staff was awesome and the amenities were great!

A great price for a great old hotel in a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: the Vibe ... the decor, local musician Sat night, great concierge advice, wine tasting in lobby, lots of shops next door, money exchange,
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: it's right on the trolley stop ... use your imagination!

review.title: Excellent location, nice decor, tiny rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel Union Square is perfectly located for visitors to San Francisco at Powell and Ellis Streets. I was in SF on business and was only about ~18 minutes walking from the Financial District. The hotel lobby was nicely designed and very welcoming after a long and late flight. The room itself was very small, with the bed taking up most of the floor space, but it was still quite comfortable. My room had both a powerful AC and a fan, so the temperature was perfect. The bathroom was also very small, but got the job done. My room faced the back of the hotel, so it was very quiet (even on Friday and Saturday nights).
review.positiveRemarks: My room was actually very comfortable despite the size. The location was great too.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lighting in the red hallways on the 4th floor, and showers that don't totally lose water pressure anytime someone in another room flushes.
review.locationRemarks: Super close to Union Square and Market Street, so there's a ton of shopping and places to eat. You're also right across from an awesome Walgreens.

review.title: Great place to call home base in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Hotel Union Square had great rating.  When we arrived early, I was worried as it looked quite urban.  Lobby however was lovely.  When we got our room they had upgraded with out our request to their presidential suite.  OMG it was wonderful.  My sons had a regular room and it was also nice but our accommodations were extraordinary. Living room, kitchenette, office, large bathroom and large bedroom.  In addition we had a very large patio with furniture to sit out and see the city.  I cannot say how great it was.  Also very central to our plans.
review.negativeRemarks: Airconditioner in rooms other than bedroom
review.locationRemarks: Union Square; retail stores; restaurants and you an 'Lyft' anywhere.

review.title: Great Location, and comfy rooms.
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay here again, love the wine reception complimentary.

managementResponses.response:

Best regards,

review.title: Stay for the location, not the hotel itself
review.reviewText: I would only recommend this hotel if you are not picky and intend on only staying in the hotel to sleep a few hours. Location is pretty much prime for a tourist in town for a few days. Unfortunately, we got a few very warm days and the lack of air conditioning made sleeping very uncomfortable and because of the busy street below, opening a window was very noisy. If you are looking for high end, this is not for you.
review.negativeRemarks: location, location, location
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is right on the path of the cable cars and a block from Union Square/BART station. You can't beat that.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Shelly,

Thank you very much for your comment. We do have a wide variety of room types some of them small and without air conditioning. I wish you would have brought your discomfort to the front desk's attention and improve your stay with us.
I hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future and maybe try one of our larger rooms.

Kind regards,

review.title: The room was hot and the bathroom was small.
review.reviewText:
The staff were very friendly and the hotel was very clean, the only problem is, or two problems for that matter, is that the room we got was very small, we could barely walk. The bathroom was even smaller. I apologize for explaining this, but setting on the toilet chair, we had to tilt because the wall is very close to the chair. The other thing is the room temperature. The room was always hot. No AC! There is a fan but because the room is small it generates unpleasant airflow, so we had to keep it low all the time, which made the room even hotter. 
But as I said earlier, the staff was very nice, I am sure that they would change the room if we told them but we didn't ask because we were busy and out of the hotel most of the time.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I am very sorry to read that you didn't have a good experience while staying with us. Thanks you for your comment and for reaching out to us.
Best regards,

review.reviewText:
They gave me very bad room , I didn't like it at all , but when I asked to change the room 
They accepted my request . 
The hotel not clean , . It was bad smelling all the time in the restroom , 
Was no saver to keep my stuff as passport and any important paper I should keep it save . The stuff wear ok , but in general I didn't like the hotel , and the location

review.title: Boutique hotel located in the hub of Union Square
review.reviewText:
We had a very pleasant stay at Union Hotel Square! We requested an early check in, however due to the fact the hotel was quite busy, they were unable to check us in early, however did place our bags in storage till check in time so we could roam the city in the meantime! 

When we did check in, we found the room quite cosy (we had four people) however very clean and had all the facilities required. The room always had clean towels and amenities and we were able to place passports and valuables in the safe provided. 

It was located right in the middle of union square, with a short walk to Westfield and even closer walk to stores such as Mac, H&M, Victoria's Secret and Macy's all located within a 5 min walking distance. Getting around was also easy with Uber as we were able to visit locations such as Lombard Street, San Fran Bridge, Fisherman's wharf, AT&T Park  and Pier 39. We had a fantastic time as we were able to get to all these locations without a ridiculous cost. 

Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like the true San Francisco experience at an affordable, convenient and cute location!
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a little cramped with the beds quite close together.

review.title: Updated but not upgraded
review.reviewText: Basically just paint, carpeting, and furniture to make an old place look stylish, but it's still old, creaky, and noisy. Great location, with shopping and public transit right there.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I am sincerely sorry for your experience while you were staying with us, it is true that some of our rooms do not have A/C and lead to a fire escape. I wish we could have better accommodated your needs.

Best regards,

review.title: Never stay here
review.reviewText: No AC in the room, only view was a wall 6 feet away and the fire escape, blocked me in my parking space with another car and lost the keys

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for your feedback, I am sorry that we didn't meet your expectations.
I hope that you will consider giving us another chance and stay with us again in the future.

review.title: Too expensive for its service and condition.
review.reviewText:
The hotel old and should be maintained better ! No air conditioning , bed was too hard . The sink in the bath room
Too small

review.title: No AC in my room and too tight to move around
review.reviewText:
The room 529 I was in, I found out there was no AC. Not something you want to look forward to when you go back to your room. Temputure inside the room was 10 degrees higher then the hallway. There was a window to a small alley chimney and I opened it and felt no difference. Decided to look up outside and found out there was a window above that blocks out all air.  Why need a window then?  What bothered me most was the smell of the room. The room smelled very musty and gave me a huge headache.  All you have is a ceiling fan which won't do enough to cool down the room when it is already hot in there with no air.  I was there for 4 nights, tried to change rooms once but there was no availability at the time during my day 2 stay. I decided to just suck it up.  The room was so small I couldn't even move around and the sink was outside the bathroom too so there was no room to really put any of your stuff around besides on your bed. I'm only 5'2 and slim and I'm complaining about being too small.

Trying to find the source of my headache I realized what was making the room smell so bad. It was from the alley chimney. Be advised, DO NOT OPEN/LEAVE WINDOW UP.  MUSTY SMELL THAT STICKS ON TO YOUR CLOTHES.  After closing it the smell slowly start disappearing or I finally got used to it but really no point open it when there is no air or breezing coming through it. 

I'm pretty sure other rooms were perhaps better but I guess I really lucked out.  Never again.

review.title: Great location near Union Center
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean room but regular room is small. Window ac unit is noisey. Location is right on trolley line and two blocks from Market St. Lots of restaurants, bars and sopping close by.  A bit pricey but everything in this area was expensive.

review.title: Charming boutique hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to stay for business and pleasure.  We both had meetings in the city and it was my birthday so needed to combine both.  This hotel is very quaint and reminded me of some hotels during my travels to Europe.  The nice little touches were the free happy hour at 5pm, and there was a guy playing the guitar.  he had a full range of music and even sang happy birthday to me.  The concierge then brought me a box of chocolate.  Big bathrooms and comfy beds, and walking distance to most everything.  I would definitely come here again.
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping was a little off - second night short on towels, parking valet was a little grumpy
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great location and great service
review.reviewText: You couldn't get a better location when visiting San Francisco, right downtown.  Walking distance to many attractions.  I took a long and pleasant walk on Market street to Embarcadero boulevard and Fisherman's Warf from the hotel. Walgreens is right across from the hotel with a good takeout section, so you never have to worry about getting food or drink.  Also, a restaurant next door and many other eating options in the area.  If you want to ride a cable car, it's just a short block away.  All major stores for shopping, like Ross, Marshals, Macy's are also a walk away.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I got a good deal for the room (considering how expensive San Francisco is), but it must have been the smallest room in the hotel, although it was very clean.  It could only fit a bed, the window was tiny facing a wall of another building, lucky I was only coming to the hotel to sleep, otherwise would be hard to stay in that room for a long time (you almost feel like you are in a closet). The walls in the hotel are really paper thin, I could hear everything that was going on in the hallway while in the room and inside other rooms when walking the hallway.  It wasn't a problem for me, but for some people who are sensitive sleepers it might be. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for it's amazing location, cleanliness and great customer service.
review.locationRemarks: China town, Embarcadero boulevard, Fisherman's Warf.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for your comment, I am glad that you had a good stay with us. If you consider staying with us again maybe ask for a room on the back of the building which quiet. Hotel Union Square is in the heart of the city and it's true that it can be a little overwhelming, if one is not used to it.

Kind regards

review.title: Small but nice hotel.
review.reviewText: It was close to everything. It was a bit noisy for someone that comes from having no noise at night.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us. Thank you as well for your comments and particular the ones about the issues you had in the room. I will go double check myself that they have all been taken care of.
I am also a big fan of the Dashiell Hammett suite, which housed the famous author for a few month after he got married. I hope you will consider staying with us again.

Best regards

review.title: Fun Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: If you blink, you will miss the front door of Hotel Union Square. Between a money exchange business and a cheap tourist crap store, is the front door of Hotel Union Square. The lobby is well appointed, clean and very nice. We were lucky enough to stay in the Dashiell Hammett Suite which was really cool. From the antique typewriter, to Dashiell's over coat and hat, the room was really cool. The good news is that there are a number of window that actually open in the room. The bad news is that none of them would stay open...we used a water bottle in a couple of them to get some air. There is a window AC but with being in SF during amazing weather, we wanted fresh SF air. There were a couple other minor issues that I brought to the front desk...hopefully they followed up.
review.negativeRemarks:
The windows in the Dashiell Hammett Suite should open and stay open for some fresh air.
The lamp was burned out next to the bed.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText:
Great location to many nice restaurants and shopping. Convenience store opposite the hotel.
The only downfall was the room we had was overlooking Powell street and was rather noisy. Even with the double glazed widow. No air con made it rather stuffy but as it wasn't exceptionally hot we managed ok. 
I would however still stay again at this hotel but on the opposite side of the complex, not road frontage. 
The free wine tasting at 5pm was a really nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning in rooms would be good.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, love Macy's. Fisherman's wharf, pier 39. China Town. Lombard Street, the crooked street. I would recommend a day tour. Well worth it.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us and for leaving a comment. We do have very wide variety of rooms and even in one room type they are not all exactly identical. It is very difficult to give a complete idea of our rooms on pictures.We also have much larger room types that are clearly identified on our website.
Thanks again for sharing your thoughts, we hope you will stay again with us in the future.

Best regards

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location..nice staff for sure... Our particular room was super tiny....there isn't a way to know what size room you are getting whaem you book--at least not thru a third party like expedia..the photos on the website sre very misleading.  The beds are very comfortable -it's clean.and some rooms are larger--but our room was teeny tiny.
Really spacious room, and fun intentionally 70s decor

managementResponses.response:

Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your thoughts about your stay.
I want to apologize for the cleanliness issue you had to suffer of and rest assured that this issue has been brought up to housekeeping's attention.
Thank you for not letting this incident deteriorate the rest of your stay.
We would love to have you back and give you the perfect experience you deserve.

Best regards.

review.title: Modern Classic boutique hotel
review.reviewText: It was a cute boutique hotel! Staff was friendly and very accommodating. The only bad thing I could say would be the restroom wasn't cleaned very thorough. The shower liner had stains and the edges had small hairs. I just wiped it down myself but it bothered me. Other than that the room was cute and modern. A/c unit blew cold, and was located near everything I wanted to do. I would recommend this to friends and would definitely stay here again. Very Cute!!!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay, I am happy to read that you were positively surprised by the hotel in general.
This building dates back from 1907 and we do have some rooms that might seem odd to the 21st century traveler. We also do have more regular rooms with a lot of sunlight. Looking forward to having you back trying one of those.

Best regards

review.title: Nice but basic room does not have natural light
review.reviewText: Hotel was surprisingly nice as we were expecting a budget hotel. Common areas and rooms are well designed and have an upscale bouticy feel. I had issues with the fact that our room did not receive any natural light so it was impossible to know if the sun had risen. I felt like in a dungeon. My partner did not have any issues with this. My suggestion, don't get the most basic room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you so much for pointing out the kindness of the staff, we all work very hard in trying to make our guest's stays memorable and t is always very nice to read about it, thank you again for your review. Looking forward to having you back.

Best regards

review.title: Great hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Booked hotel because it was close to the Powell Station, BART. The staff allowed us to leave our carrying on bags before we checked in and after we checked out. Very nice staff and great location for people that want to experience Union Square.
Great stay. No complaints. Booked for business travel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for leaving a review about your stay.
I wish that your room would have been more to your liking, some of our rooms are indeed small but we also do have a variety of bigger rooms.
Maybe you will try one of those next time you are in town.

Kind regards.

review.reviewText: My Deluxe Queen room felt like it was the size of an airplane bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was tiny. Modern cheap furniture in an old building with not much decor
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is right around the corner

review.title: Great location for first-time visitors!
review.reviewText:
I arrived very late due to delayed flight. I called the front desk to let them know I'll be late for my check-in. I finally arrived after midnight and checked in without any issues.
It's located right opposite to Walgreens which is convenient to buy food or drinks when nothing else was opened.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

I agree "no frills" rooms are small and I think their name was picked in that regard. being in the heart of Union Square sometime means that there is noise outside at night, for our guests who need peace and quiet we do have some rooms facing an inner courtyard.
Thank you for your feedback.
Best regards,

review.reviewText: Stayed in the "no frills" room which was just that, a bed and four walls. It was a great option for me in that I was only in my hotel room to sleep. Had it been necessary for my to spend more time in the room, the lack of space would have been an issue. I would recommend this for travelers that are merely looking for a place to keep their belongings safe during the day and a place to rest their heads at night. Heads up it appears a lot of guests stay at this hotel due to the proximity of night life, so there is drunken clattering throughout the night.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for sharing your thoughts with us. Your opinion is very important to us. We understand that cleanliness is key to a good stay for our guests, thank you for pointing out the areas that were lacking during your stay. Rest assured that some measures have alreday been taken.
Best regards

review.title: Little more worn than the pictures
review.reviewText: Concierge was very friendly, front desk woman not so much. Hotel is rather old and despite the upkept image in the photos the hallway carpets are rather dirty. I booked a queen bed room as I saw other reviewers commented about how small the standard rooms were, but this was also very small. Room cleanliness was decent despite the hallways looking rather bleek.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Meh... just meh... not good or bad..  interior room with only a vent shaft. A bit odd, but not terrible.

review.title: Boutique hotel - great location - has character
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, small room but cheaper than the big brand name ones nearby.  I chose this hotel because the conference hotels were sold out.  The interior room was small, but had no road noise.  Large air conditioner quickly cooled the room.  The room was so small, it didn't have a desk, but it was much cheaper than nearby hotels.  Front desk staff was wonderful on all shifts.  They were accommodating with a late check out at 2 pm.  Very clean.  24hr Walgreens across the street was great and a block away from the Powell Street BART subway station making to/from airport easy.  I would stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: clean, polite staff, across from 24hr grocery store, near subway making to/from airport easy.
review.negativeRemarks: could use a paint touch up on bathroom door - some chipping on door edge, but clean - small room, but nice.
review.locationRemarks: right on Union square - trolley's out front, walking distance to conference hotels, restaurants EVERYWHERE you look.

review.title: Nice hotel, pleasant stay
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night during memorial day weekend. The hotel is nice and clean, definitely an older hotel. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Overall it was a good experience and I would stay at the hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close to everything, within walking distance to many restaurants and stores
review.negativeRemarks: more updated bathrooms, better lighting

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is located in Union Square and we were able to walk everywhere.  Was impressed on how quiet the room was for being located in such a busy area.  Nice decor and friendly staff.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was just ok. It's been renovated to look modern but the rooms are small, many face another wall and have no view at all. The cleaning products they use are really pungent so the whole place has a strong smell. I spotted a cockroach in my room one morning.

review.title: Good spot in the city
review.reviewText: Staff at night was bit rude. The morning staff was nice.

review.title: ENJOYED OUR STAY HERE
review.reviewText:
NICE HOTEL VERY CONVENIENT TO THE POWELL STREE BART LINE, (WHICH WE USED WITH EASE TO AND FROM THE AIRPORT).
THE STAFF  GAVE US GREAT SERVICE.  AND THE WINE HOUR WAS JUST WHAT WE NEEDED AFTER A DAY ON THE TOWN-GOOD WINES, TOO!
ROOM WAS QUITE SMALL, BUT ALL THAT WE NEEDED.
review.positiveRemarks: THE SERVICE, THE WINES AND THE LOCATION
review.negativeRemarks: THEY SHULD PROVIDE EITHER A HAND BAR OR A TUB MAT IN THE BATHTUB.  IT WAS TOO SLIPPERY AND I FELL WHILE SHOWERING.
review.locationRemarks: IT IS VRY CONVENIENT TO THE BART, THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION, AND UNION SQUARE AND IT'S SURROUNDING STORES AND RESTAURANTS.

review.title: First stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was comfortable , well located in the city centre and at a reasonable price. My only disappointment was that the room was quite small, as was the bathroom/toilet, no room to move at all. Sink very deep and almost impossible to gather water to shave without making a mess. Staff very friendly and helpful and as I start a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: As above w

review.title: City break
review.reviewText:
Nice staff
Great location
Spacious room 
Recommend

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: Over priced awful hotel, it was dirty, bathroom had hairs in it. They had a broken elevator. My friend who was also staying there didn't have AC. Can't believe it was 300 a night. I left before I even had to sleep there. Would not recommend this hotel. Really can't find a worse hotel option I imagine. Should not be considered even a two star hotel.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Cool hotel, right by Union Square, comfy beds, and friendly staff. I called before my trip and asked if my room had a feature and was told it did, but when I arrived it didn't. The man at the front desk immediately moved us into a room that did, even though they were booked really full and he looked really busy. The phone was ringing off the hook the whole time I was talking to him but he was friendly and accommodating about my room switch. I was very pleased.

review.title: Would definitely stay again!
review.reviewText:
Great hotel.  It's not perfect, but its minor imperfections only added to it's personality.  We were on the 2nd floor, right above the street, so you could hear the cable car and some traffic, however the windows helped to muffle the sound just enough, which my husband and I rather enjoyed.  The room was very clean, the staff was helpful, and the bed was VERY comfortable. (The eye make-up remover wipes was a nice touch.) 

If you order room service, which is actually ordering from Tad's restaurant next door, know that a tip for Tad's is automatically added to the bill.

My only caveat is the hotel-recommended van service that I let Hotel Union Square's Concierge talk me into. Price was great (a partial of which, was paid directly to the hotel), but the service was extremely lacking!  The driver was impatient to the point of hitting a bus with the mirror and proceeding to yell at the bus driver, all while our van was in the bus' way.  He was such a rude man as he managed to add a couple racial comments along with his lesson on San Francisco.  On my next visit, I'll time myself better to get the cheaper rates to/from the airport and opt for Uber.
review.positiveRemarks: Wasn't a typical hotel.  It had a lot of personality to it.

review.title: noise???
review.reviewText: no airconditioning and not even a ceiling fan. they have rooms with air conditioning but it was not eve offered. we were not told there was construction and the construction literally went ALL night!!!! no sleep whatsoever because all i heard was banging and breaking up of concrete. absolutely awful!!!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: communication

review.title: Good location and excellent staff
review.reviewText: The location is in the middle of the shopping area so it's very convenient to do our shopping. The staff are very friendly and offers alot of help in providing advice on getting around. Though the room & bathroom might be abit small,the location and staff makes up for it.
Great. The rooms are very modern looking and not too classy. Felt like home.
everything was fine for our 4 nights stay. we had no trouble and staff were friendly. place is clean and close to many food places.

review.title: Great location! Close to all touristy attractions!
review.reviewText: Safe and clean! Parking around the corner, cheap! Great spot.
Hotel was over priced,but the location was pretty good

review.title: Very central but disappointing room
review.reviewText: Although my room was a good size, it felt like a lot of corners had been cut when the room was furnished (especially the bathroom) and as there was almost no natural light it wasn't the most inviting of rooms. Having said that, the staff was professional and friendly and it is extremely central.
Central, with really nice and helping staff. The room was a bit dark, but quite comfortable.

review.title: Good Hotel

review.positiveRemarks: Great experience! In the heart of the city!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Cozy room, very warm, with very helpful staff
review.reviewText: The room was rather small, all told, and the bathroom comparably small.  It had everything I needed in it, though, and was *very* conveniently located.  The staff was really where the hotel shone.  They were very responsive, helped me get my bearings, were incredibly friendly ... basically, everything you'd want in a hotel staff, and more.  My one complaint would be that we couldn't get the room cooled down.  It had radiator heating, and could be turned low, but not entirely off.
review.negativeRemarks: The radiator heat wouldn't entirely shut off.  Too warm!
review.locationRemarks: Nearby public transit, drug store, restaurants, shops ... everything needed.

There is quite a lot of thing to do in the area and you can take the cable care to Chinatown or to the wharf area, ie Fishermen' Wharf, Pier 39, and the Cannery.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice size rooms and comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom is quite old but it had a new sink and toilet and everthing was clean and in working order.

The only complaint I have was that it was very +++ noisy from the street below until past 3am. Mind you we stayed in a Friday night and only were there for one night. In spite of the noise my wife and I loved the hotel.

review.title: not what I expected

review.title: small, quirky, good location
review.reviewText: The room was very small but fine for one person. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, and the location was great for shopping and walking around in the evening.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and because it was not just one more night at the Hyatt.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for shopping and grabbing a quick bite.  Perfect for after work wind down.

review.title: Great location!

The staff were friendly and knowledgable and the hotel itself was very stylish and cool. The only slight complaint I would have is that our room was very, very, small but that would explain the great rate we got. Maybe next time we'll spring for a bigger room!

review.reviewText: great boutique hotel.  nice location.  clean room.  no complaints whatsoever.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: I'm not a huge fan of union square but the fact that you can almost see union square from the hotel and CAN see the muni station makes it perfect. We rode greyhound to San Francisco jumped right on muni and jumped right off a half block from the hotel. Then went all over town via an all access muni pass(includes trolley cars, subway, and busses). Only thing was the room was surprisingly small but was a non-issue for us as we only used the hotel for sleeping! We mostly were out in the town. The wine in the evenings was pretty cool. If you need a ton of amenities pay a little more and go down the street, if you see the hotel as we did, a nice, safe place to crash, this place was great. Couldn't ask for more.
