review.title: Centrally located boutique hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff was great, facilities are recently redecorated, check-in/out was easy. Located right beside Powell cable car terminus and 1 block from BART - couldn't be more convenient.

This is a 100 year old hotel, so the rooms are really small (~14'x18' or so?) but everything works and the furnishings and decor have been updated. We took an inside room rather than streetside due to concern about noise. It was pretty dark and there was no view (inside rooms look into the central outdoor 'atrium' across to other rooms 20' away; this is a typical historic ventilation strategy), but it was QUIET and there were no privacy issues. We slept like logs. 

It was January, so we didn't turn on the through-window air conditioner, but I am guessing that would have been a bit noisier. Might be a good idea to bring earplugs just in case, or if you'd like a street view.

Note that the hotel is right downtown, so there is a pretty wide population demographic represented - my 8 year old daughter was a little worried about some of the more unpredictable homeless residents around the Union Square area, and had a lot of questions in general about the people sleeping or sitting in doorways (but not our hotel doorway!!). But we didn't have any problems.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, location is great, quiet inside rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Hard to find if you're not looking for it - better signage, or additional directions on the website that say 'door is beside the currency exchange'
review.locationRemarks: So central! Access to everything! BART is 1 block away. Trolley is 1 block away. Powell cable car is 1/2 block away. Restaurants galore.

review.title: Last Minute Pit Stop
review.reviewText:
Booked the room the same day for our pit-stop in SF. It's conveniently located next to a parking garage, so we parked there, rather than use the hotel's parking services. It is in the nicer area of Union Square, so you won't experience running into some homeless people as you may in other sections

The lobby is nicely decorated. You can tell the building is older when you get inside of the room, just by looking at the original fixtures, but everything has been updated. 

I'm very happy that the room did not smell like cigarettes. It was extremely clean and neat. Their shower heads are amazing as well as the products they provide. Bed was really comfortable, no squeaks or weird springs.

In the morning they provide some coffee and tea. I drank two cups. The coffee was not shabby at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted to stay in Union Square, just because of the convenience and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Blow drier
review.locationRemarks: It's in the middle of Union Square, you're near everything!

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip, the staff are very friendly, the amenities are great, The rooms are a clean and efficient.
review.positiveRemarks: central location - perfect for transit, dining & shopping
review.negativeRemarks: they could take the bathrooms up a notch
review.locationRemarks: Street cards at the door, every possible type of food and shopping you could imagine at your doorstep.

review.title: Very disappointing...
review.reviewText: Let me start by saying my boyfriend and I come up to the city about every other weekend, so we stay at a lot of hotels. This was by far the worst experience we've ever had. Valet is self service valet, there was construction so the road to the parking lot was blocked off by cones, had to take a 20 min detour because of one way streets just to get to the parking lot that is located directly behind the hotel just to find out there are cones and signs in the way. I finally got out of my car and moved the cones and signs because no one from the hotel was taking care of it. Even after all this and complaining, I was forced to pay for the valet parking...also the rooms are VERY small, and the hot water takes about 30 min to get hot, so I took a cold shower...the concierge brought a bottle of wine to the room thinking this made up for it. Unbelievable!!!! Never had an experience like this before...will never be returning to this hotel. Many more outstanding hotels for similar price or even cheaper!

review.title: Good hotel in the center
review.reviewText:
Stayed there for 4 nights, facilities are great, staff was really helpful and the location is prime.
only thing is the fact that the room is a bit small but other then that, it's a great hotel with perfect service
(in the mornings you get complementary coffee and at the evening a complementary glass of wine at the lobby).
The hotel has it's own parking lot (need to pay for it), so it's very convenient if you are traveling with a car.

review.title: It was fine. The elevator broke.
review.reviewText:
It was a cool old building. I felt like it was right out of a noir novella. The halls were dark and the mood lighting was right on point, felt like I was in a movie scene. Room was tiny, expected as it's SF. The elevator broke, hoofing 5 flights of stairs was fine, the staff offered the service elevator for use, I declined. The room was small, but overall clean. The alarm went off at 5AM, playing mariachi music at full blast. 

It's an old building, it's creaky, but I felt it was just fine for the rate. Can't give a 5 star review and it gets 3 stars for condition of the broken elevator.
review.positiveRemarks: Real SF hotel, the lighting was cool.
review.negativeRemarks: Just a general upgrade of the bathroom, make sure everything is spotless.
review.locationRemarks: Great food and entertainment within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
I too was helped by the wonderful Coffee at the front desk. She was very delightful. The bellhop was great at taking our bags up to our room. Parking was a bit troublesome as it's only a small space in front to pull up and unload, but that's expected downtown. The room we were in did not have an air conditioner, or at least one that we could find. It was a simple fix of opening the windows which faced the street. I happen to love the sounds, so I was not displeased.

The bathroom was extremely clean, and the shower was powerful, a rarity in hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Nice Hotel within SFO downtown

review.negativeRemarks: A bit lesser price :), however in downtown & location matches the price.

Restaurants and supermarket are at door step, some literally just downstair, shops surrounding us 360 degree, with all level of budgets available. Bus stops, cable car, tour buses are within  walking distance. Staffs are super helpful. Will definitely choose this hotel again if I ever visit SF in the future !

Betsy's trip to San Fran
Christmas, 2014

review.reviewText:
Originally I had reserved a room with a queen size bed, which it was good size bed for me and my son,
But room was way too small even to walk around the bed, so i decided to upgrate, so i went to the lobby and explained i have a young boy and needed a bigger room 
The lady in the lobby was very nice and helpful, she got me a way bigger room with King size bed and street view! 
I was so Happy! And my son too!

The room is very big nice and clean!
Love the location, just about one Block away from the mall!
2 Blocks away from Target and the movie theathers 
Also just right in front from the mall is bus líne "F" which takes to the piers like 33 that .takes you to alcatraz Island 
And also to Fishermans wharf 
The only problem we had in our room was the windows, the bathroom window would'nt stay open and If I try to open it would slam shut it! 
So dangerous that I smashed my finger! Im just glad it wasnt my son that smashed his finger  :(
Other wise everything else was excelent!

review.title: Jackpot find
review.reviewText: Upon looking through many hotels and reviews before booking our trip.. I found that most hotels shared complaints about thin walls, outside noise, room temp, and parking fees. Basically these are general issues when traveling to any bigger city and looking to find affordable rooms while staying in a great central location. Through reading reviews of this hotel and overlooking the general complaints and ultra nitpicky reviews, I went with my gut and a gamble and booked with Hotel Union Square. JACKPOT!!!!! Not only were the rooms very clean and upkept (great job of updating decor and room condition in what I'm sure is a vintage building), but the service was PERFECT!! Our late night checkin with Coffee(that's her name!!) was simple, smooth, and the room given to us was perfect! Yes room sizes aren't gigantic but you're in the city to explore and be out and about so get over it! Tom at Concierge helped us with bike rental information and discounts to bike the bridge and was always informative on places to eat/drink/coffee! Rooms were always clean, service staff upon encounter was always friendly and smiling! The hallways, decor, lobby, and walls gave the hotel an awesome urban boutique clean feel. Our last day we were assisted in booking shuttle to the airport and our bags were held safely while we did last minute shopping! We absolutely would stay again and again. Thank you to the great team at Hotel Union Square. Our experience with you was the PERFECT foundation for our trip

review.title: Great location, but tiny rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and the staff is nice. However, these attributes do not make up for a room do small you can barely walk between the foot of bed and wall-mounted TV. Bathrooms have been modernized, but not closets. Had to use flashlight to see clothes.

review.title: Very convenient for downtown SFO
review.reviewText:
I think as the other prior patrons have mentioned (see reviews in Trip Advisor/Yelp), there was street noise as our room faced the Ellis street- cable cars, trucks loading/unloading, some couple upstairs was 'at it' and we could hear the bed creaking pretty loudly but other than that the facilities, price point, etc. was just apt for the convenience of downtown. Although to be completely transparent- we'd read the reviews about the street noise,etc. and were offered an interior room which would have been quieter according to the staff member- but it was for an additional cost and we only wanted the room for a night, so we chose to take the street view room. My wife loved the street view and we were tired so the noise did not bother us after some time until we were woken up by this wonderful couple upstairs. :) 

TIP: You can park for half the money in the public parking just next door versus their parking of $45/$50 (for oversize cars). I parked in the public parking for the day we came in and almost 3/4th of the next day and paid $34.
review.positiveRemarks: Great ambience, very conveniently located to restaurants, shopping and transportation, reasonably priced, clean linen and room, courteous staff! Highl
review.negativeRemarks: The lights in the room could be improved and the 'perfume/freshner' that you use in the corridors could be a lot more classy than what it is now.

review.reviewText: The hotel was great and the staff was friendly, but I had a really hard time finding their parking lot and ended up having to park overnight in the O'Farrell / Ellis parking structure.

review.title: Hotel close to shopping centre
review.reviewText: My family like this hotel very much, because it is so convenience and you can get all type of food here and surrounding all shopping area, and easier access by bus to all famous places.
review.positiveRemarks: very convenience and staff is polite and helpful
review.negativeRemarks: to provide a small kettle for boiling water
review.locationRemarks: very good location

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

I am very sorry to hear that you were unsatisfied with the room that you were given. Rest assured the issues that were mentioned have been addressed. I hope you still consider staying at our hotel in the future. Thank you for taking the time to post a review, your feedback is greatly appreciated. Have a wonderful day.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Good location, terrible room
review.reviewText: Not a very functional bathroom, poor lighting, wall unit for heat and a/c very loud, probably due to tiny size of room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for your review about our hotel, your feedback is greatly appreciated. I am sorry that the room assigned to you didn't meet expectations. I hope that you contacted our staff to see if there was anything else we could do to accommodate you during your stay. Hopefully you'll consider us again on your next trip to San Francisco, we can manage to place you into an upgraded room due to the inconvenience that was caused during your last stay. Thank you for your time, have a wonderful day.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Great location and hotel Staff but rooms.... Ehhh
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was great, and location was right in the heart of Union square, but hotel room was more like a cubicle between not having any place to unpack my suitcase into, did not even have a mini fridge, sheets were dingy, I could hear my neighbors conversations. This hotel reminds me of the small hotels you find in Paris, great location but definitely does not inspire you to spend any more time in the room than you absolutely have to.
review.negativeRemarks: Room sizes, clean sheets, mini fridge
review.locationRemarks: The location was the best thing about the hotel. Close to all major shopping and eating

review.title: Union Square - I the middle of things
review.reviewText: All in all we had a great stay.  The hotel is in the heart of Union Square - 1 1.2 blocks from Powell and Market Cable Car turn around.  Very easy to get around from this location, walking, public transit its up to you.  Some things to be aware of, the hotel rooms are VERY small.  The Deluxe Queen that we started with, well the bathroom door couldn't be opened all the way as it hit the bed.  The "queen" bed did NOT seem like a real queen.  Having said that, if needed we could have managed for the 4 nights we were there.  We were able to upgrade to a suite (ended up with the Dugout Suite which was cool) with a King size bed with plenty of room!  Then only thing I would really caution against would be if you get a room without an air conditioner because while you may not need it weather wise you'll like it at night to block out the noise from the street below.
review.negativeRemarks: All rooms should have an air conditioner (for noise prevention if nothing else).  Their website should be VERY clear on the size of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, everything to do near by.

review.title: Excellent location at Union Square.
review.reviewText: Only stayed one night.  Old building, but the room was clean and updated, with a comfortable bed.  No air conditioning, but there was a powerful ceiling fan.  (Leave the windows open when you're not in the room to allow the cool San Francisco breeze to cool the room.)  The hotel owns the parking lot immediately adjacent.  The parking attendants were very friendly, and allowed us to park for 5 to 10 minutes at no charge while we ran upstairs to the room with our bags.  (Just leave them your keys and tip a couple bucks as a thank you.)

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for your review. I am sorry that you were unsatisfied with the cost of parking and our pet fee. Unfortunately parking rates in San Francisco are very high and we keep up with our neighboring parking facilities, most of which do not offer valet service with in and out privileges. I'm sure that you understand that the pet fee is necessary to maintain the cleanliness of our guest rooms. Nevertheless I hope you consider staying with us in the future. Thank you for your time.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Looks Great on the Outside
review.reviewText:
Found this hotel on expedia, and it was in the middle of Downtown, and it was pet friendly. I had my dog so this was thought to be perfect. The room was about $150 for one night. Paid that through expedia, then when we showed up come to find out Valet was $35 a night, then a $35 pet fee (they supposedly shampoo the rooms carpet after you have a pet in the room) 

I highly doubt they shampoo the carpets after guests with pets are in a room (there is no way the carpet would be dry in the 3 hours between check out and check in.

After forking out another $70 to park and to have our pet in the room. We go upstairs to our room...which turns out to barley fit the queen size bed. I walked into the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in my life. I had a bigger shower when I was deployed to Afghanistan...
review.positiveRemarks: The looks and feel of the hotel was nice.
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Golden Gate Bridge

review.reviewText: I was just at the hotel to sleep and didn't need anything special from the staff, but they were friendly at check-in and check-out, and the room was clean and neat.

review.title: Close to most everything ....
review.reviewText: The hotel is on Powell, one half block from the famed Cable car turntable which is a hot tourist spot.  You're also  less than 2 blocks from the Powell BART station which is convenient from the SFO airport.  Shops, store, restaurants and pubs abound in this area.  Plenty to do and see.  You're also 2 blocks from the Market Street Muni street cars which are a direct trip back in time.  They run up and down Market including up to the Castro area.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel has been updated quite nicely and is very comfortable and quiet (except for daytime cable car bells).  Smaller rooms but the bed was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Late check out is only 1 pm despite that fact that check in is 3 p.m. - anything else is an upcharge.  High priced water bottles in the room are crazy
review.locationRemarks: Eat, drink, sightsee, experience the city, shop and have fun.   Bring a sweater, it gets chilly in the late afternoon & evening.

review.title: Great location - if you get the right room
review.reviewText: Our first night we were "upgraded" by Alex to a king size bed on the 6th floor.  The whole floor was musty smelling, no air conditioner so we had to open the window - and it was therefore hard to sleep with all the street noise, and it was a miserable experience - I almost cancelled the remainder of my stay.  The remainder of the trip we had a room on the 4th floor with air conditioning.  A completely different, pleasant experience.  You can't beat the location!
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning in all rooms to improve air quality and provide white noise.  Ozone air cleaners on the 6th floor.
review.locationRemarks: SanFran at your fingertips - the cable cars run in front of the hotel.

review.title: Old building but reasonably priced for Union Sq
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Union Square for three nights in September.  It is an older building and it smells like one.  The furniture and finishing upgrades are nice and the staff is very helpful.  The location is terrific as you are so close to all the things that Union Square has to offer (proximity to shopping, restaurants, BART, street car, etc).  Overall I am happy with the experience but I wish there is some way for the hotel to take that old building feeling out.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you so much for staying with us at Hotel Union Square. We are so pleased that you enjoyed our friendly staff and had a great overall experience! We hope to see you on your next trip to San Francisco.

Best,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: The rooms are small but very we'll appointed
review.reviewText: I stayed one night and location was perfect. I thought the room although small was updated and pretty. Staff was very nice and attentive all in all I would stay there again.

review.title: Hotel with awful parking, humid rooms, no AC.
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for our first wedding anniversary this last weekend. This was hands down the worst experience we have had at any hotel. First of all, the hotel is located on literally the most congested street in The city. The parking situation is absolutely awful. You do not have much of a choice but to pay 45 dollars for valet parking overnight. 45 dollars to park your car is absolutely rediculous. The hotel rooms are the smallest room I have ever seen. The hotel was humid inside and the room do not have AC. We were sticky the whole entire trip. This hotel was not necessarily cheap either. We paid a total of 365.00 for the night. For this cost, I would expect to get a lot more than a bedroom that can barely even fit the bed. Awful experience.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for sharing your positive experience. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us and the beautiful surrounding city. We hope you will choose Hotel Union Square for your next stay in San Francisco.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: we enjoyed our stay at Union Square. pleasant surroundings.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff. We were very fortunate to have many dealings with Jewel, he was very knowledgeable about many things but most helpful.
review.locationRemarks: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Union Square. Perfect location for BART, tram, Union Square, shops and eating places.

review.title: Fantastic hotel, in a perfect location.
review.reviewText: It was an amazing experience!  The hotel was so quaint and the location was perfect.

review.title: Nice modernly styled hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Able to walk to cable car turn around and the muni station in less than 5 minutes. Staff was always pleasant and accommodating.  Loved the large corner room!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review online. We really appreciate the feedback, it's important to hear what our guest have to say about the hotel so we know what areas to improve. Our parking rates are based on the competition in the Union Square area. The parking garage in which you used offers a cheaper rate, however you cannot access your vehicle 24 hours and they do not offer unlimited in and out privileges. I am sorry that you're choosing not to stay with us again because of this, I do hope you change your mind.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Nice hotel but not for the price
review.reviewText:
The hotel was ok, with a comfortable room, and pleasant staff. 

My issue was the obscene cost of parking at their lot. $45 plus tax for over night untill 2pm. Luckily there was a garage next door that was vastly cheaper, ($34 for 24 hours) but being a business owner I think that ripping ppl off solely because you can is an awful business model and only damages other private businesses. For that reason I'll stay somewhere else next trip.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kim,

Thank you very much for your positive review and for choosing Hotel Union Square during your trip to San Francisco! We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Best,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Great hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in the heart of the San Francisco CBD.   The hotel is a bit dark inside and musty (almost has a creepy sense about it) but the location is great.  Highly recommend getting the executive suites, still reasonable price but the room is bigger. It can be a bit noisy with an outside window but you will be glad of the fresh air from the windows opening.  Must do is Extranomical Tours - City Insider tour - Leo was our guide and he was fantastic! Best city tour I've done.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge could be a bit more helpful on the cable car ticketing options, Alcatraz tours (book up to 45 days in advance!) etc but overall ok
review.locationRemarks: Walgreens across the road, Cable car junction down the corner, Macy's around the corner, Westfield shopping centre across road from cable car junction

managementResponses.response:
Dear JLB,

Thank you for your positive review! We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay (and happy hour) with us at Hotel Union Square. We hope you think of us on your next trip to San Francisco!

Warm Regards,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great hotel that is centrally located! Loved happy hour with the free wine!
review.negativeRemarks: The a/c was very noisy! They need central ari & the room was also very dark.
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location. Walk to all fun shops, restaurants & tourist attractions!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Barb and Doug,

Thank you for the glowing review! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your experience and the central location of Hotel Union Square. We hope to see you again on your next trip to San Francisco.

Warmly,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Nice hotel with great location.
review.reviewText: We were in walking distance to the big bus tours pickup and drop off.  Close to big mall down down where we eat a lot from the food court which  had a great amount of choices.' Close to train route for going to the Gaints ball game.
review.positiveRemarks: Location Location also we were lucky because our room was huge but we had book the executive room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jason,

Thank you for sharing your positive experience! We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you will choose Hotel Union Square for your next stay in San Francisco.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

Warmly,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Hotel in the middle of the action.
review.reviewText: We booked 3 rooms and stayed for 3 nights.  Cleaning staff were very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Only dissapointing thing was that 2 didn't have a fan or aircon, the other had both
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping, bus tours from Union Square.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Chris,

Thank you for sharing your positive review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay with us at Hotel Union Square. We hope you will think of us when planning your next trip to San Francisco!

Best,
Dana Andrews
Guest Relations

review.title: Nice hotel, central, decent value
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel. Close to Union Square and the cable car.
Overall stay was great. Not sure if this was hotel or not but both my husband and I woke up with swollen and itchy eyes. Maybe a ventilation issue?

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review about our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I thank you for voicing your concerns. I apologize for any inconvenience caused attempting to find our hotel. Being in the middle of the shopping district can cause for a heavy flow of traffic in this area. I truly hope this doesn't affect you returning to our hotel as we would we love to have you back. Thank you for your time.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.reviewText: Difficult to find.  The entrance is a single door, adjacent to a store that caters to young people.  As a result, small crowds of people were lingering outside, making it almost impossible to see the entrance.  No other ouside signage exists.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking lot leaves something to be desired.  Elevator very slow.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review about our hotel. Your feedback is greatly appreciated. I am sorry that a disturbance was caused during your stay due to the noise. One of the disadvantages of being centrally located is the heavy flow of traffic on our busy San Francisco streets. Be sure to ask about our interior rooms facing the inner courtyard which are much quieter. We hope that you will return to our hotel on your next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Outdated hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was located in convenient area, but Powell St. was a little too busy and noisy for our hotel room. The hotel was pretty outdated and our room was extremely small.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for your feedback. I am disappointed to hear about the room that you were in during your stay at our hotel. I hope that you mentioned this to our front desk/housekeeping staff so that we were able to follow up with the room that you were in. I'll be sure to address the issues you've mentioned as this is not a way we want to represent our hotel. I am glad that you are wiling to return to our hotel to give us a second chance, we hope to see you soon.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: THE best LOCATION, but room not completely clean
review.reviewText: Best location and best staff; all friendly, helpful and eager to help, especially Ruben. However, even though the rooms were painted and decorated nicely, the cleanliness was horrible. Carpets don't have that 'just vacuumed' feeling, and had stains, the drapes and the baseboards had week-old dust. Having said all that, I would STILL stay there again over any other hotel in Union Square because the location, price and staff make up for the 'over-looked' rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: more time spent detail cleaning the rooms

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for posting a review about our hotel. I apologize if the room you were placed in did not meet your standards. We have plenty of categories to choose from and one of our upgraded categories may help for a more comfortable stay. We look forward to your return, have a wonderful day.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Tiny rooms
review.reviewText: The beds were comfy and if all you looking for is a place to sleep then This will meet your needs. Very tiny rooms. It was clean and pleasant. Cute hotel but between my luggage and rolling briefcase it took up almost all the room that wasn't occupied by a bed or desk. It reminded me of a cruise ship room.
review.positiveRemarks: Wine in the evening. Live music in the lobby
review.negativeRemarks: Paint the rooms. Lots of luggage marks bc the room is so small
review.locationRemarks: Near the cable car starting point and tons of shipping.

review.title: Cozy and nice
review.reviewText: Not a room for hanging out. But if you need a nice place to lay your head and wash up that's centrally located, this place fits the bill. Kinda place the cool kids might stay, but the staff was very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was "just enough." Nothing was over the top.
review.negativeRemarks: Better lobby seating layout.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to Powell and Market, so you can easily walk to most of the shopping and dining in the area as well as access the cable cars.

review.title: Nice hotel close to shopping and other hotels
review.reviewText: Good people  - very accommodating.  Seemed to really care about my overall experience

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review about our hotel. I am glad that you chose our hotel, it seems like the location worked out perfectly for you. Please note that we do have a variety of rooms, on your next visit we can offer you one of our larger executive rooms which may help for a comfortable stay. I do apologize that we weren't able to offer you a late checkout, unfortunately this is subject to availability. Please contact us directly for your future visit and we will be more than happy to find a room that works for you. Thanks again.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Nice place, but the rooms are small...
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel because it was fairly convenient for the SF Marathon. It was a little more expensive than we would normally book, but the location was good. The concierge was friendly and helpful, and we did get an early check in. Unfortunately, there was no option for a late check out. We had to rush back after the half marathon to clean up and check out, which was disappointing. 

Everything is small. The lobby is small and the rooms are very small. Our room had a queen size bed, a small chair and side table, and nary a square foot of extra space. The bathroom was decent. The shower and toilet were amazingly quiet in use. The bed was very comfortable and they provided two pillows per person. Our room looked out onto the light well - no view at all. On the other hand, it was very quiet. We did not notice any noise in the halls or from outside.

For me, the size did not matter. We mainly wanted a comfortable place to sleep, and we got that. The main disappointment was the lack of late checkout.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Traveler,

Thank you for taking the time to post a review about our hotel. For the most part it sounds like you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. I apologize if the decor and hallways made for an uncomfortable feeling as that is definitely not our intention. Please keep in mind that we have a variety of room types at our hotel and would have been more than happy to accommodate you with a room that met your needs. If you return to San Francisco you may also want to consider one of our sister properties either at Hotel Diva or The Kensington park Hotel which would offer a different ambiance that may work for you. Let us know when you are back in town and we will figure it out. I hope you have a wonderful day.

Lennin B. Ledesma
Guest Services Manager

review.title: Great location, a bit eerie
review.reviewText: I visit San Francisco a few times a year and have stayed in many downtown hotels but this hotel was by far the most memorable hotel. The staff were extremely polite and professional and the lobby was modern, airy and comfortable. Exiting the elevator to my room floor was akin to being transported to a bygone era. The walls were a dark shade of red and very dimly lit. The original brick walls were exposed which was charming but walking through the long, darkly lit, narrow hallway to  my room was a bit uncomfortable. The room was clean but small and the closet door was stuck shut. The window opened to the Main Street which was a bit noisy But closing the window helped reduce the noise.
review.negativeRemarks: Brighter Lighting in the hallways leading to all rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great, close to all shopping and the famous Trolley cars

review.title: Perfect location for this boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Third stay in a few years. Very quiet despite being on Powell between Union Square and Market Street. $45 parking fee in the back, worth it though.
review.negativeRemarks: Fan in the bathroom?

managementResponses.response:
Hi Darren,

Thank you for choosing Hotel Union Square. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and apologize that you did not receive a room with an AC unit. All but 30 guest rooms are equipped with AC. We hope you will stay with us again and will make sure you get an air conditioned room.

Best Regards,
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location, friendly helpful staff. However no air conditioning which is one of the main reasons we chose the hotel!  Rooms were hot and one had no fan.

managementResponses.response:
Hi EJB,

Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at Hotel Union Square. We are so glad you enjoyed your stay with us and appreciate the helpful tips you shared with others. We hope you will choose Hotel Union Square for your next stay in San Francisco!

Kind Regards,
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
I read the reviews on this hotel and some things are true, some are not. 
Quirky hotel, with a lovely decor. The light fixtures cast shadows on the walls that make you think of Alice In Wonderland. 
Loved being so close to the Cable Car Turnaround, Bart Line and MUNI station. There is a Walgreens across the street that has a mini deli inside. Lots of fresh fruit, sandwiches, frozen yogurt and snacks. Also where you buy your transit passes which in comes in handy when the Cable Car is $6 dollars each way and a three day MUNI pass is only $23. 
Some people complained about the noise of the Cable Cars, I personally wasn't bothered. I was in a corner room at the front and you heard the odd bell, but it in no way kept me awake or woke me up at any time. 
The staff were friendly and welcoming and made for an easy check in and check out. We had three people in our room and when we requested extra blankets (someone had the A/C cranked) they were brought up quickly and were nice fleecy blankets.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and decor. Love the light fixtures in the hallways.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds could be softer. Also mounting the toilet paper roll only a few inches off the ground not a great idea.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Cable Car, Cheesecake Factory. Catching a MUNI down to the beach near Golden Gate Park. Easy Car Rental near by, China Town very close

review.title: No windows and a malfunctioning shower
review.reviewText: This is a cute boutique hotel.  Staff is very friendly.  The day I was there they had wine and live music for a happy hour, which was very welcome after a long work day.  Location is good too.  My room was on the inside and had no windows.  Also, long and narrow.  Even though I was there to sleep, it was a little disconcerting.  The portable (not built in) A/C had to run full-time to keep the room bearable.  What was most concerning is that when I switched the valve from tub faucet to shower head only the hot water switched.  Cold continued to flow from the faucet.  I nearly scalded myself.  Couldn't get it to work right so my shower was cut pretty short!
review.negativeRemarks: Room -- was it a converted storage space?  Airflow.  Definitely the plumbing!
review.locationRemarks: In the middle of it all.

review.title: Nice and  place , centrally located
review.reviewText: Was great, friendly helpful staff. Very clean rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Its unusual decor really classy. Staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Co-ordination between front desk and room services. When 2 persons check in instead of one, toiletries are to be added to facilate both not one person
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping

review.title: Nice hotel on Powell street
review.reviewText:
This is a nice hotel with easy access to a lot of things in central SanFran. Close to Union Square, right next to the Cable Car, tons of shopping, dining, and drinking establishments. Very close to the Muni/BART system as well.
Rooms are definitely on the small side but very comfortable.
Staff is very friendly.
The one downside was that the Valet parking was very expensive.
The location was excellent, and service staff were very professional and helpful. My room was hidden at the end of long dark path, which offered equal amounts of "Cool" and "Creepy"

review.title: nice hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Great location and  staff. Noisy due to street car turnaround, and general late night debauchery, but with the AC on it wasn't a bother

managementResponses.response:
Hi Tom,

Thank you so much for choosing Hotel Union Square during your trip to San Francisco. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and all the restaurants and attractions nearby. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Best Regards,
Megan Brandt
Guest Relations

review.title: San Francisco Convenient Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights on our first visit to San Fran. Extremely convenient hotel near cable car, trolley route, bus routes. Union Square is only 2 blocks away. Located near several good restaurants, including some which are very reasonably priced for SF. Helpful staff. Only real drawback is the $40 per day for parking onsite. Not a problem if one uses public transportation which we will do if only visiting San Fran in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenience and helpful staff, esp the concierge, Ruben.
review.negativeRemarks: Offer offsite parking at a more reasonable fee.
review.locationRemarks: Too much to list. Take the cable car to Fishermens' Wharf where there are many excellent restaurants, shops, an aquarium and more.

review.title: Great, central location, could use facs lift thoug
review.reviewText: Great central location just around the corner from Union Square. The room could use a face lift though. Seemed tired and updated with a strange smell. Cooling was evaporative so was not all that effective. Bathroom was quite small.
review.positiveRemarks: Great central location near Union Square, opposite Walgreens, right near main hop on/hop off stop, Westfield shopping mall. Fisherman's wharf walkable
review.negativeRemarks: Poor wifi, room decor old and outdated, in need of facelift. Cooling was ineffective evaporative. Bathroom was very small.
review.locationRemarks: Central Union Square location close to shops, good restaurants, public transport. Walkable distance to Fisherman's Wharf.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Gerard,

Thank you for leaving a comment about your stay with us. It seems that we did not completely meet your expectations and I am sorry about that.
We are a boutique hotel and therefore we have a wide variety of room types. If our guests express the need for a bigger room we always try to fine the right solution. It is also true that we don't have a bar or a restaurant but Tad's next door does our room service and we are in walking distance of tens of restaurants and bars as we are in the heart of Union Square.
I am sorry that you feel like you didn't receive proper service at the Front Desk, It does happen at certain hours for the Front Desk agent to be alone.
I hope you had a good stay in San Francisco nevertheless.

Best regards

review.title: Limited and not a 3 star
review.reviewText:
Facilities are limited. There is no restaurant, no bar etc. Room was very small and basic.Reception was undermanned, only one person to handle everything.
Expedia rates this as 3.5 stars...... I purchased it without knowing the name of the property, I will NOT do this again.
review.negativeRemarks: Reception, size of rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of town: but because of that, it is difficult to get to by taxi and for get about parking.

review.title: Great lication
review.reviewText:
No breakfast incluided
Very nice rooms
Confortable beds, clean rooms, needs a little bit more light
No safe box

managementResponses.response:
Dear Casey,

I am sincerely sorry you had a bad experience, but it seems that you left a comment for the wrong hotel. This is Hotel Union Square in San Francisco and it looks like you are talking about a hotel in New York.
If you were to come to San Francisco we would be happy to accommodate you and make sure that you have a great stay.

Kind regards,

review.title: Good Location, Service Leaves Much to Be Desired
review.reviewText:
We booked the hotel at the last minute due to position. Location was good, opposite Madison Square Garden and a short walk to Times Square. That is probably where the compliments end. When we checked in we were greeted by a lady at the counter who barely looked at us and instead was joking and chatting to the person working beside her and then kept walking away while looking for a room for us (after waiting a considerable time in the line). The room was very small, just a bed and a bathroom and old school TV. There is no fridge or amenities in room one flat pillow per person, you pay fo WiFi and to store bags after you check out. The book of what to do in New York in the drawer was printed in the 90's like all of the furniture and the bed look not entirely clean.
Staff at "Help" desk gave us incorrect or not accurate information in transport and also Broadway tickets, we got slightly more info from the men haggling on the street. Trying to check out the attendant was again quite rude and after we ducked up to the room at 12.02pm (2 minutes after check out) we were charged an additional $100 later for a late check out fee. After we had just left a really nice and helpful place this was a massive let down and after all the additional charges was not cheap enough for what they offered and the room. Would not recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Good Location close to Times Square and Madison Square Garden as well as Subway lines.
review.negativeRemarks: Service and attitude of the staff on almost all occasions whoever it was that served us was rude and unattentive and did not give good info. And rooms
review.locationRemarks: Location is across the road from Madison Square Garden, and a main Subway Station. It is also a pretty short walk to Times Square and bus tours etc.

review.title: Excellent location, but my room was very noisy
review.reviewText:
Overall experience was ok.
Room small but comfortable.
The big con was I could hear the noises from the street and the cable cars.
Location is the best of the hotel.
Price was fair.

review.title: Room 207
review.reviewText: It is such a beatiful hotel with so much history and nicely remodeled. Close to everything in downtown San Fran as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The look and the history of the place
review.locationRemarks: lot's of shopping and restraunts nearby

review.title: Centrally located and wonderful
review.reviewText: The staff was super friendly and helpful. The beds, pillows, towels and every other amenity were totally comfortable. Morning coffee was delicious, as was the wine served between 5-6 in the evening. Contrary to some other review, street facing rooms were not noisy during the night, since cable car bells ended in the evening and didn't start until about 7ish in the morning. The black out curtains also kept the room quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: My 10 year old grandson, who has been to Vegas and NY kept saying "I love this hotel". I agree for all of the above.
review.negativeRemarks: An additional waste paper basket.
review.locationRemarks: Directly across the street is a "Super Walgreen" which is devoted to good and healthy snacks at a reasonable price.

managementResponses.response:

Warm Regards
Domitille Montoro

review.title: Excellent staff, location
review.reviewText:
Fantastic stay, love their staff (coffee, jewel!!), excellent location, close to everything, 2 streets to Union square, Niketown, across there is Uniglo, Wallgreens, 2 doors away there is H&M, Thai restaurant next to the hotel serves great noodles (not the rice though).
My only complaint - room too dark
Otherwise is 5/5

managementResponses.response:
Dear Melissa,

Thank you for taking the time of writing a comment about your stay, I am disappointed to read that you did not feel comfortable staying with us. I understand your discomfort but I wish you would have tried a different room type that you would have felt comfortable into.
Our hotel is more than a 100 years old and we do have very different room types.

Best regards

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: I was booked for three nights at the Hotel Union Square, my first time at this hotel though I travel frequently to the Bay area and stay in Union square several times per year. I am a fan of boutique hotels and prefer them to the big chains. I knew as soon as I got to the room that I didn't like this hotel. The room had a horrible musty smell and was so dark. I was in a large room on the 6th floor, facing away from the street so noise was not an issue. The furnishings in the room were shabby - the couch and chair were dirty - though the bathroom was fine and the shower was great. The worst part was the bed - I think that's where the musty smell was coming from! The mattress smelled, the sheets were terrible and I was itchy the entire night! I didn't sleep a wink. Although I didn't see bugs in the bed - I did check - I felt like something was crawling all over me the whole night. It was also hot in the room - and then too cold - because the window air conditioner did not have a temperature sensor. I checked out and moved to another hotel the following morning. The front desk person did offer me an upgrade but I just couldn't stomach sleeping there another night. For the same price I moved to the Hotel Nikko, just around the block and I felt like I was in paradise. I realize there is something to be said about the predictability of a large chain hotel. Do yourself a favor and don't stay at the Hotel Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: New mattresses, new sheets, new furniture, better air circulation/ temperature regulating system.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The room was a little small, but overall, clean and nice. Location was great. Staff helpful and nice.
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping

review.title: Personality Hotel captures hotel's essence
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a central location within the shopping district, only a block or two from Union Square, near various forms of transit. The staff was courteous and friendly. They were kind and happy to oblige us when we requested to upgrade our room to increase space.
review.negativeRemarks: The title of the "Queen Deluxe" room was a little misleading. We barely had space to walk around the bed or turn around in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was central to shopping, the streetcar turnaround, and various other forms of transit to take you anywhere throughout the city.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Melissa,

Thank you for staying with us at Hotel Union Square, and to share you experience with us. It is very important for us to know how your experience was, in order to know what we could improve. We hope to see you again during your future visits to San Francisco.

Warm Regards
Domitille Montoro
Hotel Manager

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was quite satisfied with the room and hotel as a whole. There was a spinning chair in our room, which was a fun surprise, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Rate was a tad pricey, but the location is unmatched in the heart of shopping and the city, so it was easy to travel. One thing I didn't like was the low flow showerhead-less water pressure than I needed to shower proper, for me personally. But overall, great stay.

review.title: Great location but overpriced
review.reviewText:
Although Hotel Union Square has an excellent location, the room I stayed in was incredibly small and a major disappointment for the price I paid. Bathroom and work desk space was also not up to par. Flimsy work desk chair too. Security lock didn't work either and it took me an average of 12 TIMES to enable the room key/card to work.

Photos of the room are very misleading - no frills, no robe - can use a better description

Being a native Northern Californian, I stayed in several hotels in San Francisco but decided to try something different. Needless to say, I will not be coming back to this hotel. Front desk service was also below par.

Room Tip: Definitely make sure you know what you're getting with the "No Frills Double". Also consider parking at the Ellis-O'Farrell Parking Garage for a safer environment and better rate (save $8 over 24 hours)
review.negativeRemarks: Get front desk staff that's friendly and helpful. Expand hotel room information and add photos that aren't misleading. Upgrade card key system.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is the city center for upscale shopping. Chinatown is about a 20 or 30 minute walk away. Market Street is also not far away.

managementResponses.response:
Hi Lisa,

Thank very much for your review and for choosing Hotel Union Square during your trip to San Francisco.

We look forward on welcoming you again in the near future

Warm Regards
Domitille Montoro
Hotel Manager

review.title: Great hotel! Excellent location
review.reviewText: Able to walk to restarunts and shopping. Would stay here again

managementResponses.response:

review.title: In the middle of it all
review.reviewText: Great hotel in an amazing location. The cable car runs right in front of the hotel. 5 minute walk to union square. The location is perfect! The hotel itself is great! They call themselves a "personality hotel" and I think that is a perfect description. The building itself is very old which makes the lay out of the hotel super cool. The rooms are very nice with all the accommodations you need. The rooms are tiny and the bathroom is even smaller, but your in San Francisco and so the amount of time spent in the room was minimal anyway! The decor was very modern and was very well taken care of! I hope to return to San Fran again someday, and I will definitely stay here again!!
review.positiveRemarks: This is a boutique hotel! It is very unique and unlike any "chain" hotel you would stay in.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge who was there the first day we checked in was not very friendly at all!
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect!! 2 minute walk to all major public transportation options including the Bart, cable cars, and buses....

review.title: Nice hotel very central -
review.reviewText: Very central location, beautiful decor however internet (wifi ) very very slow at times

review.title: Old hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Reception was friendly. Good location for bus and cable car. We got the room on 3rd floor and there was bad smell overall in the floor and really bad in the room. we are not sure it was due to the fact washroom window was opened when we got the room. The sink in the washroom is very small. Beds were comfortable...
review.positiveRemarks: Good location Good beds Friendly reception
review.negativeRemarks: Sink is very small smell on the room and floor ( 3rd floor)
review.locationRemarks: near cable car and bus for major attractions.

review.title: Perfect location in the heart of San Fran
review.reviewText: Amazing location, in the heart of San Fran city centre. Right next to all the major shops and shopping centres with good proximity to restaurants - everything you need.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Best option for shoppers and travelers with family
review.reviewText:
Best experience more than my expectation. Shopping, eating, transport, speak for any thing it's near by.
Highly recommended for Indian, Pakistani folks as food is within walking distance.

review.title: Great view and comfy stay
review.reviewText: Even though we checked in late our stay and experience was more than expected! The night life twas rather quite alive which we thought was interesting and fun, but might not be for people with hobophobia despite the 24 hr diners. During the day there are these touring karts you can drive around in which looked really fun and if you can't find parking there is a garage that's ~22 a day.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is stuck between shops in Union Square. You might miss it, but it is in a great location. The rooms are small, but clean and quiet. I was there for business and it was a perfect hotel.

review.title: City
review.reviewText: Loved our room!We stayed on the top floor and asked for a city view which was awesome!We will be returning! the wine reception at our 5:00 to 6:00 pm everyday was nice.

review.title: Great Location Downtown, Nice Room
review.reviewText: Very Friendly Staff, Clean, Quiet Room, Free Wine!

review.title: Great location but terrible comfort

service with a little more attention to detail. Good Wi-Fi connections.
Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business or pleasure!
review.positiveRemarks: The age of the hotel, architecture, the quaint rooms, great managers happy hour, and a very comfortable bed which made for good sleeping.

review.locationRemarks: In the heart of San Francisco, within short walk to all transit options, access to all shopping, entertainment and fabulous restaurants downtown.

review.title: A surprisingly small room with big character

The decor and layout of the rooms are a perfect combination of vintage and modern themes. Customer service was excellent.

review.title: Close to shopping and Union Square of course

Parking is convenient and good rates considering what other garages are charging. There is valet too

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location - close to shops, main streets, Union Square and the trains station. We were able to walk to the train station to get to and from the airport to the hotel and save on cab fees.
Hotel Union Square had a fantastic and helpful staff and offered free wifi. The hotel was clean and the beds comfortable. this hotel is very well priced for its location and quality. Will definitely stay at again.

review.reviewText: Check in at 3 staff very friendly and helpful. First room was too small so I call front desk if there was another room available my window was facing another room and i can see what my neighbor was doing not so cool. When i walk towards the window i was actually going up and then when i walk towards the restroom i was going down But thank god the bed was leve becuase i didnt roll to my side because i slept fine beside the city noise. beside the uneven floor the shower head was awesome and staff were friendly. btw room 606 try to stay away. lol I stay here before but never had this problem but first time booking with expedia so i really dont know what happen.
review.positiveRemarks: the atmosphere is awesome here shopping, music right in the middle of union square cant really go wrong with staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: post the size room will be nice for people that cant really stay in small rooms.
review.locationRemarks: mall, food, clubs etc

review.title: WIll Stay Again
review.reviewText: This is my second time staying at this hotel and I love that its so convenient for everything. You walk out and all the shopping is in front of your face. I also like that just around the corner you can find a bar or club to have some fun. Starbucks right on the corner. The hotel is currently going through some renovations and I'm excited to see how it will turn out to look. I will be welcoming the year there in a couple weeks.
review.negativeRemarks: The look, but they are working on it!!
review.locationRemarks: Clubs, bars, restaurants, coffee shops and of course shopping!!

review.title: Accommodations for Dreamforce13
review.reviewText:
My weeks' stay at the hotel to attend the dreamforce conference was enjoyable, for the following reasons:
- location of the hotel to the conference session's multiple location
- friendly staff at the hotel
- comfort of the room, wonderful housekeeping services
- exceptional help in the right time to get a taxi out of the city on Thursday when so many people were leaving
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very well appointed and housekeeping did a wonderful job The rates fit into my company's dreamforce budget Staff was great

Towels smelled and were coarse/old
Noisy
Difficult to get a cab due to location on busy narrow street
review.positiveRemarks: Geographic location good, interesting old architecture
review.negativeRemarks: Service at front desk and cleaning staff. Better towels.
review.locationRemarks: Good restaurants, site seeing nearby, excellent shopping closeby

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, but the rooms are quite small. That isn't an issue for me, because I spend little time in the room. The location cannot be beat, and the price is right. The wine reception in the lobby each afternoon is a bonus. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: You're paying for a great location.
review.reviewText: Room was labeled something like "deluxe king suite room" which turned out to be mostly branding. The room was about 12 ft by 12 ft with a small bathroom attached. Almost not enough room to unfold the ironing board. Hotel was clean and decorated well. I also liked the free wine and music downstairs in the lobby around 5 PMs. That said, the room was not comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: size of rooms. Also, they were doing construction in the lobby during the day which made it look like a mess and made the elevators inoperable
review.locationRemarks: It is close to everything in Union Square.

review.reviewText: This hotel was great. The mix of the modern renovations with the historic architecture give this place a lot of character and comfort. As it's located right in the middle of downtown, it stays pretty noisy but there's plenty to do around you. The complimentary wine tasting was a treat, as well as the complimentary coffee the next morning! The staff were all very friendly and helpful.

review.title: City meeting and turism
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice. The staff friend and very well located. The concierge service helped a lot for asking information about routes, dinning, museums, etc.
The only problem is that the room was very little, and only one side of the queen bed had night table. But the room next to us was bigger, a lot bigger. No view from the window.
The closet was very big but without light, so is was uncomfortble looking for your things.
The bathroom great. Great shampoo brands, good hairdryer, bathtub. And very clean.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, clean. Vine in the afternoon!
review.negativeRemarks: Light in the closet, and night table in both sides of the bed.
review.locationRemarks: Located in Powell street, 1 block away from union square, walking distance from Moscone Center and museums. Right next to the cable car, Bart station.

review.title: Great hotel close to downtown
review.reviewText: I had a great experience with Hotel Union Square. I originally booked a room with one queen bed and a roll-a-way. When I called to confirm the roll-a-way bed, they offered to upgrade me to a room with two double beds, which is what I wanted anyway. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the decor of the hotel was cute.
review.positiveRemarks: The central location to Union Square, the Cable car, shopping, and the Walgreens was great.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is in the perfect location with tons of shopping nearby, Union Square just a block or two away, and the Cable Car line right outside.

review.title: Location Location Location.
review.reviewText: You can't beat it, everything with in blocks. Shopping, wonderful restaurants, transportation, Union Square, and china town. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.

I hope that you will return to Hotel Union Square soon.

Best regards,

Overall we love this hotel and would highly recommend this hotel to everyone

review.title: Not what I expected ;-(
review.reviewText: I thought I found a good room for a good price. The minute I walked in the hotel I knew I wasn't going to like it, unfortunately. Hotel is dark, not kept up, example carpeting dirty and smells musty. Our room smelled like a small animals cage. The faucets in the bathroom were new and modern but again place wasn't clean, grout in shower was full of mildew. All I could think was that we were going to experience bed bugs, and thank goodness we didn't. I really wanted it to be nicer. The front desk lady gave us bad direction with the public transit, if you don't know than just say sorry I don't know how to get you there and I would accept it but would be disappointed.
review.negativeRemarks: On the up keep. Clean!!!
review.locationRemarks: Location is center, easy to get around, transportation is all around the area within walking. Tons of shopping and fast food.

review.title: This was not at all what our team expected.
review.reviewText: This was very disappointing. To the point where one of our team members was so discussed he had to check out. If you plan on trying to charge us a cancellation fee after the way he was treated we will try to fight it. Another person was woken up by sanding at 2:30 am and then after he asked the staff to stop they started hammers. So disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything.

review.title: Close to everywhere
review.reviewText: We stayed for 10 days. Everything was good, except the room service was keep bothering us, what time we will leave our room. We usually go out around 10 am. One time because not many guest in our floor, she told me that she likes to do early. One morning around 8 am, the room service opened our room when we're still sleeping. Maybe she knocked the door, but we didn't hear, because we're still sleeping. Apparently woke me up, because when she opened the door, the door hit the closet door very loud.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice stay with excellent staff. Close to cable car station, Chinatown, and many options for public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a little bit more light, I think it's a little bit too dark.
review.locationRemarks: So many location close by to the hotel. Restaurant and shopping mall, public transportation

Dear Mel oh,

We would be honored to have you back next time you come to San Francisco.

Best regards

review.title: Close to all transport
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. Great free wine and music in lobby at 5pm - good way to relax before heading out to dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: Family feel to the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff.u
review.locationRemarks: Union square is one block away. Tram cars are on the street outside the hotel.

review.title: Great Accommodation centrally located.
review.reviewText: Great place situated centrally for ease of access to shopping, entertainment and transport.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly staff, Clean and modern rooms with excellent facilities including free Wi Fi.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for this great 5 star review, and for pointing out our staff's helpfulness and kindness, this is the best reward for all of us.

review.title: Convienient location.
review.reviewText: We had a great time. Staff was helpful and kind. We would definitely stay at this same hotel next time we visit San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Our rooms were not always restocked with shampoo, coffee and soaps. Once we had to go to the front desk to pick these items up.
review.locationRemarks: Several stores located within walking distance. Union square was fun to visit in the evenings for entertainment. Museums, restaurants with in walkin

review.title: Good location. So-so hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in a great location, right on the line with the cable cars and easy walk around the city. Room was less than expected and average at best. Seemed like a dorm room in Ikea chic.

No ironing board in my room. They did bring one. The other person traveling with me said his room had one of those small ironing boards.

The hotel rooms and halls have an odd smell--not stinky, just different. They do have incense in the rooms which may be the cause of the lingering smell. Also may be an issue with people affected by the smell of incense.

Bathroom was massive. Could have washed a Shetland pony in there (which may have happened in San Fran). But with all that room, no place to put your own stuff like cosmetics bag and tooth brushes.

The room worked for a quick trip to the city, but for the price and compared to the competition (which I've stayed at) I'd opt to not go there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Ironing boards that are for human clothes and not Barbie clothes. Hotel has odd smell.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Excellent staff. Everyone was very helpful

review.title: Decent hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location for shopping, dinning and transportation. The cable car turnaround is right around the corner and you can pick up the trolley by walking one block. There is no shortage on restaurants anywhere in San Francisco but definitely not in Union Square. The hotel was quaint and surrounded by history which was pretty cool. Our room was small. The bathroom door could not open all the way because the bed was in the way. It had a large closet but no dresser so we used our suitcases. There was a window air conditioner and the bathroom was a nice size but no where to put your bath articles except a glass shelf above the toilet. We would stay at The Hotel Union Square again because of the location and we would recommend it to our friends.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great. It is close to the cable cars and trolley's. The history og the hotel was cool.
review.negativeRemarks: Somewhere to put your clothes and bathroom articles would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Great location it is right in the heart of the shopping district. Walking is a must in San Francisco. China Town is not too far to walk.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very pleasant, live music in the lounge, loved the style of the hotel, old fashioned. Easy access to the trolley and BART. I would love to go back here and stay longer.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the old fashioned style
review.negativeRemarks: We were very satisfied
review.locationRemarks: Steakhouse, The Cheesecake Factory, the fanciest Walgeens we've ever seen with fresh squeezed orange juice, and within walking distance to rent a car

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kitty,

Thank you for leaving a comment about your stay with us. I am sincerely sorry that the service wasn't what it is supposed to be and did not respect our standards. Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention, I will definitely address them with our General Housekeeper to make sure it doesn't happen in the future.
I hope that you might consider giving us a second chance and stay with us next time you come to San Francisco.

Best Regards

review.title: Great location and great price
review.reviewText:
You really can't beat the location nor the price of the Hotel Union Square. Still, I can't recommend it because of the laziness of the housekeeping staff. Yes, my bed was made daily, but in all the hotels I've stayed in over the years I've never seen mold on a shower curtain until now. My used wash cloth and used drinking cup were never replaced. I purposely left the bathroom in disarray one day to see if they would even bother to tidy it up... nope.

The concierge was great, as was the gal behind the reception desk, but there are so many other hotels around the area that I'm sure you could find a better one without trying too hard.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping needs to be more detailed when cleaning!
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car station is 1/2 a block away, Hop-On/Hop-Off tours are down the street, tons of great shopping and great restaurants!

review.title: Good Find!
review.reviewText: Staff were very welcoming from the get go! The location of this hotel is amazing. It is close to the rapid transit system, the famous cable car, and ample shopping including high end and a favourite, Macy's! Our room was smallish for three but we managed. It is clean, comfortable, and modern...we liked it very much!

review.title: Heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Love this hotel so much! Stayed 5 nights and so wish it could have been longer. Small, safe, quaint. Everything we could have wanted or needed and then some.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: Location was right in heart of Union Square just steps from wonderful restaurants and great shopping. One block from Cable Car "starting" route.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, the staff were helpul and polite.Excellent location.

review.title: Great hotel in a fabulous location in Union Square
review.reviewText: This hotel is one I would stay at again! The room and hotel were clean. The hotel staff was great from check-in to check out. They were able to assist with most anything we asked about during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great! The bedding and mattress were awesome and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! The hotel is close to great shopping and any form of public transportation you wish to use (rail, cable car, and bus).

managementResponses.response:
Dear Sandi,

Thank you for giving us a 4 star review. It always a pleasure to know that our guests had a good stay with us,
I am sorry that one of our staff wasn't as helpful and friendly as the rest of the team, thank you for bringing this to my attention. I will address the issue.
We hope that you might consider staying with us in the future.

Kind Regards,

review.title: Very Nice spot!
review.reviewText: Very nice, clean, modern rooms. We loved the central location for a decent price. All but one of the front desk staff however were not helpful, rude, looked tired...which was particularly off-putting.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff not helpful
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time. Hotel was clean, modern, and in a great location.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for choosing Hotel Union Square to celebrate your 30th anniversary! We are really happy that you had a great stay with us for that occasion.
We are looking forward to celebrating more anniversaries with you.

Kind Regards,

review.title: In the middle of it all!
review.reviewText: Took my wife there for her 30th surprise birthday. Staff was great with getting me checked in quickly and the wine in the lobby was awesome! Some nice live music gave it a cozy feel with the other guests sipping their wine throughout the lobby. Our room was very nice- somewhat modern feel. Quiet (not street side) at night and no disturbances from house keeping the next morning.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was not the greatest since they do charge but the O'Farrel garage is right next door. Only $16 overnight.
review.locationRemarks: Great restaurant Puccini Pinnetti just around the corner and shopping galore! Get on the Trolly right there and take a ride over the hill.

review.title: Great Location. Horrible bed.
review.reviewText: Great location. Beds are way too soft for a nice hotel. They are all Futon like beds with no box springs
review.negativeRemarks: Beds. Windows were stuck shut with old paint

review.title: small room, but convenient location
review.reviewText: Room was small and pretty bare bones, but comfortable. Hotel was in a really convenient location, very much set up for tourists, walking distance to everything. The staff was helpful and pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom was cramped. Not a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located on Powell street, near downtown.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Boutique hotel, helpful staff, convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms and bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Powell-Hyde cable car, great shopping, access to other transportation.

review.title: Not a bad hotel
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel at a reasonable price, close to the airport, near main attractions within walking distance or public transportation. The only negative with this hotel is the size of the bathroom and the sink.
review.positiveRemarks: I think it is a very nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the size of the sink in the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: As mentioned above the location is ideal for sites outside and inside the city.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The location was perfect but I was disappointed with the room. Carpet was torn and window broken in the bathroom. I was there for a week and told them on day one that I wasn't happy but no offer was made to change rooms. I had expected better.
review.negativeRemarks: Below par room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for transport, shopping, restaurants.

review.title: Misleading pictures.....unpleasant odor.
review.reviewText: Great location. Pictures are very misleading........the room was more like the ugly stepsister to the room pictured on the web. We chose the 'delux king' and expected something much nicer. The closet smelled like an old rest home and our clothes acted like a spong soaking that smell in. We made a game of holding our breath before opening the closet door.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness and smell! Lighting is terrible.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great! Close to everything we wanted to see!

review.title: Convenient and Reasonable, but not luxury
review.reviewText: The hotel is convenient to downtown, but the room was noisy and had no dresser or hangers in the closet. Rooms were not ready when guests arrived ---after check-in time---and guest after guest was told that they would have to wait. Staff was polite and apologetic, but it was not very professional to have people lining up in the lobby waiting for rooms. Rooms are updated and clean, but without air conditioning. Having the windows open made it noisy with downtown traffic and construction. It is a stones throw from Union Square and all that the area has to offer.
review.negativeRemarks: Check-in preparation and processing
review.locationRemarks: Many of the things to do in San Francisco are close. China Town is a few blocks. The Wharf is only a few miles. Great shopping is just outside the doo

review.title: 3 nights in frisco
review.reviewText: hotel had beautiful rooms although some small booked a double room we were not offered queen beds thru expedia and when we arrived the room was quie small for 3 people we tried to move to a queen room but none left for our entire stay we moved to a king room and had a rollaway brought in the room was very nice at an additional cost of 104 dollars
review.positiveRemarks: location one block from union square.. great steak next door
review.negativeRemarks: na
review.locationRemarks: na

review.title: Center of San Fran
review.reviewText: We spend five days here and enjoyed our stay. The room was a bit small but comfortable. The location is great, steps away from the Bart, the Cable Cars, and other buses and transportation. There is shopping and eating all around.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast, rather than just coffee and tea would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and dining and transportation are all near by.

review.title: Unique at Union Square
review.reviewText:
First time to San Fran for me and hubby. There is not a better location for your stay I must say. Room was very simple, but it was very clean and quiet. Didn't hear or see others in the hall. Others mentioned dark halls which I thought had a nice romantic ambiance to the place. Ceiling fan was super quiet and bed was comfy. Concierge staff were extremely helpful and never pushy.

Will stay here on our next visit.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping within a mile or less. Variety of transportation to get all over the city available within minutes.

review.title: Prime location
review.reviewText: I love everything about this hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Extremely close to great restaurants, public transportation and tourist attractions. Highly recommended!
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was exquisite.
review.locationRemarks: Near union square, the embarcadero, many clubs and bars and soooo much good food!

review.title: San Fran Central
