review.reviewText: Really central, comfy. Had a street facing room, but was still quite. comfortable bed but tiny bathroom. staff very helpful

review.title: Great Location, Tight Fit
review.reviewText: Room was clean and staff were very friendly and knowledgable. Ease of taxi and cable car access was very good. Room was incredibly small, with shower and toilet together, sink outside of bathroom (literally right beside the television). This, in its own right, would not be an issue, but the fact that there was no bathroom counter space (only a sink) and that my wife has A LOT of "getting ready for the day" accessories, made preparation very inconvenient. Also, we had an third floor interior room facing the "very near" other side of the hotel, which did not allow exterior light to reach us--it seemed like midnight 24 hours a day. In total, the room was depressing. Definitely will not stay in this hotel on our next visit to SF.

review.title: Fantastic location, elegant rooms
review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms, FANTASTIC location, very friendly staff. Overall comfortable, non-stress stay. No breakfast but the area is full of places to eat for any budget so that's not a problem.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: 1 minute walking from Union Square, lots of shops, cafe and restaurants around, and a short walk to Chinatown

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: A bit noisey from street but overall nice boutique hotel
review.locationRemarks: Cable car very stone throw away. Great supermarket across the road. Union square short walk

review.title: Right in union square area. Easy walk to square
review.reviewText: Free wine social was nice. Friendly staff. Only thing we found wrong was iron didn't work

review.title: Fantastic location.
review.reviewText: Was a fantastic place to stay. Location was amazing and room was exactly like descriptions and photos.
review.negativeRemarks: Five people max in elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Amazing.

review.title: Wonderful hotel right in the middle of the city.
review.reviewText: We were looking for a close hotel in downtown next to Bart so we didn't have to drive into the city. We haven't stayed here before but we were pleasantly surprised to find this tucked away gem. The rooms we a little small but very comfortable for two. There is alway free coffee, juice, and water in the morning with them having free small selection wine tasting after 5 on the weekends. My wife and I will stay here on our next adventure to SF again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was a main selling point for me. They were all very helpful and professional. The second was how quiet it was inside the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The size of our room was smaller than other places we have stayed out side the bay, but you can't just move a wall in a place where space is limited.
review.locationRemarks: It's placed right around the cable car turnaround on Powell St, so the city is at your finger tips.

review.title: Worth it for the location alone...
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel based on the location and reviews. I was traveling alone and visiting friends so I wanted something close to Union Square so I could shop and get around easily when I was on my own. The hotel was super helpful with an early arrival and the room was perfect. Bigger than I would have expected for a boutique hotel in an old building. Cute decor and ambiance, only wish the halls were more well-lit. Great amenities and very comfortable... Watch out for the bed frames though, ouch! Concierge was very helpful as well and the use of the business center was super helpful as well. I would definitely recommend this property!!!
review.negativeRemarks: More lights in the halls.
review.locationRemarks: Right in Union Square by all the shops and restaurants.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Great location. Off off powell and ellis. Right in the heart of union square. The cable cars statt here. The metro is across the street. Market street is a block or two. All access. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Rooms are small but comfortable. We faced Powell street and thought it would be noisy but surprised it wasnt. We have stayed at many of yhe hotels in ssn Francisco and we give this one a 4 out of 5.
review.locationRemarks: Metro,/muni cable cars, shopping, great food, and the great energy of the city right outside your window

review.title: not bad for 100 years old hotel
review.reviewText: The only problem of the hotel is no air-conditioning in my room and it's very noise during the night
review.negativeRemarks: Services
review.locationRemarks: Just 5 Miss walk from Powell Bart station

review.title: Great hotel for a tourist.
review.reviewText:
What this hotel lacks in ammenities (pool, in-room fridges, frills of a higher-end hotel) it more than makes up for in location. If you want to get out and see San Francisco, this is the place to be. It is located right on a stop for the famous Cable Car lines, just a block away from a major MUNI bus stop to take you anywhere in the city, and a block away from the BART hub which takes you to the airport.

The room itself is quite comfortable. We stayed in a deluxe king room and it had more than enough room for us to spread out our things and still move around quite easily. I suspect we may have been given an ADA compliant room, because the bathroom was ENORMOUS. You could have easily fit a cot in there and slept another person! Whenever we make it back to San Fran, we will look for this hotel again.
review.locationRemarks: Being located right on a Cable Car stop and just a block away from a main bus stop made getting anywhere in the city a breeze!

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable but extra small. The room was a lttle dusty. Customer service is excellent. Location is ideal!! Very vintage and had a great stay overall.
review.negativeRemarks: A little dusty and no view.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for shopping, restaurants and railcar access.

review.title: Photos are deceiving
review.reviewText:
I must say that the photographs are VERY deceiving! Our room (and other rooms that I viewed) looked much larger, cleaner and more modern than what I found when I opened the door to the room. This hotel is OLD and it felt more like a dreary, dark bed and breakfast than the "Art Deco boutique hotel" as it was described by Expedia. The "wine reception" is plastic cups and an old bottle of cheesy wine. BRING EAR PLUGS! It is so incredibly loud at night with the trolley, honking horns and noise of the city. Of course, it is close to the trolley turn around which brings loud crowds and it is close to a lot of things, I will give it that, but this hotel is NOT what I expected and what I paid for.
The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful everything else stunk.
review.negativeRemarks: the room was dark and dirty, halls were dark, $40 for valet parking, LOUD!
review.locationRemarks: Optimal for walking and catching public transportation

review.title: great for shoppers
review.reviewText: great location, a hidden gem, close to all public trans
review.negativeRemarks: bath little small
review.locationRemarks: prime

review.title: Fantastic location, great staff, highly recommend
review.reviewText: Fantastic location and a great and friendly staff. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in (slept so well that I slept through my alatm) I would stay here again when I return to SF and will recommend my friends stay here too

review.title: not all rooms have air conditioning. great staff.
review.reviewText: Great location. Wonderful staff. Adam the manager was great in dealing with issues. Just make sure you have climate control (air conditioning) in your room. Apparently its not in every room.

review.title: Nice hotel right in the heart of everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and well maintained, the rooms are pretty small but you shouldn't expect much bigger since its the city. Overall very nice hotel an luckily we didn't get any complaints of our loud 1 year old who was too excited to be some where different other than home.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Cheap hotel
review.reviewText: hotel low class, no air conditionning, very small room

review.title: This hotel is a gem.
review.reviewText: What consistently stands out about this hotel itself is the attitude of the staff (caring, competent) and the opportunity for guests to gather each day in the lobby for pleasant live entertainment and refreshments. The location is very convenient - right by Bart and Muni stops, and shopping. It is not a fancy place however it is very comfortable.

review.title: Not the best for the business traveler
review.reviewText: No desk and poor lighting in the room made it difficult to read, or use a laptop, comfortably. Also, the closet rack was in the bathroom, which was both odd and inconvenient. The pillows were too soft and the bed too hard; the combination made my head and back ache.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were among the nicest and most helpful I've encountered in 18 years of business travel. Its location is also central and convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Lighting, especially in the bedroom but also in the hallways. Also, if there's space for a desk in the room, why not put one in?
review.locationRemarks: Very centrally located -- one terminus for the cable cars is right outside; lots of shopping and restaurants nearby; convention center an easy walk.

review.title: Three nights in the City
review.reviewText: Great location. The best thing about this hotel is Tom, the consigliere. He was a wealth of infomation and helped us out tremendously. We checked wirth Tom before leaving the hotel every day regarding coffee shops, China Town, cocktail lounges and restaurants, sites to see. He really made our stay very enjoyable. We would return to this hotel primarily because of Tom.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. On Powell, one block off of Market Street. We walked to everything we wanted to see.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was very low to the ground. No box springs. The external bed frame was a reall toe and shin buster. The chairs were also too low to the groun
review.locationRemarks: We really enjoyed Johnny's 1920's era Dashiell Hammett) lounge & restaurant across the street out the side door. Also all the Dashiell history nearb

review.title: $$ for the quality. That's San Francisco for you.
review.reviewText: They need sound reducing glass on window. Parking was $40 per night.

review.title: Lovely stay at Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText: I just returned from a five night stay at Hotel Union Square. It is spotlessly clean and amazingly well located. It is half a block from the turnaround for the cable cars, it is two blocks from a BART station and two blocks from a cab stand. Union Square is a major shopping district with Old Navy, Tiffanys, Macys right there and a mall close. Because of all the public transportation near, it is easy to get to all the other parts of the city that you want to visit. There is no restaurant inside the hotel, but there are multiple dining options nearby. No breakfast either, but there is a great diner right next door. Try the sourdough french toast, it's wonderful. The hotel hosts a nightly wine reception from 5pm to 6pm.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, lots of shopping opportunities

review.title: Close to shopping and transit
review.reviewText: Right in the center of the shopping district, and a perfect spot to catch the MUNI trains, busses and cable car to Fishermans Wharf, not to mention walking distance to China Town, Union Square, the Yerba Buena Park and more!
review.positiveRemarks: Very cozy, comfortable room! Simple elegance. Good coffee in the morning and wine in the afternoon:)
review.negativeRemarks: I wish they offered a light breakfast, but there are tons of places to pick up a quick bite just a few steps outside the hotel.

review.title: Never Again!!
review.reviewText: We are Honeymooners from Aus and has to take alot to upset us, We have travelled through Europe and Asia with no hotel troubles from 3-5 stars. On our 4 weeks trip through America Hotel Union Square was a horrible experience,When checking in we told the guy we were honeymooners and we had booked a double room but said we could change to a King room with one bed which was in the quiet part of the hotel, when asking for this we were told oh sorry there is none available (WHY SUGGEST IT?) The staff on the front desk out of 4 nights were different each day and the service was never the same! On the day of check out we finally recieved some sort of decent service! The rooms are so no what is advertised and our window view was a car park!! There was a nice wake up every morning at 5am from the rubbish truck emptying the bins. We had our door access card not work 6 times and had to walk down stairs each time to ask for a new one. When telling them i had enough of the keys not working we got a simple oh sorry here is another one when returning that night oh whats that it didnt work again!! There was mould that would appear on the bathroom walls each time after a shower! The iron did not work, the bed side lights were broken so you would have to click it over a dozen times and it would finally turn on. Overall look else where there are hotels near by that are cheaper and much better. Dissapointing stay!

review.title: Union square hotel
review.reviewText: Staff great, lobby & common areas very deco lovely. Room a little tired.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed in one of the smaller rooms, but loved the quaintness and comfort. This is a very charming boutique hotel and I would stay again.

review.title: Perfect romantic getaway
review.reviewText: I love personality hotels! My boyfriend and i stayed at the Hotel Union Square a few months back and most recently the Hotel Diva. These hotels are perfect for romantic getaways and the staff at both are amazing. Thank you for giving us a wonderful stay!We will for sure be coming back.
review.negativeRemarks: the staff made a mix up in our reservation but was smoothed out very professionally.
review.locationRemarks: perfect union square location. Everything is just minutes away.

review.title: A most wonderful San Francisco experience
review.reviewText: From the moment I entered, until the moment I left, the service was most personable. A greeting in my own language, service tailored to my needs (at one stage, bandaids) and helpful service at many other moments. The hotel has a wonderful own character, something that most hotels in big chains lack these days. Centrally located and beautifully decorated, this hotel provides a most wonderful experience.
review.locationRemarks: optimal - so central

review.title: Great location, needs some TLC
review.reviewText: Great location and cool style but needs improvement in maintenance and upkeep (tile in bathroom was in rough shape and some of the fixtures were loose and near falling off).

review.title: HORRIBLE
review.reviewText:
Musty, dark, depressing, smelled terrible. Sheets were nasty, was itching all over. I had to go out and buy a scented candle just to enable me to stay in the room another night.

Had a second reservation for the following week which I cancelled within 5 mins of entering my room.

Such a terrible experience, I would not recommend anyone stays there.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING
review.locationRemarks: GOOD LOCATION IS THE ONLY THING THIS PLACE HAS GOING FOR IT

photos.caption: just a bed in a room with a bathroom

review.title: If you are ok with a small room it is a great stay
review.reviewText:
The room was small but we really liked the hotel. I took my teenage daughter to SF for her birthday. This was obviously an old building but it was very clean and well kept so we found the age of it charming. Most hotels are pretty much the same now.
The location is great, near lots of restaurants, quick food, drugstores, and public transit just like what I want when I travel. There is a take-out window literally next door and a late night pizza take-out place less than a block away. Walking is safe. Remember when you walk SF, safety can change quickly in a couple of blocks and you want to avoid the Tenderloin (although it's right in the middle of everything and I always seem to pass into it). We had no car-it would have been more of a pain and expense than anything.
No desk in room only nightstands-bathroom clean & nice(small). Staff was really exceptional, way better than average.
Overview: only downside is size of room if it matters to you, I found it irrelevant. Price and location matter most as long as it's clean and this place is normal/fine not just acceptable.
That is all the info I would have wanted.
review.negativeRemarks: It was small with no desk or chairs
review.locationRemarks: Busy downtown location by a lot of food and shopping

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText: Great access to all public transportation. All staff were especially helpful with any need. Concierge was excellent with great recommendations and schedule. Thank you!

review.title: Nice cozy hotel
review.reviewText: great location, friendly staff, nice interior of the room

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My room was small clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were helpful and courteous. The $40 parking fee per night was a bit expensive. The coffee in the lobby in the morning and the wine for Happy hour were nice hospitality gifts. Unfortunately I don't drink alcohol....The guitar player and singer was amazing.....all making Hotel Union Square a great little personality hotel. I will definitely recommend it. Thanks
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly helpful staff, clean rooms and the Happy hour guitar player
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking........The attendant was helpful and pleasant
review.locationRemarks: Close to the conference at the Grand Hyatt and more reasonably priced

review.title: Great hotel for a quick getaway
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a prefect location. It's minutes away from everything! Totally recommend

review.title: Downtown SFO
review.reviewText: Overall good experience, small bathrooms. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Location is great

review.title: Great location; tiny rooms.
review.reviewText: Great location; tiny rooms in a very old structure. Great staff, and the live music and wine hour from 5 - 6 are a big plus.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near Union Square, transit, and cable car
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny rooms

review.title: Boutique Sheik in Union Square
review.reviewText: Centrally located in San Fran where local amenities such as shops, cafes, restaurants and public transport are within easy reach! The hotel itself is very boutique sheik, very trendy for the area it is in.
review.negativeRemarks: Creeky floors in the hall ways
review.locationRemarks: Absolutely Perfect location for all amenities!

review.title: Antique Boutique at its Best!
review.reviewText:
Awesome "Character" Hotel! If you want the Hilton - go to the Hilton. If you want a unique, quirky, updated turn of the century building to stay in - THIS is the place! Right at the heart of where you want to be. Streetside noisy? Yup! You are in the middle of the city after all!
Loved it and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else on our next trip! Staff is outstanding and uber helpful.

review.title: Budget stay in very limited space room
review.reviewText:
Rooms are so small it can barely fit a single bed. Despite that fact they placed 2 bed shelves and made it absolutely impossible to move around the room(box). Horrible.
Price wise was ok that explains the issues above.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and comfort
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: very good location, small room
review.reviewText: Room is too small. No room to put 2 big luggages (good thing we only brought 1). But we did a lot of shopping and I had to re-arrange our stuff everyday otherwise there wouldnt be any space to walk on. That's how small it is. We are a couple - male is 6'2", female is 5'1" and the room is too small for us. But the staff are all very efficient.

review.title: Great value for Business Stay
review.reviewText: Concierge and Front Desk Staff was very courteous and helpful.

review.title: Accommodating staff.
review.reviewText: I visited on a long weekend and was able to check in early (10am) and have my luggage taken care of late (8pm) so that I could enjoy the whole long weekend in San Francisco. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and made me feel very welcome on my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: True boutique hotel - great vibe and grounded in history
review.locationRemarks: Jump on the trolley right outside the hotel

review.title: fun times in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I liked that it was so centrally located and the staff were great and the room was very comfortable and clean.

review.title: Great location, thin walls.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was extremely small, but clean and well kept. The design was nice and all the furnishings were nice. Our room was near the elevator and we could hear the dinging throughout the night which was very annoying. We could also hear our neighbors and people in the hallway talking due to the extremely thin walls. The location is great for exploring Union Square and was close to the cable cars and the BART station. Those were big advantages for us. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this isn't it, but for the price it is okay.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, trolleys, and BART station within very short walk

review.title: Terrific way to do SF
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable, easy and plenty of thoughtful touches. Very European feel to the property. Going back for sure.

review.title: Great hotel for exploring the City!
review.reviewText: A great hotel in a fantastic central area. Ideal for tourists and holiday makers but I would not recommend this for a business trip due to the noise!

review.title: Christmas in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel Union Square is ideally located for someone wanting to be right in the thick of Union Square hubbub. Nice feel to the hotel, not generic. The beds were comfy and the rooms clean and well-appointed. Warning, if you are sensitive to noise, bring earplugs or this may not be the hotel for you.
review.positiveRemarks: location, wine happy our and coffee in morning, comfy bed
review.negativeRemarks: Noise!
review.locationRemarks: right above the Powell St cable car turn around and the BART station, close to shopping center

review.title: New year's eve at SFO!
review.reviewText: Superb location, good price, definetively I'll come back.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Great service and location for vacations!
review.reviewText: Everything was great! The location is perfect and the hotel service amazing, they were really helpful!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText:
Great location, close to restaurants, cafes, stores, cable cars, trains. From here you can get everywhere easily!
Not a big room, but quite comfortable and functional.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: excellent location and cleanliness. surrounded by shopping areas, but is not noisy at all. convenient and clean is the utter consideration

review.title: great location but walls are thin
review.reviewText:
Great location. Provides easy access to cable cars, buses for getting anywhere else you need to visit. Rooms are spacious. Decor of hotel is very distinctive. Concierge was friendly and knowledgeable. Evening receptions with wine were welcome.

But there's a distinctive musty smell on the 3rd floor where we stayed. And crucially, the walls are *thin*, involving you in the conversations and goings-on of your fellow lodgers. Boorish, profane, late sleeping neighbours like ours will force you to play the radio loud just to block the sound.

review.title: Good hotel for business travelers
review.reviewText: Although not used, complimentary services of beverages in the morning and afternoon are a nice touch to the excellent service. The hotel staff was very accommodating in a variety of needs including some last minute use of their business room before departing from the Union Square district. It was a unique experience staying in a hotel with a rich history in the Downtown San Francisco area.

review.title: Perfect place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: It was a a really good experience and the location is perfect. The parking is very expensive. It would have been nice to know that it wasn't included and the price of parking prior to check in.

review.title: fine for business
review.reviewText: Stayed at this hotel multiple times; room decor is nice, but there rooms vary from large with street windows (cable car/street noise), to much smaller interior rooms with a 'window' to a fire-escape. Beds are good, lights, internet, TV etc. all in good shape.

review.title: A hotel that never sleeps!
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfect if your wanting a location in the center of union square, but if you want to be a part of a city that never sleeps you'll get your wish! I stayed 1 time prior and got a room with a view, but between the cable car and sirens all night, didn't get a lot of sleep. Just returned from this hotel last week and really forgot how truly loud it was. Asked for a room away from the street but it didn't much matter. No sleep the entire trip!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great, loved the reception area with tea and wine
review.negativeRemarks: I asked if the conceirge could call us a taxi for a certain time and was told it was best to walk a block up the street . Wasn't very helpful
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location in the heart of the city. Perfect for shopping

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location; not family friendly; a little noisy at night
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in union square

review.title: Cozy room
review.reviewText: Unique hotel right in the middle of tons of shopping! The rooms are very small and very different than I have ever stayed in. The walls are thin so noise can be a problem. The hotel staff is great and we would consider staying again.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small rooms, parking fee
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: small room, free Internet
review.reviewText: The room is very small, however, Internet is free. so, the price is relative high considering its size

review.title: Great location not a great hotel
review.reviewText: Great location for the convention centre (10 minute walk) but its an old hotel that seems like a bit of a rabit warren. Rooms are small and not well maintained. The cold water tap came off in my hands and when they moved me to a next room the soap dish screwed to the wall was loose.
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of the rooms

review.title: I'd go back
review.reviewText: Treated well. Great location! Clean and cute. They have a rewards program too with perks! Join

review.title: Charming!!
review.reviewText: Small, yet satisfying. The daily wine reception soled my friend and I on this hotel! The rooms are very small, but comfy. I would recommend if you are not planning on being in your hotel the majority of the time.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the daily wine reception with live music!
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms...
review.locationRemarks: Location is good for upscale shopping and riding the cable cars. Not really the best area for going out at night though.

review.title: Quaint but noisy.
review.reviewText:
I came to San Francisco to attend a nearby conference at another hotel and picked this to have a retreat from the business of the conference.

The hotel itself is quaint, the staff very pleasant. The wifi worked fine for me. My biggest concern was the level of noise in the room, as it overlooked a busy street and it impacted my sleep, despite the use of earplugs. Perhaps one of the rooms facing the rear of the hotel would not have been so bad. I would suggest they consider getting double pane windows whenever they decide to do a reno.
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, obviously.

review.title: It's unique
review.reviewText: A unique little boutique hotel right in the middle of everything. It's noisy outside (street noise from the trolley and outside hustle and bustle) but quiet inside, nice and a bit funky. The Thin Man plays continuously on a wall mounted plasma screen, in homage to Dashiell Hammett, who stayed here. Other decor fits the time period. Our room faced the interior courtyard and was quite small but nicely equipped and quiet. The staff are very helpful. The complimentary wine every evening was a great way to meet other guests. It's convenient to restaurants, shopping, Union Square, and more. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: My room was pretty small
review.locationRemarks: The location is great

review.title: "Disappointed hotel stay"
review.reviewText: For the price I paid to stay in this hotel, I was very disappointed. First of all, there was no central air conditioning and the room was unsually small. The room was equipped with a window unit which yield a constant, annoying humming sound. This made it difficult to sleep. Most importantly, the room had no desk which I needed to complete work activities. The other furnishings you would expect to find in a quality hotel room were missing or scaled down. This included a small dresser, small nightstands, small vanity in the bathroom and only one chair. I am happy my husband cancelled at the last minute. Thus, it was only 1 disappointed guest instead of 2.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about the hotel was that it was located close to the convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: No ammenities, very small room.

review.title: Great Location, Stale Rooms
review.reviewText: The location is superb, but the rooms are disappointing. They are cramped and lack adequate ventilation and light. The first room we were assigned had a strong smell, so we requested another room. A good hotel would regularly inspect their rooms and would have discovered the odor and remedied it. The parking attendent left our car unlocked and the keys in the car. That's unacceptable. They corrected it after we complained.
review.negativeRemarks: The lack of ventilation in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Great downtown location near the trolley end of line and very close to great shopping.

review.title: Do not recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel maybe in a really good location... However the rooms smell like wet dog..Everything feels moist, and there is absolutely no ventulization in the bathrooms. The sinks are the size of an iPad, which isn't much! We request an extra towel every night, and all 3 nights they said they would bring them, and we never got anything!!!
review.locationRemarks: The smell and tiny bathrooms

review.title: Great Location !! But.......
review.reviewText: We have stayed here several times but this last time I would not stay in a front room over Powell its way too loud either screaming homeless or bellowing drunken club goers sleeping after 2am is near impossible ... I was at first happy for an actual opening window but no.. I will pass on that next time for sure !!!!!.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Quiet, quaint & clean. Rooms small. Had 2 rooms reserved & one was on 4th floor, other on 6th which was disappointing. Also no area to lounge in to have a drink or socialize with friends & rooms too small for gatherings. Staff very friendly & helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to shopping, restaurants and transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms small & no area to sit with friends to socialize. Lounge area in front of hotel to busy & small for socializing.
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Great hotel to stay in the city.
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is great.

review.title: I can't move and my back is soooo sore!!!!
review.reviewText: We booked our room via Expedia and traveled with three adults and a 13 year old. We were charged an extra $60 for the extra adult. When we arrived we were given a room of 160 square feet. It was awful!!! We were unable to put our suit cases down and were tripping over each other. We were so exhausted as we flew from Hawaii to LA and drove to San Francisco all in one day so we stayed in the room. The next day we were given a larger room but were told we had to pay another $40 per night. We had a large room with a king size bed and broken sofa sleeper. My 13 year old sat on the sofa sleeper and fell thru the springs. My 21 and 13 year old said they had bars and springs poking in their backs all night. For the $$$$$ this was absolutely a complete over priced disaster. Make sure you do your home work with this place. The hotel over looked nice on the outside and the lobby but the rooms were way way way over priced!!!! Sure to find something better else where.
review.negativeRemarks: Room to small and uncomfortable bed.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to the city.

review.title: Not for business travel
review.reviewText: Used only as a last resort to cover a short notice meeting. Large convention in SFO made all of the hotels normally used for business travel sold out.

review.title: modern
review.reviewText: The hotel was updated and clean. Very cute hotel! Rooms are very small but most hotels in Frisco are small. The only compliant I have is the room was very stuffy even w/ the AC on.
review.negativeRemarks: stuffy room even w/ AC on
review.locationRemarks: perfect location to public transportation

review.title: Dissapointing rooms
review.reviewText: I received a room with no window. The AC was too loud to keep on. The intererior was not comfortable.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location friendly helpful staff only negative was outside construction noise definetly coming back

review.title: Great place for adults to say.
review.reviewText: Rooms are small, no dining facility but access to many in the same block. Wine at 5 in the lobby is a nice touch. Everything else was great..
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location right on cable car line & near to Union Square. Great shopping area!

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a great location- 1and a half blocks of the BART system- direct from the airport, as well as right in the cablecar line.

The hotel staff was great, the concierge got us set up with a amazing dinner just across the road.

I would highly recommend this hotel to couples traveling.
review.locationRemarks: Central to everything

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Overall a nice hotel that is conveniently located near the Moscone Center, Union Square and the trolleys. It's an older building but it has been renovated nicely. The staff was pleasant and helpful and I was happy to see an in room safe even though that is not listed as a feature on Expedia. My only complaint about the hotel would have to be the lighting. The hall ways are rather dark as is the room unless you turn on most of the lights. Even with that, this is a great place to stay while visiting San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location just wishes linens in room were clean. I could tell the linens had not been changed in a few days. Otherwise, great place. I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: linens were not clean and hair was found on my pillows when I first walked in.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: great for shopping and centrally located
review.reviewText: ejoyed the refreshments available in the lobby every day, especially the wines in the evening

review.title: Glossy cover but fairly standard in reality.
review.reviewText: 2 teachers: modest means. We had very high hopes further to reading reviews when booking. It was impressive at first but overall, not quite the luxury we'd hoped for. Very clean, nicely decorated in hallways and a super location for shopping in Union Square. As soon as you step out of the front door, the homeless will harass you (not necessarily specific to this hotel). The 'hidden but deadly' bed legs jutted out and had been padded with foam, obviously the result of complaints of leg injuries to previous guests trying to navigate around the room. Some staff members were disappointing - they seemed tired and they didn't answer my questions (tended to pass the buck). Wide, pretty, fixed shower head, but not particularly powerful. Some of the TV channels worked, sometimes. Our room looked out onto the street:- take ear plugs. Overall, OK to good.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff and noise.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for Union Square.

review.title: SF treat
review.reviewText:
Very close to everything if you want to stay near downtown and Fisherman's Wharf area.
Nice & quiet even though your in the heart of it all
Very pleasant staff
Would stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Old hotel with new renovations, very creative style
review.negativeRemarks:
Rooms were a little on the small side, a little more square footage would have been nice.
But hey, it's friggin San Francisco go figure!
review.locationRemarks: Traffic to get to and from the hotel is a nightmare.

review.title: "Great Hotel for Union Square Conferences"
review.reviewText: Well-situated hotel for the price. Right on the Powell cablecar route and only a block from Union Square. Walking distance to most shopping and within easy cable car or taxi reach of anywhere - Fisherman's Wharf, Union Square, Market Street, Tenderloin, and China Town/North Beach. Had a wonderful time. Tad's steaks next door provides comfort food for late night and breakfast service directly via the hotel to your room. I would return again without any hesitation.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge Tom and Joel were phenomenal
review.negativeRemarks: Low pressure on shower head for wife's hair washing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for all your Union Square needs

review.title: Top spot for San Fran
review.reviewText: The hotel is in such a great spot, right on the Powell street cable line, close to shops and restaurants. A short walk to union square the ferry building and china town. It was clean with a funky design for an old building. The staff were great, very helpful and friendly. The room was small but comfortable. The only downfall was that the street can be a bit loud at night up to about midnight but you can always ask for a room not facing the street. Free wifi was very handy. If you are driving call ahead and get directions to the hotel car park as it is not on Powell street rather on Ellis. Over all a great stay!

review.title: Good location and convenient for the price.
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a very convenient location on Powell near Market Street in downtown San Francisco. The staff were very friendly and professional. The lobby is nice. Has complimentary tea and coffee in the morning. Always a cooler with orange slices available throughout the day. There is an evening wine tasting too. The only down side is the room is a little tight and i found myself bumping the TV when trying to get around the bed. Still, a pleasant stay and would come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet and had a good night's sleep every night.
review.negativeRemarks: Bumping into the tv while walking around the bed
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient....to shopping, to BART, to muni travel, to cable car.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A little small but cozy and pleasant stay overall.

photos.caption: Famous Cable Car. So fun to ride!

review.title: Great Hotel for a Family!
review.reviewText: The location is fantastic! Literally steps from Union Square and the infamous spot where the cable car turns around. Our children (4 and 6 years) loved being in the middle of the city with all of the excitement! You are walking distance from Market Street, Yerba Buena Gardens, Union Square, tons of shopping, and so much more! Highly recommend this hotel. Convenient parking and nice atmosphere. We will stay here again without question!
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing was the beautiful mermaid hanging in the lobby of our floor right outside of the elevator! I wish I could have taken her home!
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are on the smaller side, but even with our 2 kids, it was plenty of space to relax.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location! Can't be beat! Especially for the price!

review.title: Centrally located nice hotel
review.reviewText: Charming hotel located in the heart of San Francisco. All the staff have been very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is on Powell street, next to the cable car end station: it cannot be much more central than this.

review.title: Comfortable but compact, good location
review.reviewText:
Good location and a quirky modern styled hotel a little boutique. Rooms are compact but comfortable.

Staff are a little hard work when asking for tourist information maybe it was the British accents they didn't understand!

They offer a glass of free wine at 5pm which is a nice touch.

But beware the car park costs plus tax. There is a public car park right next door which will save you ove $10 a day. It you can avoid it you don't need a car in San Fran, but we were on a road trip so had no choice but to pay San Fran's over priced parking fees.
review.negativeRemarks: car park fee
review.locationRemarks: Central location

review.title: Big Orange
review.reviewText: If you are a dyed-in -the -wool Giants fan, then the Giants Junior Suite is for you. If flash backs to Halloween are a problem, pick another option

review.title: Cute, cozy, great location.
review.reviewText: Very good location in union square. Room was really small, rate was inexpensive. We were happy with the room. The most time we spent in it was to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room
review.locationRemarks: Near the trolley pick up and drop off

review.title: Hotel is good and bad...
review.reviewText:
The pictures on the internet site of this hotel are misleading. Although the TV and the bed/ linen were good, the small room was up a flight of stairs (which was difficult with a large suit case) and the decor of the hotel was very old and run down (carpet worn, dark hallways). the bathroom in the room was tiny and old.

The location of the hotel was good and they had free wine at a happy hour at 5:00 so that was pleasant. So good and bad
review.positiveRemarks: Bed was comfortable, decent linen, good flat screen TV, and free wine at 5:00
review.negativeRemarks: Decor in hotel was old with dark hallways. I carried my suitecase up a flight of stairs, no offer of help from hotel staff. Bathroom was small/ old.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great. I was taking a class at the university so it was convenient.

review.title: For heavy sleepers who are not claustrophobic
review.reviewText: Small, noisy room. Open floor space in the bed area and the bathroom were about equal. Thin, old windows allowed street noise unimpeded access to the room, despite being on an upper floor. Beeping trucks (garbage? delivery?) on the street backed up every morning at about 6 am. Might be quieter when construction across the street is finished. Staff were nice and room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Sleep deprivation
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square where there are many hotels

review.title: Perfect Union Square Stay!
review.reviewText:
Hotel Union Square was EXACTLY what we hoped it would be!
We travelled to San Francisco from Toronto for our honeymoon, and being from a big city we wanted to be right in the heart of San Fran. Staying at hotel union square we were RIGHT there, in the middle of the shopping, restaurants and the cable car was directly outside the front door!
We had a place to park our car for a very reasonable rate, and they even sent us a complimentary honeymoon package including a bottle of wine and delicious treats. They held our bags when we arrived before check in so we could wander the city and while we were there they were incredibly helpful with suggestions of what to do while in town.
The room was beautifully designed, it had the perfect urban cozy feel. The size for the 2 of us was perfect, and it was very clean. The Bed was comfortable, and the exposed brick gave it a special feel.
We would stay here again in a heart beat, in fact it might have to be an anniversary spot for us next year!
Thank-you to everyone at Hotel Union Square.
We loved our stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Our stay was too short!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. Easy to get ANYwhere. Walking distance from everything.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice. Not luxury, but I knew that when I booked. Very convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: great location, close to everything.

review.title: Ok, not great.
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient to shopping and the cable cars but the Deluxe Queen rooms were very small. There was little room to put toiletries in the bathroom and very minimal walking space around the bed. Once you pull up in front of the hotel, nobody is available to greet you or direct you towards the parking lot. Service wise, we requested a late check out on two rooms and the staff was less than accommodating. Even when they agreed to give us an additional hour on the rooms, housekeeping still checked on us twice prior to the late checkout time.

review.title: Great comfort, cleanliness, but can be very noisy.
review.reviewText: Great hotel but it was rather noisy and never got good sleep due to the nearby construction. The hotel just didn't seem insulated from the noise at all. But other than that, it's a great, comfortable beds, clean and conveniently located. But might think twice if you're on business and need great sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the decoration of the rooms, great bedding and pillows. clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Not well insulated from noise outside such as traffic or construction noise which leads to bad sleep.
review.locationRemarks: Great convenient location to convention center, union square, bart and other public transport.

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText: Very convenient and we enjoyed the decor in the older hotel. Coffee and Mario were extremely pleasant and helpful. If you prefer air conditioned rooms,though, be specific when booking your stay. Some rooms do not have air.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to the cable cars, BART and shopping. Restaurants are nearby too.

review.title: Great trip
review.reviewText: it was very good service I recomended to all my friends and I will be back
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Request a non-street view!
review.reviewText:
We stayed at the Hotel Union Square for two nights. The first night our room faced the street (Powell) and it was a very unrestful evening. In addtion to the cable cars dinging their bells every few minutes and the general noise of traffic, etc., there was a demolition project going on across the street that went into the night and started early in the morning, and the windows in our hotel room were not insulated enough to buffer these sounds in the slightest. We asked to be moved for our second night and the front desk staff was very accommodating - we were put in an identical room toward the back of the hotel and had a MUCH better experience. It's worth clarifying the location of your room on this hotel - give up the street view if you don't want to be groggy on your vacation!

Aside from that, our experience was nice. The rooms are very small at this hotel, and the bathrooms have no shelves or counter space to set clothes, toiletries, etc, but the rooms and common areas are clean and well kept. Convenient location for the BART, rental cars and Union Square shopping.

review.title: So So Stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Very good front desk. Interesting eclectic decor. However we had a small room with NO windows and POOR ventilation. Very dark. Very noisy and inefficient air conditioner. Mossy odour. Had to ask for towels and soap on several occasions. Might have ignored this if it were only 1 night but we stayed longer. Cannot recommend but the location is perfect just near Union Square. Insist on a well lit room with windows if you go.
review.negativeRemarks: Poor quality room

review.title: Nice hotel !
review.reviewText: The hotel is a nice hidden gem right around union square! The room was nice and comfortable and modern! I thought the overall hotel and room was clean! My only gripe was we couldn't check in until 3pm exactly which was a little difficult as I had to change in the hotel restroom ( and there was only one hotel restroom!)

review.title: Yes I Recommend This Hotel
review.reviewText: A 'boutique' hotel along the cable car route, one block from the Powell St. turnaround. Very close to Union Square and conveniently located. Rooms are rather small but clean and functional. Besides, you don't come to SF to hang out in your room anyway.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small, hotel's wi-fi logs you off quite quickly so you have to keep logging in.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and next to Powell St. cable car turnaround, walking distance to China Town and financial district.

review.title: Great location, OK hotel comfort
review.reviewText: Floors to some 6th Fl rooms tend to be slanted. But staff changed my room. Mattresses are of lower quality so beds are not the most comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: poor paint job and cheaper mattresses

review.title: Good if trying to save money.
review.reviewText: Really streched dark-feel halls, very small rooms, ugly deodorant in carpets, no air conditioner (just a heater that wasn't working at all). However it's located at a very good point of downtown and I got a cheap offer for 3 nights. I would stay here again only if I wanted to save money, otherwise I would go to the Westin or some other alike.
review.positiveRemarks: Lower price than other hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and halls size. No smoking rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Very centric. Near almost everything.

review.title: Well-renovated charmer
review.reviewText:
Great: location, value, friendliness and efficiency of staff.
Good: condition and size of room; plenty of electrical outlets (importantt given all the gadgets a business traveler carries)
Good (for me - but probably not for everyone): rooms on Powell street get cable-car and other street noise. Someone who needs a quiet room for sleep should ask for a courtyard room.
Missing: desk. If you need to spread out papers and don't want to use the bed you'll have a problem; air conditioning (although there's a ceiling fan). I don't mind the heat, but if it's a very hot day in SFO this might be a problem.

review.title: Union Square Convenience
review.reviewText: The location was perfect to get around with public transportation. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. The bathroom did not have ventalation so there was mold growing on the walls (in the bathroom only); however, the floor and fixtures were clean. I would recommend the hotel.

review.title: Happy with our choice
review.reviewText: We had difficulty to find the hotel and then the parking (we drove to San Francisco) because it is a very busy area and the signage was not that noticeable. However, the staff was superb. Concierge help us book our tours and answered all our questions. Coffee is available in the morning and wine (from 5 to 6) in the afternoon. The price was reasonable. We liked the brick walls in the corridor. Rooms are quite small but very clean and remodeled. We would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff. Happy hour in the lobby gave us the occasion to meet other guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the bedroom - Quite small
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transport and stores. Many restaurants nearby. Very busy.

review.title: I'll be back...
review.reviewText: Delightful stay--would love to go back. Rooms are small, but high ceilings gave feel of roominess. Conceirge and front desk staff were great--very helpful and loved giving suggestions for restaurants, tour bus,etc. Arranged taxi for 3:30 am pick up--surprised to find front desk staffed at that hour. Location is great for all mass transit options.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car outside the front door--BART station 1 1/2 blocks away; great central downtown location

review.title: dissapointed in San Fran
review.reviewText: The location is the only positive thing about this hotel. The mattress was uncomfortable and super squeaky. Also the rooms are really small, there was no closet in our room and the sink was in the room, opposite the toilet/shower. I would not stay there again when in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: room layout and size, mattress

review.title: Funky and Cozy!
review.reviewText: I go to San Fran often and am always trying new hotels. My boyfriend and I read other reviews about the size of the room. We got a room with two double beds because it has more square footage than a room with one queen. We slept in one and used the other as storage (clothes, backpack, maps, etc. The rooms are small but very cozy. It was clean, the staff is very friendly and has a wine hour for it's guests. I don't drink wine but very cool on the hotel's part. Overall, awesome, funky, trendy hotel with a great location!
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom a little too small..
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area right off Market.. can get to the major busses and the BART!.

review.title: union
review.reviewText: Nice architecture. Great location, staff is very nice and attentive

review.title: Great Location, Decent Room, Good Service
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, very close to the Market Street turnaround for the north-south cable car line that goes up to a few blocks south of Fisherman's Wharf. Great shopping is available at the large Westfield Mall two blocks to the south. The rooms are modestly appointed but well kept and the service at the hotel is very good.

review.title: What I expect from a boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly and professional staff, attractive and well appointed room, perfect location. I will stay there when I am next in SF.

review.title: Not luxorious but adequate.
review.reviewText: Its an older hotel. Feels a little creepy at first but by the second day I was comfortable. They staff are very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: It is older and doesn't have all the comforts of a newer hotel.
review.locationRemarks: It was very close to shopping.

review.title: Great boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Union Square is in a great location. The staff were friendly and very accommodating. Coffee available in your room and in the reception area daily. Wine for guests between 5-6 pm every night a lovely touch. Music 2 nights a week. Great restaurants close by. Shopping centres from Westfield to Macy's. Bart transport just a block away. All in all a very good experience.
review.locationRemarks: 114 Powell Street, right on the tram line.

review.title: A hotel with character for a great price.
review.reviewText: A hotel with character for a great price. Rooms are small and the building itself is old, but furnishings are modern and everything is clean. Helpful staff. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Old building, no exercise room on premises
review.locationRemarks: Right by union square

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Great location and very comfortable - especially for the price to surrounding hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful and friendly staff... room was comfortable and had that boutique charm to it.
review.negativeRemarks: If your're a light sleeper, don't get a room facing the street (Powell).
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the heart of San Fran - easy/quick acces to great restauraunts, bars, and shopping.

review.title: Modern style; perfect location; bumpy floor.
review.reviewText: An older property with many charms in an ideal location. Our 6th floor junior suite was clean and modern -- yet the floors have obviously suffered from a number of SF earthquakes and were no where near flat. That aside, this hotel is a winner.

review.title: Union at Market
review.reviewText:
Comfortable,cozy,great location,nice weather,so what's not to like?
I'd definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location.Close to good food and good shopping.Public transport conveniently located.
review.locationRemarks: It's San Francisco,what more needs to be said?

review.title: Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Union Square was an overall good expierience. The one thing that was disappointing at first, was that they put us in a room with handicap facilities. Fortunately, we went on a slow weekend and the staff kindly put us in a much nicer room. The best thing about this hotel is the Location. I would stay there again.

review.title: THE Place
review.reviewText: Amazing location, very helpful staff, and the complimentary wine, tea, coffee, were a plus. The only down side was our window was facing the street which made for an excellent view but resulted in a lot of street noise during the night.

review.title: Great Spot to Land
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Union Square is in a great location for a home base for San Francisco excursions. My family stayed there several years ago, and it was looking a little run down. Since then it's been renovated and is a much better experience.
On this one night visit, I was arriving from Portland on my way back home to the Philadelphia area. I met my daughter, who is cooking in a restaurant in SF, for a quick dinner and some hugs.
We both had a great night's sleep in our double double room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: not what I expected from the internet
review.reviewText: the first night we stayed we had to have a table top heater in our room because there was no other way to get heat plus it was pretty cramped for only 2 people. the following 2 nights we were in a different room with a window unit (201) much better room and room to walk around I guess if I stayed there again I would check for what room was available first before making reservations, but the people outside in that area didn't look the best, alot of beggers around.
review.locationRemarks: we stayed at the St Francis -- nicer area, better scenic view (across the street) but the rooms are higher in price per night.

review.title: Good location, clean, small but nice rooms.
review.reviewText: Very happy with our stay. Family of three for a long weekend. No problems at all with the hotel. Location is convenient to all of SF. The rooms are not large but they are updated nicely and are clean.

review.title: Our new favorite SF hotel!!
review.reviewText: What a great boutique hotel. All the staff are so friendly and accommodating, from the young lady who checked us in to the concierge who helped us with dinner reservations. You won't be disappointed in this little charmer. The location is perfect!! We'll go back again!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, anywhere. San Francisco is the greatest city to explore. There's so much to do and see. From where Hotel Union Square is located you are just a block from public transportation - BART, cable cars, muni bus...and of course there's always the taxis, too.

review.title: Great location and price. Character
review.reviewText: Old hotel with lots of character. Great for business trip where you just need a room

review.title: Great Union Square location, cool 1940s feel
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at the Hotel Union Square. It's in a great location within walking distance to hotels, stores, cable car stop, and more. The look is 1940s retro funky, not your typical corporate hotel. The room was spacious with desk with plenty of plugs and free wireless access. Room service is from Tad's steak house downstairs and is standard American fare. It is delivered in take-out boxes so it's not elegant, but both breakfasts and a dinner arrived only 10 minutes after I ordered! Parking entrance is on Ellis Street, not Powell--learned that after my "scenic tour" of the neighborhood ;-). Very friendly staff, great location, and excellent service.

review.title: generally happy, good location, newly renovated, small rooms
review.reviewText:
Generally happy, great location for Union Sq.
pros: good location, newly renovated, "semi" valet parking, business center for pc/net/printer access, generally friendly and helpful staff, easy access to tram and central city.

cons: street noise (it is the middle of a city....), small rooms that still have old tired AC, the slowest lift in the Northern hemisphere, very poor wifi signal (many guests complaining at desk),
"semi" hotel valet: not at hotel front entrance, more like a valet parking building next door, expensive ($30 a day, next door parking $20), busy, small, and difficult to access. not helped by roadworks that made concierge directions (that they should be aware of since it was outside the hotel) irrelevant.

review.title: Union Square's Little Secret
review.reviewText: This place has become my favorite hotel in SF.

review.title: is not worth it
review.reviewText: We went over there and they charged us extra 40 bucks for party of 4 and they literally provided nothing in addition. The room was too small but the location was really good.

review.title: Supreme Location
review.reviewText: Room was small with little storage space. Staff very friendly Location ideal for getting to Fisherman's Wharf (just a short bus ride) or shopping on Powell street. The hotel had all the things we needed to make our stay great. Would definitely stay here again

review.title: union square
review.reviewText: Small rooms. Old but updated. No great amenities. Did have wine each evening and coffee in the mornings. On very loud street. Had to wear ear plugs at night. NO AC so kept window open and noise even worse. Staff were helpful but had to request washcloths several times and eventually gave up expecting they would replace them on a daily basis.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent price
review.reviewText:
Chose this hotel for proximity to transportation and price. Location was great, right downtown so packed during tourist season. Sensitive sleepers shouldn't get rooms facing the street, as it's pretty boisterous, but I sleep like a log so I was fine. Bed was comfortable, room was very clean. Not a lot of space in the room, so I would say it's best suited to people who will be out enjoying the city all day, not hanging out in your hotel room. Staff was friendly and the amenities were adequate. Building was cool and had nice vintage SF charm.

Good stuff!

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText:
THe location of the hotel was amazing! Right on Powell St and in the heart of Union Square. Prime location for shopping, eating, and bar hopping.

A little disappointed with the size of the room for the price, but it seems in that district all hotels are old and would have small rooms as well.

review.title: Great location & Service
review.reviewText:
Great Location
Great Service
Rooms have been renovated but still feels dated,
Hallways had that "old" smell to them.
We had a room facing onto the street which gets quite busy and noisy.

review.title: very good location but small rooms
review.reviewText: location is very good close to all the shops and the tram line is on the door step. we had no issues with the hotel itself and would recommend breakfast at Lefty's bar just up the street or Mo'z next to the Westfield Centre. The only issue that we had was the size of the room we were staying in. It was small with a view into the middle of the building, but the furnishing were good and the bathroom was fine - on the whole I would recommend this hotel to others planning a short stay but try and get a room that looks out on the street

review.title: Don't be fooled by the pictures...
review.reviewText:
This place could best be described as "a 3 dressed up as a 9"... the pictures posted on Expedia are deceiving to say the least. The hotel is old (which is fine - I like character) but it's been "updated" in a very cheap way... dingy carpet, dark walls, mediocre decor... put it this way, it's not a luxury hotel - you definitely get what you pay for. The staff were friendly enough and helpful. The best part about this hotel is its location - it's very close to Union Square, lots of great shopping and restaurants.

But if you're thinking you're getting a really great quality hotel for an amazing deal - you're not.

review.title: My 2nd stay and still happy
review.reviewText: Was at this hotel the previous year and this year's stay was still pretty pleasant. I was given an option for one of the inner rooms so it was quieter than those along the actual street. However, the room was nowhere near as big as last year but I didn't mind as the bed, bathroom etc were very comfortable. The bed was a bit big for the smaller room but it's something I can overlook. I would plan on booking this same hotel next year. Great location.

review.title: Impressed with the hotel.
review.reviewText: We were impressed with the hotel. It was in a good central location, was clean and we will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Dive hotel: Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText:
This place was a run-down excuse for a hotel. The pictures on the website are totally misleading and are taken at such an angle to make the rooms look larger than they are. There was no closet--only a few hangers in a make-shift cabinet--and the room smelled of damp mold and depression. The bed was like sleeping on a floor futon, except that would have been much more comfortable.

The only saving grace was its location...great shopping district, near trolley and a few blocks from the convention center.

review.title: Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel with lots of personality. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are on the small side (to be expected for older buildings). Street noise can get a little noisy at night with window open (no A/C).

review.title: Convenient Location for Business
review.reviewText: The bedding was worn, not all the staff was helpful, and not all the rooms are equally comfortable.

review.title: weekend in san francisco
review.reviewText: I spent quite some time researching hotels that fit my budget as well as the location of the city I wanted to be in before I chose hotel union square. For all intensive purposes it aS a great stay. The hotel is vintage contemporary and is well furnished. The location is very close to everything I come to san Francisco for. The cable car turnaround is a block away as is the subway, buses, and walking distance to shopping and food of all kinds. The o.ly complaint that I or my wife had was that the bed was worn out. The mattress is not on a box spring but on a Chrome metal frame, it looks cool but is not great for sleeping on. Overall I'm happy we chose to stay there. I would not bring my.children here, it is definetly an adult establishment.

review.title: good location, good hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of union square. It was easy to find. Renting a car was not necessary. Cable cars are right in front of the hotel. The room was small but clean, quiet, and affordable. There is a free wine tasting in the lobby.

review.title: Excited to go back!
review.reviewText: My friend and I were only able to stay at this hotel for one night, but we had a great experience. Although our single queen bed room was small, we absolutely loved it! It was very intimate. We are both excited to go back, hopefully this summer. I would say the only negative thing was the noise outside of our window. We were on the 5th floor and could still hear a lot going on outside. But with that said, we will still return!

review.title: Best Hotel in the downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: It's located in the middle of the shopping area in Union Square, safe neighborhood and close to all transportations including the famous tram! Friendly service, Lovely room, very clean(super important to me), great Thai food next door that open until 1 am(not expensive at all) and above all, FREE Wifi !!!!! :D

review.title: Good Botique Hotel
review.reviewText: Although the common areas of the hotel were a bit threadbare, the room was in good condition. There is only one elevator, and that was a bit limiting when the lobby was busy. The staff was generally helpful. One negative point: when we ordered a cab to the airport, the staff member was persistent in his recommendation that we pay cash rather than use a credit card, implying that it was unsafe to give a credit card to the cab driver. We learned from the cab driver that the kickback to the staff member was greater when the fare was paid in cash.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at The Hotel Union Square and would recommend it to travelers who like accomodations that are unique and intimate. The location was awesome, right on the trolley line and very close to Chinatown and shopping. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Tom, (conceirge) was extremely helpful in planning our visit and arranging airport transporation. After a busy day, it was nice to "go home" for the evening. Visit their website, the photos are true. It was built in the early 1900's and just finished a beautiful renovation.

review.title: Exceptional hotel with exceptional service
review.reviewText: I was extremely satisfied with my stay at Hotel Union Square. The other positive reviews were very helpful to me in making my decision. The hotel is well maintained, has a very friendly and helpful staff, and the room and bathroom were clean and tidy. Both room and bathroom were small in comparison to other larger hotels, but it was perfect for a single traveler like myself (could easily accomodate two comfortably). Fresh coffee was available in the morning and the wine happy hour was a nice addition to the overall experience. I would highly recommend this hotel!!

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: A good boutique hotel with great location. The downside is the noise - you can hear everything outside the window.

review.title: Definitely can't wait to go back!!
review.reviewText:
Hotel was clean and updated.
Staff was friendly and consistantly helpful.
Rooms were small but accommodating - didn't spend enough time there for it to be an issue. Closet size was more than adequate for clothes AND open suitcase plus shoes and therewas still space left!
Bed was comfortable (new mattress?) and I slept without issue.

review.title: Just O.K
review.reviewText: We got the room with the queen bed and I was definitely take back by the size, the entire room was tiny,a lot smaller than my bedroom. The bathroom ia also very small and the light is motion sensored so...when you are showering, the light turns off until you step out wet and cold and wave your hand at the sensor that located by the toilet. The room looked pretty clean and the location was great! It was o.k because we only used the room to bathe and sleep but we will probably not be returning.

review.title: Tim
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed the hotel. The lobby staff and concierge were very helpful as it was our first time in the city. The location was great, being a block away from the train car turn-around made getting to Fishermans Wharf easy. The room had a modern look, but an classic hotel feel. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Good location, compact room, nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, only criticism is that you can hear corridor noise under the door and the walls were a little bit thin. If you are a good sleeper this won't be a problem though.

review.title: Nice room, great price and location.
review.reviewText: Small room but very typical for the city. floor sloped therefore bed sloped also which made the bed a little uncomfortable. Nice flat screen TV but it was mounted on the small side wall and was very hard to see from one of the beds. Got a great deal on the room and would stay there again.

review.title: Best location best price
review.reviewText: Best location, best price

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: Would never stay here again.

review.title: Anniversary in Bay City
review.reviewText: I had been to San Francisco multiple times for work, each time staying at a classy, chain hotel. This year I took my wife for our 5yr anniversary and opt'd for a boutique hotel. Having read about dozens of them I chose Hotel Union Square and I was not disappointed. They gave me the room i had requested (street side to watch the trolly cars) without issue. The only complaint I have is the pillows were awefull - nearly non-exisistant. Location was great - two blocks from Union Square, one block from Market street and right on the tolley car route.

review.title: What you buy is not what you get
review.reviewText:
I left the hotel without being able to stay in the room.
I've booked an executive queen bed room and they provided me a room with no windows, no air conditioning, low ceiling, small space and painted all red. there was no wardrobe or other furniture to store my clothes and there was no desk for computer or writing.
I asked for a cancellation and their policy is no refunding. With help from expedia I was able to pay just one night and get the refund from the other nights, but the whole experience was not good.
It is an old building remodeled and with charm, but the description on the expedia files should be more clear about this.
It is probably a good hotel for fun and pleasure, but never for business travelers.

review.title: Ridiculously small rooms.
review.reviewText: The room essentially just fit a queen bed with about 2 feet on each side to spare. The toilet was so narrow that it was almost impossible to use it and a larger person wouldn't fit. Although it was cool outside the room temperature was probably 90 degrees with no way of adjusting it. We wanted to upgrade but weren't able to. We had a miserable stay and won't be coming back here.

review.title: Jon
review.reviewText: Was very disappointed with the hotel. Room was cozy and this was a deluxe queen, after seeing a smaller room was very glad we got the deluxe. The room had a stale smell and given the window opened onto the fire escape and didn't get any natural light i was not surprised. There was no air conditioning and we stayed during a rather warm spell and the ceiling fan didn't quite cut it. The bathroom was tiny and not very good. The hotel is in a good location but would not stay here again.

review.title: Loved the hotel!
review.reviewText: I think this was a great hotel. Really central location. The room was small, but cozy. They had complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. Really a place to sleep and to have your stuff which is great for me & my boyfriend who spent most of our day outside. The concierge and front desk were helpful and the hotel has a really unique and cool design. The thai place next door is phenom. btw! :)

review.title: Great stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Compared to other personality hotels in the Union Square area, our hotel was the best one as far as position and appreance is considered. We were close to everything we needed and any attraction we wanted to see. The cable car stop was right across the street or our on our same sidewalk (Powell St.) and that was fantastic. We were really in the heart of SF. We were also pretty much satisfied with the room, smaller than most hotel rooms in the US but ever so cute and european-style...I really am happy I chose this hotel.

review.title: Wonderful experience
review.reviewText: My daughter and I stayed for 5 days. The room was beautiful, the location was perfect and the staff treated us like family. We will stay here every time we visit San Francisco.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Room allotted on checkin was good for a couple. There was no place within the room for our child. Subsequently we moved to a larger room. Hotel good from location point of view. Rooms very tight in space.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at this hotel a number of times and have never been disappointed. Yes, the rooms can be a bit small, but if you know that in advance it's not a problem. It's a great location, right in the heart of things in Union Square. This does mean the lower floor rooms at the front can be a bit noisy, with cable car bells and noise from people out on the street. However, if you ask for a quiet room they will do their best to accomodate you.

The staff were always very helpful and curteous. The rooms always clean and well kept with great toiletries and a bath in every room we stayed in.

Overall highly recommended, a great hotel in a great location for a great price!

review.title: Good on style, poor on Wi-Fi
review.reviewText:
Decent boutique hotel very close to Union Square. Small buy stylish rooms, old-fashioned bathroom (not very comfortable). All-in-all acceptable. The major problem is the wi-fi: listed as free, it's actually crippled unless you pay to upgrade it, and the signup process for the wi-fi is horrendous. I spent nearly a half hour just trying to figure out what it wanted me to enter.

As a tech-savvy traveller I'll definitely be skipping Hotel Union Square in favor of something with a better net connection. I walked by Hotel Boheme during the trip, and it had open wi-fi that was very fast. Definitely impressed me, they're now top of my list for next time.

If you don't care about the Internet, however, and would rather be close to the start of the cable car line, this hotel will serve you well.

review.title: Pethatic
review.reviewText: the stay was very bad. Rooms were not clean and not anyway close to the pictures; whats nice is just their reception area; rest is scary house.

review.title: Never again, very strange hotel rooms.
review.reviewText: This hotel was quite the experience, at first it seemed okay, but once we got to our room, we turned around and headed back to the check-in counter to see about a different room. There was none, so we stayed in this room. It was nothing like the website described or the photos showed; very good trick photography. The room was very narrow and very claustrophobic, like an eight foot wide hall with a bed on one end and a bathroom on the other end. The AC did not work, it was a window mounted unit and when you set the temp low, it jumped back up to a higher temp. It was extremely stuffy and the energy in there was very strange. We felt trapped, because they lock the cars after 2:00am and you can’t leave until 6:00am. The neighborhood was not safe at night.
