We actually left the building before six to get out and get some fresh air, walked to a Starbucks and waited until after six, went back and checked out. I think in all of my life, I have never been in such a hurry to check out of a hotel, we just could not wait to get out of there. NEVER AGAIN!!!

review.title: Boutique Hotel in a Big City
review.reviewText: One of the greatest things about the hotel is its location; it's right in the middle of the bustling Union Square. The hotel is on the same city block as Macys (w/ Cheesecake Factory) and the actual Union Square park. The trolley passes in front of the hotel, and stops on the corner. Walk one block south and there is the SF Centre Shopping Mall (on Geary St.), which is huge! You can spend an entire day in the mall (w/ movie theater), if you're a shopaholic. There is an abundance of restaurants, bars, shopping nearby. Now, the only slight downside was the hotel rooms. We had to remind ourselves that the hotel is considered a boutique hotel, so it's more about the style vs. the sq. footage. The hallways are narrow and the standard rooms do not boast size, but rather style. (The bed was definitely comfy.) But, how much time will you be spending in the hotel anyways, when you have the entire city to explore?

review.title: brilliant location
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. Great location, only short walk from the train station going to the airport, and near great restaurants, bars and shopping, complimentary internet service. Room very small but all the necessary amenities. Highly recommend

review.title: VERY Cute room!!
review.reviewText: Stayed here with my boyfriend one night while attending a concert at the warfield, perfect locations. Our room (a basic queen) was very small but Ok for a couple, VERY cute and very clean, not as noisy I expected. Very nice clean comfortable bed, LOVED it will definetely be staying again.

review.title: Not For Light Sleepers
review.reviewText:
This hotel is NOT for light sleepers. At least not if you end up with a room facing Powell Street. It's location means it is a constant source of noise, from the trolley cars at 7am, to the same filled with groups of noisy tourists at 10pm through to the not so occasional drunk and homeless people yelling and screaming at midnight and beyond and the loud removal of the rubbish from the activities of all of the above at 4am

I would recommend this hotel otherwise. The room itself was good, and great value.

I'm not sure what a room on the other side of the hotel would be like, I didn't get one. I'd imagine the rooms facing the interior space of the hotel would be much quieter. If you can secure a room that wasn't facing the street, I'd imagine your stay would be a whole different experience.

The location is fantastically central (and hence the source of the noise), being a short walk from the Powell Street BART.

review.title: Great Location - small rooms
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel is decent. It's location is just perfect! Half block of the Muni tram starting point (The Powell) in Union Square neighbourhood and very nice and safe area. The room is very very small, but clean and ofcourse don't expect sound insulation (we could hear clearly the neighbour talking to her friend or her alarm in the morning!). If you need something with super location and just for having somewhere to sleep is perfect. If you need to stay more in the room, choose another hotel.

review.title: Nice boutique hotel in the heart of Union Sqare
review.reviewText:
This was our third stay at this boutique hotel right in the heart of Union Square. The location can be both a plus and a minus. While Union Square is right outside your door, this brings along all of the noise and activity that comes with it. We had a room overlooking Powell Street and between the cable cars running until 12:30 am and people yelling, I had to sleep with earplugs both nights we were there. Also, the Union Square does not have air conditioning, so it's not like you can close the windows and turn the A/C on to drown out outside noise. However, there was a nice ceiling fan over our bed. With earplugs and because the bed was so comfortable, I slept pretty well.

Our room was probably the smallest room we've had in our three trips there and reminded me of hotel rooms in London. The front desk said they'd normally offer an upgrade, but those rooms were all sold out. We had a very comfortable queen bed and a small contemporary dresser. No desk or chair for working, but the hotel offers complimentary wi-fi access. Our bathroom was long, narrow and not well-lit.

The staff at the Union Square are exceptional, from the registration desk to the bellman to housekeeping. However, I thought I might have left something at the hotel and left a message with the director of housekeeping, who never returned my call.

This hotel worked for us 20 years ago, but as we discovered another newer, nicer, quieter hotel a block away for the same price, I would consider that option first.

review.title: A charming and well run boutique hotel in the tourist area
review.reviewText: Room was small but adequate. Clean and everything worked. Bathroom was tiny, not much space to rest toiletries. Service and attitude of personnel was excellent. The decor was charming. Location is excellent, concierge had no problems getting us taxis, and taxis were easy to get when we wanted to flag them down ourselves. Location near public transit is also a plus. Front desk on duty at all hours, we felt safe and well looked after by the staff. Would book them again.

review.title: First timer in SF, and pleased with visit
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. Front desk and concierge were very friendly. The petite queen was very ''cozy'' meaning tiny. I traveled solo, so it didn't bother me. Good enough for a single traveler. The location of the hotel is convenient being that I was one block away from the "bart" transit station. Overal I would go back to that hotel, but not in the Petite room.

review.title: San Francisco centre hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel at Powell Str. in the middle of where it happends.

review.title: So Disappointed
review.reviewText: A personality hotel that had no flowers/plants as all the photos showed, not a single piece of art in the building or rooms. I specifically emailed a request for some form of a birthday welcome as they have shown they have other "fun" packages to be added to a stay. not only did I not receive a single response to my "contact us" email, but when I went downstairs to ask about having wine, balloons, anything decorated for my boyfriends 30th birthday, we simply came back to a room with a bottle of wine and a note made out to ME, not my boyfriend. I thought the hotel to be overpriced and oversold - very disappointed

review.title: Superb hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A suberb hotel, excellent location, clean, welcoming, helpful staff. Perfect.

review.title: Cant Wait To Go Back!
review.reviewText: Me And My Boyfriend Recently Stayed At Hotel Union Square. We Were Completely Satisfied, Prior To The Visit i Read Reviews Complaining Of Small Rooms, However our room was a perfect size and and we loved our oversize bed! the location was perfect! right next to union square and westfeild. a cable car is right on the corner to take you to the wharf, we are defiantly staying here our next time to San Francisco

review.title: comfortable room
review.reviewText: Great location, superb comfortable bed. There was a wine reception between 5-6 but I just missed it, and there was no bar or mini-bar. So you had to have your own water and other drinks. The room itself was very comfy, and the staff were all really friendly and helpful. Some street noise but this is San Francisco. Hotel itself was quiet.

review.title: Great find in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is basic, no restaurants, but does offer coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. Coffee is offered too late as far as I am concerned - should start at 6:00 AM, not 7:00 AM. Room was very nice - bed was wonderful. Bathroom does not have much counter space so bad for storage of makeup, etc. Hotel was well located - near Bart, cable car and restaurants. Room rates were good.

review.title: First time to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was quaint -- old fashioned and personable. The room was great -- the bed comfortable. It was located where we expected -- and we could walk or catch transit to everything we wanted to see or do. Tom at the concierge was awesome. The only negative comment that I have is the street noise. There was no noise from the hallway or the other guestrooms -- but the street noise was unbearable. We were on the fifth floor overlooking Powell Street -- the cable cars clanged until midnight, the partiers filled the streets until 3 am, and the the garbage collectors banged around until 4am. I understand that is the workings of a city -- so I think if the hotel invested in better windows overlooking Powell Street this could be corrected.

review.title: Great location, great service, great price
review.reviewText:
Excellent place to stay - just outside from shopping area, trolleys - clean and safe. Rooms are smaller than chain hotels, but very clean and quiet - and personable/helpful staff - that's the charm of good boutique hotels!

Would go back again!

review.title: I like to watch
review.reviewText: people shopping and my room was right accross the steet from a DSW with lots of windows. Union Square was a block away, Blondies Pizza and Lorie's Diner within stumbling distance. The room was fancy-shmancy with cool lighting and lots of mirrors. My Lady and I will be staying here again for sure.

review.title: Lots of Personality
review.reviewText: The decor was fantastic and gave the hotel a warm but energetic tone. Bed, pillows, and blankets were so comfortable I almost wanted to forego all my plans and stay in bed until checkout time. Parking was convenient enough, though I didn't like how they left my keys in the car with the window down. Also, the hotel is in a great area near lots of interested places.

review.title: Overpriced and cramped
review.reviewText: Although located in an older building, I felt the room was way too small for 2 double beds. I was not able to get two medium suitcases opened and available without being in the walkway. Had I known that the room would be sooooooo small, I would not have paid the money. However the location on the cable car line was convenient.

review.title: Will be back next year or sooner.....
review.reviewText: I like this hotel very much. I stayed here last year. I love that it is close to many things and that you can get on a cable car right outside My only complaint is that the bathroom in the room we chose, was tiny. Minor detail

review.title: Truly a bargain
review.reviewText: This hotel did have "personality". The location was excellent, close to everything or within walking distance. The decor was nice, the rooms clean and a great bargain for the money. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay there again if I ever visit SF.

review.title: Kings suite was very nice.
review.reviewText: Started with a queen room which was very dark, no windows and thin walls. Woke up in the middle of the night to a huge leak in the sprinkler system pouring down onto the red sofa chair. Guest services came right up and sent us to another room which was bigger,brighter,nicer and had huge windows for natural sunlight. We slept very well that night, no more noise from the loud t.v next door in the smaller room. But the next night woke up at 2:00a.m. to a loud fight out front on the main street from some drunk club members. I really liked this room just next time I will ask for one in the back corner with less noise:)

review.title: Hotel Union Square in San rancisco
review.reviewText: The Hotel was in a very nice location, as soon as you walk out, you can see the trolley passing by the street cause the Trolley terminal is just a block away! The staff were very nice and courteous, and are very accommodating to your needs. over all the hotel is a nice place to stay, has nice interior decorations, clean and has LCD Tv's! but the only thing that bothers me about the T.V is their cable! it's ridiculous! and the Bathrooms are HELLA small/TINY!!! especially the sink! and there's no closet for your things! those are the only comments I have, I am still recommending this hotel for people who will only be staying for a day or two.

review.title: Not impressed.
review.reviewText: The photos on the internet do not properly represent the rooms. It took a long time to check in. Elevator was slow and seemed unsafe. Hotel staff gave me a key to a room that was already occupied!. Gave me an upgrade

review.title: Great value in a great location
review.reviewText: Inexpensive hotel in a great location. No room service or on-site dining, though many restaurants and bars close by. Not all rooms have air conditioning. But decor is new, bright and welcoming and the location is hard to beat for the price.

review.title: Definitely would stay again!
review.reviewText: We typically stay at one of the larger chain hotels - and this was a fantastic change for us. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Each morning there was a coffee bar set-up and in the evenings a wine reception - very nice! The rooms are not large - but how much time do you really spend in the room? Located on Powell so the cable car is right there - they also have their own parking lot which is nice.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was very close and convenient access to the transportation (MUNI, cable car, BART). The hotel was clean and neat, the staff was great. They have complimentary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening at the lobby. While it's a cute hotel and I enjoyed my stay there, it's not for everyone. The room is a little smaller comparing to most hotels and after all it is on Powell St where the cable cars go through. Being in the middle of downtown, it's not the most quiet hotel and you hear a lot of street noise. It might be best suited for those who wake up easily with noise.

review.title: Good hotel with crummy rooms
review.reviewText: our room had practically no windows and was really small. other than that, it was pretty good. the staff and location are great, they just need more floorspace and more windows.

review.title: Would stay at this hotel again in a minute
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful. The location was great. My travel companions and myself would stay there again anytime. Great value for the price. Very clean and cutely decorated. The rooms aren't huge but they are big enough- we barely spent anytime in our room anyway. The beds were extremely comfortable- I didn't wake up with that morning after backache that you usually get from a hotel bed. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Nice Digs!
review.reviewText: This hotel reminded me of a NYC studio apartment. Just big enough, but swanky. Everything was new and the style was modern. They had flat screen TVs and a IPOD docking station/alarm clock. We valeted our car and had no problems with doing so. It's small and quiet nestled in between a Thai noodle place and a tourist shop.

review.title: Would definitely return...
review.reviewText: The Queen room was small, but the decor was very nice and it was spotlessly clean. The addition of a mini-fridge would have been nice so we could keep beverages cold. We had a streetside room, overlooking Ellis, but it was not noisy even though we stayed over one Saturday night. The proximity to the cable cars on Powell was awesome.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Forget the car! The Hotel was a short walk from the BART station. Ride the BART from the airport. Buy a MUNI three-day pass go anywhere in the city! We were warmly greeted when we came in a midnight. We had a choice to have a room-overlooking Union Square or stay in the back away from the road. The hallway was interesting! Our room was small but very nice. Restaurants are an easy walk from the Hotel. The cable car stop is right there.

review.title: great little hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything that I expected. Nice, clean, quiet and a very friendly and helpful staff. the rooms are small but verry well appointed. It has great location. It was a tremendous value and I would stay here again.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel and although it was a bit "cozy" it was certainly acceptable especially compared to rooms in Europe. The staff were super friendly and helpful.

review.title: Ideal position.
review.reviewText: A really lovely small hotel very close to Union Square and all the large department stores. A couple of blocks from the BART, buses, trams and cablecar stops so very handy for getting around town. Smallest hotel room in the world but very clean and comfy and well appointed. Would definately stay there again!

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: I thought that the location of the hotel was the best part about it. It was truly in 'the mix' of San Francisco. However, due to a heat wave my first night there, the hotel lost power for four hours. While the staff did their best to make up for the electrical outage, my opinion of the hotel never recovered. Maid services, bed, and cleanliness was great but overshadowed by the small size of the bathroom.

review.title: Luxury Room, Prime Location, Clean
review.reviewText: Hotel Union Square- A Personality Hotel -- took me by surprise. HUS is off rare find and has loads of plus qualities: comfortable bed, clean room, did i say clean, quiet (get court yard facing side), all new bathroom, flatscreen, wifi, and of course 5pm vino in the lobby for guests :-) location is in the heart of all SF action. id def stay there again.

review.title: Great location, tiny room
review.reviewText: The best part of this hotel was the location, steps from the cable-car turnaround, and great shopping and dining. The room was tiny, without a chair or desk or dresser, but the beds were comfy. There was no central air in our 6th floor room, but there was a noisy window unit. Our best bet was to leave a window open to the noisy street below. We would stay here again however - the price was right, the people nice, and the location great.

review.title: Nice little hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Nice affordable hotel with clean and stylish rooms in downtown San Francisco within easy walking distance of a plethora of shops and restaurants. Very close to cable car terminal station and Union square. Hotel staff was very friendly, rooms cosy and clean although bath room could be a little bit spacier. Hotel offers parking facilities at a usual but rather high overnight rate. Nights may get a little noisy (street traffic etc) but earplugs and a firmly closed window proved to be a good cure.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but have everything you need and are renovated. I pod station, love it. You can't beat the location of this hotel. Close to everything within walking distance. Complimentary wine daily from 5 to 7pm that you can take to your room as well. No breakfast facility but everything is close by.

review.title: Not for us...
review.reviewText: We were not impressed with this hotel at all.

review.title: Randomly picked this hotel... ended up being PERFECT
review.reviewText: Location wise: Perfect ( middle of Union Square + right near Bart station ) Staff was EXTREMELY friendly ( let us check in 1-2 hours early and keep our bags at the hotel till we had to leave for our 10:55 p.m. flight ) Modern and Clean / newly renovated hotel. Only down side was the rooms were a little small, but i didn't go to SF to run laps in my hotel room. offered free wine 5-7 pm everyday, and free coffee in the mornings ALL for a GREAT price If I go back, I WILL Definitely go back.

review.title: Charming and cute hotel!
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 days over Valentine's day weekend and it was absolutely perfect! There's a wine reception every night and hot tea/coffee every morning! The hotel staff is beyond helpful, kind and knowledgable. The room we stayed in was cozy, cute and wonderful for a romantic getaway! Free Wi-Fi for the duration of your stay, flat screen tv and down comforters. I highly reccomend it!!

review.title: Yet another raving review for Hotel Union Square!
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 nights. Great Union Square location, clean rooms. Hip, contemporary decor. We stayed on 5th floor overlooking street. The noise did not bother us at all. Actually, it was quite nice to hear the cable cars! Parking rates are great, not over-inflated like other area hotels. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Stay at this hotel!
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff were very accomodating, our room well-appointed, and the location second-to-none. apart from being unable to use the in-room movie service, there were zero issues with this clean, recently renovated and funky little hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself, while recently renovated, maintains its charm and funkiness.

review.title: so cute and cozy
review.reviewText: Went there over valentines weekend, so cute, quaint, romantic and cozy. Everyone was really nice and they have cool little samples of shampoos and conditioners and soaps,the good stuff (name brand) not lame hotel soaps. Every night from 5 to 6 they do wine tasting free of charge and they have a nice coffee bar in the mornings. Next time we go to San Fran we are staying there!

review.title: Hotel Union square is not for the squares
review.reviewText: This hotel was very small and elegant at the same time. It was in the heart of union square and is surrounded by resturantes and the trolly is right out front.

review.title: Fun boutique!
review.reviewText: Fun, funky, and centrally located in Union Square - steps away from trolley, shopping, Bart, and bus.

review.title: Cant wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel!! The Staff was friendly and helpful. The beds where super comfy and I liked the decor of the hotel throughout out. It is conveniently located withing walking distance to BART and shopping.

review.title: I would go back.
review.reviewText: Everything was great but the TV in the room was fuzzy and I was really cold one night where I couldn't get any heat in the room.

review.title: Outstanding Union Square location.
review.reviewText: While traveling on business or pleasure in the SF Union Square area, this hotel is not to be missed. Newly renovated the rooms are very modern and clean. Outstanding staff and a late afternoon wine tasting awaits you.

review.title: Great Hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Nice accommodations and good service. We stayed here before the renovation and the quality and comfort are much improved. IPod dock in the room is a nice touch. Be aware that rooms on the Powell Street side can be a bit noisy. If you need absolute quiet to sleep ask for a different location.

review.title: small room, huge price tag
review.reviewText: I guess when I pay as much as I did for this hotel room, I expect a space bigger than the bedroom in my apartment in Chicago. The hotel was beautifully decorated, and I loved that about this place. But my suggestion is look at the pictures on the site, and take your money elsewhere. There was just enough room to walk around the not-so-comfortable bed, and that's it. The bathroom is nice, and for what ever reason, there was a walk in closet. The lighting fixtures were cool, and there was an ipod doc which was nice, but again, I wish I would have just looked at the pictures and then stayed at a another hotel, where atleast I could have gotten a free breakfast. The staff was ok, nothing spectacular. I wouldn't stay there again, it just wasn't for me... not to mention they charge a lot more to park your car than the garage just around the corner, and I didn't like that either.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, stunning rooms and reasonably priced

review.title: no air conditioning
review.reviewText: The hotel/rom itself was pretty good - the issue I had was that my room got over 85 degrees at night because I was next to some sort of boiler or heater. Most of their rooms do not have AC but because my room obviously had issues, a standalone AC unit was in there...but it didnt work well enough to cool the room down. They gave me a key to another room at 3am so I had somewhere to sleep before I had to get up at 6am, and were very sympathetic, but for the price I paid, I expected a little more comfort.

review.title: It was a very good hotel and if I ever go back I,d use it again
review.reviewText: The hotel was idealy placed only 75 metres from a BART station ($5.35 fare from San Fransisco airport)and bang in middle of shopping Macy,s round corner CABLE CAR at front door and bus,s on Market street one block away Plus free wine at five and TV AND COFFEE machine

review.title: Best of, and worst of really......
review.reviewText: Lovely room - great decor - comfy bed and a nice 32" widescreen TV, lovely bathroom with superb fittings - roof mounted shower and a large corner bath. Very friendly staff and a superb concierge. Great location on Powell a block down from Union Square and on the Cable Car line. Next door to H&M and 100yrds from Macys. Only let down by my room being in the middle of the hotel with no windows and it having a portable air conditioner - being one of the hottest spells San Francisco I was left with 2 choices - either don't sleep due to the heat - or don't sleep due to the portable aircon sounding like the 747 we came in on.

review.title: Refreshingly interesting
review.reviewText: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in SF, from 5 star to 1 star and this might be my new favorite. If you're looking for a quiet, homogenized, rest stop to lint roll a suit for the corporate conference.. this isn't it. If you are looking for a fun, eclectic, and invigorating experience in the city, this place has you covered. Easy parking, and easy access to the subway, buses, and cabs to get anywhere in the city. 2 blocks, from Prada, YSL, Marc Jacobs, etc. Tons of great restaurants, whether looking for indulgent culinary perfection, or greasy midnight pizza by the slice to go with that Cabernet you just opened in your room. This hotel was made for people wanting to experience life.

review.title: Very attentive staff
review.reviewText: My mother in law was ill and the concierge was very concerned and helpful. The hotel was lovely and the location superb.

review.title: Great location, extremely comfortable, would stay again anytime
review.reviewText: We were travelling with 2 teenagers, they loved the location, steps away from fabulous shopping. Powell street cable car stops less than a block away, easy access to all of San Francisco, no car needed. Hotel itself older with a lot of character, rooms beautifully remodeled, some slightly small, but it's an old hotel. Extremely comfortable beds. Rooms to back of hotel quieter than those that faced Powell, but the street noise was part of the ambience. Desk staff helpful with advice and directions.

review.title: Charming and great location
review.reviewText: I would stay here again. It was very different and urban. Easy parking, cable car turnaround 1 block away. Newly decorated, art deco style. Exposed brick. Nice staff. I left my camera in the room after checkout, called from a cable car, they went into the room and located it for me while I stayed on the phone and held it at the front desk.

review.title: Hotel Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, comfortable and great service, but if you want to get any sleep, this is not the place! Besides all of the street noise, the guests above our room would not quiet down and the hotel staff did nothing about it for the four nights that we stayed. I would stay again only if we were on the top floor!

review.title: Disappointed on all levels
review.reviewText: Personality and character - yes...but in 100+ degree heat this is no place to stay. To start we arrived at 11:55 and the parking lot attendant turned out the lights and walked in to the hotel while we were at the gate asking him to help us. Perhaps he did not hear us. We drove around and checked in then had to go back around the block again and wait for him to come back out. The room we were given on the top floor was unbearable. There was also a good deal of noise from the street as well as surrounding rooms. When we called down to the desk to ask what was up with the air-conditioning, we were told they do not have it anywhere in the hotel. Front desk was not accomodating at all. We left that evening and did not stay, nor will we return. I cannot imagine spending a night under these conditions and would not recommend this property.

review.title: excelent hotel
review.reviewText: good deal, excelent location, nice rooms, better service

review.title: Inexpensive alternative in SF, but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel has had a nice facelift but it is very noisy.

review.title: no sleep
review.reviewText: First impressions are not lasting... beautiful little hotel in the middle of a construction zone. Construction began just as we were turning in about 11:oop.m. and finished at 7 am . NOT A WINK OF SLEEP! Checked out went to the Marina next night slept like a baby.

review.title: Very stylish hotel
review.reviewText: Loved it! It has this je ne sais quoi about it because its decor and style give it a very different sense of comfort. I enjoyed my stay at the Union Square Hotel and I highly recommend you give it a try.

review.title: perfect spot in Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel staff very friendly..... Room: very spacious and very clean. Furniture updated. Can't wait to go back......

review.title: Worst overnight stay ever
review.reviewText: The place is very difficult to find in the chaotic traffic as it is a very small opening in the side of the wall, with no highly visible signs. When I first arrived both parking attendants where very rude. The supervisor was on his cellphone talking to someone about non-work related stuff and was of no help also. There was no 32" Flat screen LCD in the room as described, I was told they haven't been installed yet. Construction was going on, as they where renovating and very large banging noises where going on above my room past 10 o'clock at night. Also I was on the main street with street cars ringing their bells and screeching their brakes every 5 minutes. I finally asked to get moved to another room, which took them 60 minutes, when they said it would take 10. It was in the far back of the hotel, so noise no longer became an issue. However the beds where very uncomfortable for me. I had about 2 hours of sleep, mostly interrupted and was a mess at my conference the next day. For the most part the rooms where clean, and the front desk staff was courteous, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I told the speaker at my conference about where I was saying, and he said, "Ouch, Yeah I have stayed there before, it is horrible."

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The hotel was undergoing construction, so this evaluation is a little tainted. However the staff was great, the room was clean and for the value, I would say definitely worth considering.

review.title: Nice Place To Stay
review.reviewText: This was our first stay there and we were pleased. The location is good not far from Union Square, the Bart, good restaurants and shopping. Our room was comfortable & clean. The staff was extremely helpful. One surprise though, no drawers for clothing items; however we didn't mind. We would stay again.

review.title: Great location, good price
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of a renovation which it needs. Rooms are small, but comfortable. The service was great and very friendly. I hope the price does not skyrocket once the renovation is completed. I will stay there again without hesitation.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice cozy room. Great location with a great Tai Restaurant next to it.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Cheap hotel, price not so cheap.

review.title: very cute hotel.
review.reviewText: very cute boutique hotel in the heart of union square. close to lots of shopping. friendly and helpful staff. nice room decor.

review.title: Great Location, Great Value For Money
review.reviewText: Although a small room (as all are in San Francisco) the location and great value for money made this hotel a gem of a find. Ideally placed near the cable car station, shops, bars & restaurants. Staff were really friendly and always helpful and made it a nice place from which to explore this fantastic city.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: The Hotel Union Square was charming. It retains much of it's original character but it has been updated with the comforts of today. It is not extravagantly furnished but it was comfortable and quiet (in the interior rooms). It lacks a work out facility and room service (food), however it does have free wireless internet and quick pleasant service from the front desk staff. It is located two blocks from the Powell Street BART station and is conveniently located near Union Square and the Moscone Convention Center. Particularly for the budget minded, this is a fantastic hotel that will leave you refreshed for business or pleasure.

review.title: Hotel With Character
review.reviewText: Perfect location - we walked to the theater, restaurant, and shopping at Union Square. The hotel is very old so you'd have to be okay with that - but lots of character and a retro feel you can't get at newer, glitzier hotels. Great stay!

review.title: stay here every trip to San Fran
review.reviewText: I'm a repeat customer and stay here every time I'm in San Francisco. Great location re: public transportation (bus, train, trolley) and shopping.

review.title: I'd definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: I just went into the city for a quick shopping trip and only stayed one night, but really liked this hotel. Smaller rooms, but had a lot of artsy character and very quiet and comfortable (I had an inside room, not a window on the street), especially for the great price. The hotel is right on Union Square, couldn't be more convenient. Very nice staff, comfortable stay, great water pressure (surprising considering it's older construction) and a beautiful lobby with wine reception in the evenings. I'll be back!

review.title: I loved it
review.reviewText: I loved the hotel, but some of the staff were a little snobbish. However, the stay was very satisfying and the hotel was in the middle of everything - and you could open the windows. I would recommend this hotel in the future and would stay there again myself.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: They were great. They let us keep our bags behind the desk after we checked out so we wouldn't have to carry them around town while we waited for our train.

review.title: Great Time & Close to Everything
review.reviewText: Hotel Union Square is in the middle of the best shopping district in San Francisco! I loved having the Cable Car stop just down the street and an excellent Thai restaurant right next door. The hotel had everything I needed including a computer in the lobby. The Concierge was very helpful and all the staff I met were friendly. My room was comfortable and the hotel had a European flair that I enjoyed. I will definitely come back here again.

review.title: A fine hotel with some quirks...
review.reviewText: This hotel was a fine place to stay for the money we paid. The only things about the room we weren't happy with were: the pillows were really fat and firm and the shower was so light we joked about having to run around in it just to get wet. As for the pillows...we are picky about our pillows, so that's just a personal preference. Also-we had a room on the side of the street...take ear plugs or else you'll never fall asleep with all the stuff going on down there at all hours. We were serenaded by someone playing a really bad Sax tune til after midnight one night...thanks to my ear plugs...I didn't have to hear it all!!The hotel was quaint with it's old style. The wine reception in the evening was nice to have before hitting the stretts of SF.

review.title: My home away from Home
review.reviewText: The Hotel Union Square is so very convenient for me and my family whenever we travel to San Francisco. It's only a skip, hop, and a jump from the Cable Care turn around and the BART and MUNI stations. Staying here frees you from having to rent a car because all the transportation you need to get anywhere is right there. HOWEVER, it must be a drag staying here in the height of Summer. There is no air conditioning in the rooms. Luckily, the weather in San Francisco keeps it comfortable, but for those who like a colder climate this may be a little uncomfortable. The activities of San Fran will more than compensate that though. It is an older hotel, doesn't offer much as the 5 star hotels do, but its historical significance, as being the first boutique hotel, and being a place where historical incidences occured becons visitors to come and stay with them. I do suggest though if you're here on business, request a room on a higher floor. The bell ringng of the cable cars can be heard especially if your room is facing Powell Street. All in all, it's okay, price is right and you can't go wrong with that.

review.title: Charming hotel on a budget
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great deal if you are on a tight budget. The atmosphere is charming and the employees are very approachable and extremely helpful. Although my room was very small, I did get it for a great price...and it really didn't matter since there is so much to do in San Francisco and I didn't spend much time in my room. I loved the fact that they had free wine in the evenings during the week. It was a great way to start the night. I would recommend this hotel to those who are on a budget but want to stay in a historical hotel in the middle of all the action of Union Square.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The room dind't have a fridge, and later, they let us know that we should requested it (it was the first time that I found that) We asked for a non-smoking room, but even though it was in the non-smoking area, it smelt really horrible to smoke. We were 4 people but everyday the just left a little bottle of body lotion, a little bottle of shampoo and a hand soap.

review.title: OK Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel Union Square is an affordable alternative to the very pricy big name hotels located around San Francisco's Union Square. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable. There was no desk or chair in my room, which is a mark against it, but overall it is a good value.

review.title: Bargain with friendly staff and great location
review.reviewText: I asked for a room facing the interior courtyard. It was just big enough to hold a queen bed but had a walk in closet and a very clean bathroom with a handy storage ledge. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Wireless internet was freely available throughout the hotel and the staff was friendly and helpful. BART (Powell Station) is just around the corner and many bus connections can be made within 2-3 blocks (MUNI, SamTran both run nearby). This hotel also has its own monitored parking lot. A fabulous location, great staff, warm atmosphere, basic services, internet, and great rates! I will be staying here again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: MAy be a lot of character but nothing else. It is so bare bones that my husband wanted to move to a better hotel. But the price is right and the bed was good.

review.title: Decent location for the $
review.reviewText: It was satisfactory and for the price considering room rates in SF, it was decent. Location was pretty good too, only a block or two from Union Square. air coniditioning and heat would've been nice. It was a bit noisy, but honestly, you can't expect too much for a 2.5 star hotel.

review.title: Worst example of hospitality
review.reviewText: The bathroom did not have bath towels, the do not disturb door sign was missing. The following day, I returned to my room in the evening to find that it was not cleaned. The clerk hardly acknowledged my concerns and did nothing to remedy the situation nor did he even attempt to apologize for the lacking amenities. I would not recommend this hotel. The level of service and professionalism in the hospitality of the establishment is the lowest I have experienced in any city anywhere in the world. This was a very disappointing hotel.

review.title: Good location, but...
review.reviewText: The hotel locates near the Union Square and the Cable Car Turnaround. You can walk around the most exciting area in San Francisco, and go sightseeing with buses, metros, cablecars from the stations around the hotel. You can enjoy San Francisco with cheep fee. But the hotel building is old. There is only one elevator. There is no bathtub in the room we stayed. The bed is stiff. The room is too small to set a TV on a desk--actually it is put on a shelf above the door. The steam heater doesn't work very much. I had read a guidebook that says croissants are served at the breakfast, but there is no breakfast--except self-served coffee and tee available in 24 hours. Honestly, I couldn't feel at home; if I had stayed at the hotel more nights--we stayed three nights--, my body would have squeeked and exhausted.
